name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County
review: Tasty wild berry, cranberry and briar notes have good intensity, with dense tannins and pleasant herbal, dill and bell pepper shadings. Drink now through 2012. 3,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Supple, with herb, wild berry and cola tones. Lively structure and cedary oak frame the finish. Drink now through 2007. 1,863 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma County
review: Black cherry and toasty herb aromas mix with modest tart cherry, tomato leaf and cedar flavors. Drink now through 2014. 1,489 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: Soft and modest in scale, with notes of raspberry, cola and herb. Drink now. 1,488 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: This juicy red is loaded with toasty spice, with modest cherry and herb flavors. Drink now. 2,168 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: Lean in structure, with plum and anise aromas and herb and mineral flavors. 2,100 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Howell Mountain Collection
review: Rustic and funky, with herbal aromas and bitter, peaty flavors. 595 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County Writer's Block
review: Straightforward, with firm, juicy berry flavors that mingle nicely with spice, caramel and butterscotch notes, finishing with tight tannins. Drink now through 2008. 500 cases made.

name: Grenache Lake County Writer's Block
review: Rustic, not afraid to be funky, but still somehow appealing for its leathery, earthy notes and spicy plum and coffee aromas and flavors. Shows modest depth. Tannins turn a bit gritty on the finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Syrah Lake County Writer's Block
review: Ripe, with cola, mocha, espresso and spice flavors that deliver fine richness. Round tannins and smoky cedary oak tones linger on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 1,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mendocino County Writer's Block
review: Dense and a bit rustic, with wild berry and slightly leathery aromas, showing good complexity and firm but slightly earthy tannins. Drink now through 2008. 1,000 cases made.

name: Black Muscat California Elysium
review: Floral and berry aromas meld into delicious complexity against a remarkably light, elegant structure. Sweet without being cloying, this is long and distinctive, with violet overtones and ripe boysenberry flavors lending considerable depth.

name: Orange Muscat California Essencia
review: Wonderful aromas and flavors to match, with lots of orange, nectarine, fig and tangerine flavors that are elegant and lively. Drink now through 2004. 8,189 cases made.

name: Port Amador County Starboard Frank's Vineyard
review: Port-like, with fine-grained tannins and a lovely core of pure blueberry and plum that extends into a long, firm, elegant finish. Tempting now, but better in 1999. 590 cases made.

name: Orange Muscat California Essensia
review: A delicious dessert in a glass, bursting with rose petal, litchi, nectarine, honey and orange aromas and flavors. This is a sensory symphony offering elegance as well as intensity. Drink soon. 5,600 cases made.

name: Black Muscat California Elysium
review: Disarmingly ripe and fruity, this sweet wine shows plenty of plum with hints of cinnamon and vanilla, and a touch of mint on the open-textured finish. Ready now. 5,042 cases made.

name: Orange Muscat California Electra
review: A spritzy white, with clean, refreshing orange, nectarine and tangerine flavors, turning elegant and fragrant. A nice change-of-pace wine at an attractive price. Drink now through 2004. 6,508 cases made.

name: Orange Muscat California Electra
review: Light, fizzy and refreshing for its unassuming pear, peach and litchi-fruit flavors. Finish is sweet and balanced. Drink while it's fresh. 4,191 cases made.

name: Orange Muscat California Essensia
review: A jazzy mouthful of spicy honey and dried apricot flavors, this is sweet, not at all delicate, open-textured--appealing for its range of pretty characteristics. Drink soon. 883 cases made.

name: Port Amador County Starboard Frank's Vineyard
review: Spicy, heady aromas and flavors center around cooked plum, chocolate and exotic spices, finishing smooth and rich. A powerful wine that needs until 2002 or 2005 to settle down.

name: Starboard Lot A Amador County
review: Big, ripe and brawny, with sweet plum, spice, hazelnut, tobacco, fig and chocolate flavors that firm up on the finish, where the tannins are quite evident. Well done. Best from 2003 through 2012. 330 cases made.

name: Black Muscat California Elysium
review: Smooth and lightly sweet, displaying plum and litchi notes that dance delicately. Appealing for its unique fruit flavors. 3,130 cases made.

name: Orange Muscat California Essensia
review: Very fragrant, with orange blossom, Muscat-like spice, with creamy scents, highlighted by nutmeg and apple flavors, though it turns a bit raw on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 7,000 cases made.

name: Port Amador County LBV
review: Has a spicy, almost Muscat-like edge to the rich plum and black cherry flavors, which remain balanced and not too sweet through the dusty finish. Approachable now, should keep improving through 2005. 668 cases made.

name: Starboard Amador County
review: Syrupy, with a whiff of Worcestershire sauce that flows with the jammy, prune and blackberry fruit. Finishes with a flash of heat, but overall it's well-balanced given its size. Drink now through 2012. 1,900 cases made.

name: Starboard Batch 88 Amador County
review: Very rich and spicy, a well-crafted, Port-like wine with concentration and character. A brilliant berry flavor extends through the finish, shaded by smoky, spicy overtones. Best from 1998 through 2000. 600 cases made.

name: Black Muscat California Elysium
review: Syrupy, with a jazzy raspberry flavor at the core and a sweet finish that shows a hint of plum. Should be served cold. 2,910 cases made.

name: Black Muscat California Elysium
review: Firm in texture and ebulliently fruity, with terrific blackberry, Muscat and nutmeg aromas and flavors. The alcohol doesn't get in the way. Like a Muscat Port. Drinkable now.

name: Orange Muscat California Electra
review: Sweet and amazingly fresh, with appealing orange-scented pear and litchi aromas and flavors. Disarmingly fresh and juicy on the palate, and low enough in alcohol that it almost tastes like juice. Drink soon. 2,500 cases made.

name: Starboard Batch 88 California
review: A ripe, sweet, expressive style that offers candied cherry, root beer and pruny chocolaty flavors, finishing with a burst of heat and coffee ground flavors. Drink now through 2012. 2,000 cases made.

name: Black Muscat California Elysium
review: An off-beat dessert wine that's dark red in color, with a medley of spice, blackberry and cherry pie scents. Sweet and lively, with a citrus note on the finish. Drink now. 10,100 cases made.

name: Black Muscat California Elysium
review: Despite the light, almost magenta color, this sweet wine has plenty of peach, watermelon and berry aromas and flavors. It could be more concentrated, but it's refreshing. 4,300 cases made.

name: Orange Muscat California Electra
review: Light in texture, softly sparkling, with delicate perfumy apple and fresh corn (!) flavors that are charming. Drink soon, while it's fresh. 4,470 cases made.

name: Starboard Batch 88 California
review: Properly Port-like, with some prominent, ripe black cherry and spice flavors, a gentle grip and a nice touch of spice on the finish. Drink now through 1998. 1,169 cases made.

name: Black Muscat California Elysium
review: Sweet and spicy, with modest cherry and strawberry flavors accented by a twist of lime. Some may find this quite appealing, while others may dismiss it as simple. Drink now. 5,097 cases made.

name: Orange Muscat California Electra
review: Fresh, crisp and spritzy, with tart, sweet orange and floral flavors that are refreshingly lively. Tastes fresher and better than a bottle reviewed earlier.

name: Orange Muscat California Essensia
review: Appealingly sweet, adding a definite citrusy edge to the honey and pear flavors. Drinkable now. 9,407 cases made.

name: Orange Muscat California Electra
review: Light and sweet, exhibiting orange and peach flavors that glide smoothly across the palate. Drink soon while it's fresh. 1,156 cases made.

name: Orange Muscat California Essensia
review: Has a stronger alcohol edge than usual, but the orange and spice aromas and flavors are attractive and stay with you on the finish. Drinkable now.

name: Starboard Batch 88 Madera County
review: Sweet, with a hot edge to the green herb, fig, toffee and coffee flavors. Good. Drink now. 2,229 cases made.

name: Black Muscat California Elysium
review: Incredibly fruity and almost effervescent, with wild, jammy aromas and flavors. Sweet though not rich, with grape, raspberry and plum flavors. An unusual style that isn't for the faint of heart.

name: Black Muscat California Elysium
review: The color of a young Bordeaux and the sweet jammy flavors of plum plus flor al and anise overtone, good acid balance, silkiness and length. An intrigui ng wine, but one glass will do you.

name: Port Amador County Starboard
review: Ripe and sweet, but spirity, showing more alcoholic harshness than is desirable. Still, the cherry and berry flavors are appealing.

name: Port California LBV
review: Light in color, lightly plummy and spicy in flavor, a smooth wine that is ready to drink already. 851 cases made.

name: Orange Muscat California Essensia
review: Fragrant, with orange blossom and spice aromas, but it turns a tad bitter on the palate in an attempt to balance the sweetness, and loses charm. 3,194 cases made.

name: Orange Muscat California Essensia
review: The deep color and rich, creamy texture show off the distinctive orange character in the aromas and flavors. Long, flavorful and a bit sticky. It's lacking the usual finesse associated with this wine.

name: Orange Muscat California Essensia
review: Dark yellow orange in color, with sweet, earthy citrus and burnt orange liqueur flavors that are well off the mark. 10,450 cases made.

name: Orange Muscat California Electra
review: Smells woody, as in plywood, with a spritzy mix of canned pineapple and paint thinner aromas. Very tart and lean on the palate. Hard to get excited about. 16,400 cases made.

name: Port Amador County Frank's Vineyard
review: Spicy and alcoholic, smelling more like grappa than Port, this spirity wine could never be described as smooth, but it has complex chocolate, cherry and spice flavors that linger on the finish. May be worth drinking after 1995. 1,500 cases made.

name: Port Amador County LBV
review: A funky, pruny wine with sweet flavors and tarry, racy, fruitcake and datelike flavors, finishing with a hot aftertaste. 589 cases made.

name: Port California
review: A harsh, bitter edge takes away from the sweet, plummy flavors and overcomes whatever smoothness and elegance it has. Drinkable with strong cheese.

name: Port Amador County Frank's Vineyard
review: Smells like it was fortified with grappa, not brandy. Harsh and hot, a wine that singes-not sings.

name: Viognier Applegate Valley OX Block Mae's Vineyard
review: Polished and expressive, featuring a lovely pool of almond, pear, pineapple and tropical fruit flavors that linger easily on the subtle finish. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Grenache Rogue Valley Bomba
review: Dark and spicy, firm in texture and juicy with blackberry, cassis and spice flavors, extending into a generous, open-weave finish. Drink now through 2017. 120 cases made.

name: GSM Rogue Valley
review: Supple, open-textured and appealing, with guava and rhubarb flavors, finishing with spice and cream notes. Shows presence and refinement. Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2018. 200 cases made.

name: Pistoleta Rogue Valley
review: Fresh, open-textured, polished and appealing, with nectarine, pear, peach and delicately spicy flavors, finishing with intensity. Marsanne, Roussanne and Viognier. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Pistoleta Rogue Valley
review: Polished and lively, this is a deft style that offers floral pear and passion fruit flavors, sliding smoothly into a gentle finish. Viognier, Roussanne and Marsanne. Drink now. 220 cases made.

name: Syrah Rogue Valley 4-2, A
review: On the lighter side, but nicely focused to show lovely plum and berry fruit, balanced against fine acidity and supple tannins. Drink now through 2014. 211 cases made.

name: Viognier Applegate Valley Steelhead Run Vineyard
review: Broad and expressive, brimming with pear, floral and spice flavors on a polished and expansive frame. Lingers well. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Viognier Applegate Valley Steelhead Run Vineyard
review: Sleek and distinctive, with unexpected twists to the melon, lychee, pepper and tangerine flavors, lingering on the lively, tangy finish. Drink now through 2016. 160 cases made.

name: Viognier Applegate Valley Steelhead Run Vineyard
review: Smooth and silky, brimming with spicy peach, apricot and melon flavors, persisting nicely on the polished finish. Drink now. 130 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Applegate Valley
review: Fresh and vibrant, open-textured and appealing, with herb-accented red berry and cherry flavors, assembling into a harmonious finish against the fine tannins. Drink now through 2017. 250 cases made.

name: Pistoleta Rogue Valley
review: Refreshingly juicy, with pear, guava and floral flavors on a taut frame, echoing on the finish. Viognier, Roussanne, Marsanne and Grenache Blanc. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Viognier Applegate Valley Steelhead Run Vineyard
review: Bright and ebullient, bursting with pear, pineapple, Meyer lemon and spice flavors that dance energetically into the finish. Drink now. 220 cases made.

name: Viognier Applegate Valley Steelhead Run Vineyard
review: Smooth and vibrant, with a bracing mineral note rushing through the pear and spice flavors. Not a big wine, but has zip. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Arsenal Applegate Valley
review: Polished and focused, with blackberry and herb flavors jumping through a crisply balanced finish. Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2014 through 2017. 140 cases made.

name: Pistoleta Rogue Valley
review: Open-textured and appealing, with spicy, orange peel-accented pear and floral flavors, finishing dry and expressive. Roussanne, Marsanne, Viognier and Grenache Blanc. Drink now through 2017. 670 cases made.

name: Syrah Applegate Valley Steelhead Run Vineyard
review: Focused and expressive, centering the blackberry and dusky spice flavors on a bed of fine tannins. Finishes with precision and length. Drink now through 2019. 100 cases made.

name: Syrah Rogue Valley 4-2,A
review: Well-built if modest in scale, offering appealing notes of smoky plum, roasted herb and spice. Drink now through 2022. 1,085 cases made.

name: Syrah Rogue Valley 4-2,A
review: Broad and expressive, with earth and tobacco accents to the dark berry and dark plum flavors, finishing with crisp acidity. Best after 2016. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Rogue Valley 4-2,A
review: Lithe, fresh-faced and appealing, with modest blackberry, white chocolate and floral flavors, lingering against modest tannins. Drink now through 2018. 252 cases made.

name: Syrah Rogue Valley 4-2,A
review: Fresh and vibrant, with spicy clove and white pepper nuances wound around a gentle core of blackberry and licorice flavors, picking up coffee and cocoa notes as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2016. 440 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Applegate Valley
review: Dark and spicy, with lots of smoky, meaty character and prickly tannins wound around a supple core of currant fruit. Best after 2014. 220 cases made.

name: GSM Rogue Valley
review: Well-built and a touch gamy, with zesty notes of raspberry, spicy cinnamon and smoky herb. The tannins are slightly gritty for now. Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Best after 2018. 180 cases made.

name: Rosé Rogue Valley
review: Light, off-dry and appealing, with peppery watermelon and pear flavors, finishing with polish. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 450 cases made.

name: Rosé Rogue Valley
review: Colored a bright pink, light and sleek, with a touch of sweetness to balance the tang of lime against a whisper of raspberry. Syrah and Grenache. Drink now. 670 cases made.

name: Syrah Rogue Valley Serenade Vineyard
review: Shows good focus and structure, with smoky beef aromas and medium-bodied raspberry and tobacco flavors. Drink now through 2022. 61 cases made.

name: Viognier Applegate Valley Steelhead Run Vineyard
review: Lighter than most Viogniers, with a paprika accent to the earthy pear and apple flavors. Drink now. 240 cases made.

name: Arsenal Rogue Valley
review: A snappy red, if modest in scale, with blackberry and grilled herb flavors. Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2018. 203 cases made.

name: Grenache Rogue Valley Bomba
review: Fresh and tangy, with juicy mulberry and lime flavors on a trim frame, persisting quietly. Drink now through 2016. 150 cases made.

name: Syrah Applegate Valley Mae's Vineyard
review: Earthy, gamy nuances nudge against the crisp blueberry and blackberry fruit in this taut style. Best after 2016. 150 cases made.

name: GSM Rogue Valley
review: Strong gamy notes weave through the dark plum and blackberry fruit in this full-bodied style. Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 180 cases made.

name: White Riesling Monterey County
review: Light and lively, just off-dry, sporting orange, apple and vanilla flavors. Ready now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Merlot California
review: Tumbles down the path of oak and raspberry flavors, with a drying finish. Drink now. 2,365 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Dilute notes of leafy, tart apples. 7,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A big, rich, chewy wine, packed with concentrated cherry, plum, chocolate, cedar and smoke flavors that are tight and complex. Jams in lots of everything, including oak and tannin. Let this one mellow out until 1997. 2,200 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Thick, rich, soft and luscious, with black cherry, herb and chocolate flavors, fine tannins and a plummy aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A rich, smooth, seductive wine, with pretty, toasty, oaky, ripe currant, cherry, tobacco and anise flavors that are broad and complex before the firm tannins clamp down. Fine structure; long on the finish. Best to cellar until 1993 or '94.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Concentrated, with intense flavors of black currant, black cherry, herb, chocolate and integrated toasted oak. Tannins are ripe and firm, lingering through the finish. Drink now through 2009. 700 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Rich, smooth, flavorful and well balanced. Ripe, almost sweetin flavor, with intense pear, honey and apple notes, a dense, chewy texture and a long finish.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A big, rich, dramatic wine loaded with layers of ripe, concentrated plum, currant and spicy oak flavors that are very intense and lively. Has the stuffing and tannin for long-term cellaring. Drink 1994.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Smooth, ripe and generous, with appealing pear, citrus, cream and herb flavors that are rich and concentrated, finishing with a sense of elegance and grace. Picks up a hint of butterscotch and oak on the aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Ripe and fruity, with a nice core of plum, cherry, cedar and spice flavors. Moderately rich and complex, finishing with a pleasant blend of fruit and oak. Tasty now, but can hold. Drink now through 1996. 400 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Wild and exotic, bursting with jammy berry and plum aromas and flavors, turning tight and tart without diminishing the fruitiness. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Rutherford
review: Fairly lean, this sports a dominant mineral edge that works well with the intertwining grapefruit, herb, grass and lemon notes. Refreshing. Drink now through 2001. 2,140 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Ripe and interesting for its strongly herbal flavors backed by round berry and currant. Needs until 1999 to 2000 to soften the finish. 5,651 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Medium-bodied and modestly fruity with hints of anise and currant. Can stand short-term cellaring to soften, but it lacks the depth and richness for greatness.

name: Merlot California
review: Fairly lean, with smoke, licorice, blackberry and cedar flavors bringing up the finish. Tannins are firm yet ripe. Best from 1999 through 2004. 8,684 cases made.

name: Merlot California
review: Tart and crisp, offering pleasant, straightforward berry and tangy citruslike flavors. Ready to drink. 2,532 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Here's a nicely crafted Sauvignon Blanc at a reasonable price. It's firm and well balanced, bright and grassy, with hints of sweet pea and melon, and a touch of toast on the finish. 2,025 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Soft, floral and fruity, a generous wine with a profile that includes pear, honey and oak.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Rutherford Reserve
review: Pretty bright, with grapefruit and lemon flavors at the fore. A little weak on the midpalate, it rises to the occasion on the finish, with a clean, mineral edge. Drink now. 398 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Dry and tannic, with herb, sage and dill notes and a narrow band of currant and spice flavors, turning leathery and even drier on the finish. 2,068 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Strives for complexity, with its blend of fruit and oak, but the toasty pear and spice flavors turn austere and tight. The finish is complex and spicy from oak. Drinks well now.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Light, smooth and pleasantly full on the palate, with herb-scented plum and cherry flavors rounding nicely toward spice and vanilla on the finish. Not a powerful wine but smooth and appealing. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Fragrant, with jalapeño pepper and lime notes and a refreshing acidity. Drink now. 2,378 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Fresh, simple and appealing, with peachy apple flavors. 2,846 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Tough in texture, with tannic currant and berry flavors hovering around the finish waiting to break through. Try it in 1997. 4,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Tough and tannic, with tobacco- and herb-tinged cherry flavors, masked by a wall of tannin, closed and bitter. With cellaring until 1995, it could smooth out.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley V. & L. Eisele Vineyard Reserve
review: A touch earthy and leathery, with a narrow band of mature currant and anise flavors. Lacks depth and richness. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Volker Eisele Vineyard Reserve
review: Tannic and marked by a green streak, this is a hard-edged and unyielding wine that lacks focus and harmony, and comes up short on fruit, too. 474 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Crisp and intense, offering cherry and berry flavor, firmly tannic finish and an earthy edge. Can stand short-term cellaring into 1997 to soften. 7,200 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Menthol and tobacco overtones make this distinctive, but it finishes with an austere bite. Drinkable now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley Reserve
review: Fairly light and clean, it's bright and refreshing, with a lemony finish. Lacks complexity, however. 928 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Hard, lemony, citric and tart, very lean. If you like steely Chablis, try this one. Needs to develop some layers of complexity. Start drinking 1989.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A simple style that is light and fruity, with plum and cherry notes and a hint of oak. Has more tannins than you might expect, but best to drink now, while the fruit is fresh.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Spicy berry notes have a distinctive herbal side to them, with charry oak notes. Drink now.

name: Merlot North Coast
review: Modest cherry, spice and herbal flavors. Drink now. 7,320 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Light and fruity, with a distinct herbal cast to the modest, toasty flavors. 3,633 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Toasty, butterscotch notes are heavy-handed, with orange sherbet fruit flavors.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Simple and fruity, with pleasant pineapple and citrus notes, but it's nothing special.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Perfumy, floral flavors never resolve into anything attractive or smooth, making this a funky white without much charm. 3,009 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Chehalem Mountains Tiaraella Reserve
review: A lithe, seductive style, appealing for its creamy texture and delicately caramel-scented blueberry and plum flavors, which this delivers in a refined style that keeps it all beautifully modulated. Drink now through 2016. 377 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Chehalem Mountains Alexiss Reserve
review: Smooth and round, with just the merest prickle of tannin to support the generous mulberry, blackberry, floral and spice flavors, hovering beautifully above the fray as the finish persists expressively. Best from 2012 through 2018. 284 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Caletino Reserve
review: Velvety, with a gentle mouthful of ripe blackberry and plum flavors that linger beautifully, wrapped in a fuzzy blanket of fine tannins. Drink now through 2014. 305 cases made.

name: Riesling Okanagan Valley Ice Wine
review: Unctuous and bursting with honey, cinnamon, apricot and citrus, all displayed on a vibrant structure that finishes lean and refreshing. Just a hint cloying on the finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Okanagan Valley Family Reserve
review: An intense, full-throttle Chardonnay, with smoke, fig and hazelnut scents. Densely textured and flavored, offering apple, spice and butter notes on a lean framework, it's ambitious, but the fruit ends up overshadowed by the oak. Not quite as good as originally reviewed. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling British Columbia Ice Wine
review: Vivid and fresh, this shows well-defined Riesling peach and floral flavors. It's rich but not heavy, subtle—even delicate—with a nice balance of moderate sweetness and acidity. 104 cases made.

name: Riesling Okanagan Valley Dry Limited Release
review: Elegant and well defined, this fresh, pure Riesling glides across the palate, with apple, peach and honey notes that linger. Well done. Drink now. 1,660 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Okanagan Valley Family Reserve
review: Over the top, this mélange of clove, nutmeg, vanilla and butterscotch is too heavy and candied for this palate, despite lively acidity underneath. May appeal to fans of new oak. Drink now. 233 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Okanagan Valley
review: Smoky cherry and spice notes pick up hints of herbs and char in this light red, which shows medium intensity and a lingering finish. Drink now. 1,013 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Okanagan Valley
review: Round and buttery, with underlying lemon and apple flavors accented by clove and vanilla. Finishes slightly bitter. Drink now. 571 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Okanagan Valley
review: Green olive and peach notes mark this off-dry white. It firms up on the finish, with a saline aftertaste. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Chenin Blanc Okanagan Valley Limited Release
review: Fresh, floral and peachy, this off-dry white delivers soft fruitiness on an easygoing structure. A good quaffer. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Foch Okanagan Valley Old Vines
review: Mature and distinctive for its smoke, plum and tobacco aromas and flavors, with a thick texture and a smoky, diesel aftertaste. A touch coarse on the finish. Drink now. 450 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Okanagan Valley Family Reserve
review: Smoky, spicy oak makes this a pleasant red, yet a touch more fruit underneath would improve the balance. Light, smooth and moderate in length. Drink now. 290 cases made.

name: Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon Okanagan Valley
review: The sawdust notes from the oak don't quite mesh with the focused core of cherry in this slim, dense red. Not bad, though. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Okanagan Valley Family Reserve
review: Kicks off with rich plum, cherry and earth aromas, but on the palate it shows bright acidity, herbal aspects and a certain lean edge. Finishes a bit tart. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Suave, with plush flavors of dark plum, olive and chocolate that are deep and rich. Medium-grained tannins and fresh acidity knit it all together. The long, intense finish features mocha and cream. Drink now through 2014. 883 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Elegant, supple and full-bodied red, with loads of chocolate, dark plum, cassis and mocha flavors. There's a lovely creaminess to this as well, which lengthens on the vanilla-filled finish. Drink now through 2008. 1,080 cases made.

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: A succulent red, with notes of underbrush and dried herb to the bright cherry, dried berry and red currant flavors. Hints of graphite and paprika show on the chewy finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,134 cases made.

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: Redolent of freshly crushed red fruit flavors, with plenty of vanilla and chocolate overtones. Well-focused, minerally finish features notes of raspberry and cream. Drink now through 2013. 100 cases imported.

name: Douro Terra a Terra Reserva
review: Cherry and crushed red plum flavors fill this to the brim, along with notes of sandalwood and savory herb. The fresh, crunchy and mineral-filled finish has luscious dark chocolate accents. Drink now through 2019. 1,100 cases made.

name: Douro Terra a Terra Reserva White
review: Very racy and crisp, with intense minerality to the flavors of fresh-cut green apple and lemon tart. Aromatic midpalate, featuring notes of tarragon on the firm and well-sculpted finish. Drink now through 2020. 600 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: Fruity, powerful and pure-tasting, with fresh-cut apple, mineral and citrus flavors that cruise into the long, minerally finish. Offers excellent balance and focus, with the stuffing to age. Drink now through 2013. 275 cases made.

name: Douro White Grande Reserva
review: A suave, refined and rich-tasting white, with floral accents to the lush, cream-filled flavors of apple tart, baked peach and ripe melon. Concentrated spice notes are powered by fresh acidity. Drink now through 2022. 160 cases made.

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: Fruity, with a dense core of dark currant, black olive and cherry tart flavors that are supported by firm tannins. Savory accents envelop the finish of slate and hints of smoke.  Drink now through 2020. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro Grande Reserva White
review: Plush and creamy, with pear tart and apple compote flavors, featuring notes of cardamom and vanilla. A hint of mint and anise extend on the rich and finely textured finish, revealing some floral hints. Drink now through 2015. 100 cases imported.

name: Douro Terra a Terra Reserva
review: This has plenty of bright acidity behind the red cherry and wild plum flavors, which feature notes of green olive and hot stone. Juicy finish.  Drink now through 2018. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro Terra a Terra Reserva
review: A powerful red from Portugal, with rich, ripe flavors of dark plum, cocoa powder and raspeberry. Very creamy on the finish, with a lush note of milk chocolate. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca, Touriga Nacional and Tinta Barroca. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro White Terra a Terra Reserva
review: A refined white, with apple tart and dried mango flavors, supported by loads of fresh acidity. Delivers mouthfilling creaminess, featuring a finish that lingers with dried mint and savory spice details. Drink now through 2018. 694 cases made.

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: Grilled herb, dried blackberry and spice flavors are streamlined and focused in this full-bodied red, with earth, tea and mineral notes rounding out the firm finish. Drink now through 2019.

name: Douro Grande Reserva White
review: Fruity and rich-tasting, with a surplus of berry and white fruit flavors that are fringed by melon and tropical fruit notes. Spicy on the rich finish.  Drink now through 2018. 250 cases made.

name: Douro Pouca Terra
review: This plump, full-bodied red sports ripe blueberry compote and raspberry flavors, with hints of licorice and spice on the clean, floral-tinged finish. Drink now. `200 cases made.

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: A taut red, with dried red berry and currant flavors accented by minerally notes. Dried mushroom and hummus hints show on the finish. Drink now. 175 cases imported.

name: Douro Terra a Terra Reserva
review: Medium-bodied, with red berry and plum flavors that tail off nicely into the rich, smoky finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro Terra a Terra Reserva White
review: Shows good cut to the green peach, apple and lime zest flavors, featuring notes of mineral and juniper berry. Hints of lemongrass appear on the finish. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Port Reserve
review: Bottled in 1987. Beautiful amber yellow color and toasty walnut aromas, lots of caramel, but ter, honey, vanilla and nutmeg flavors of great depth and intensity. Finish is long and intense yet vivid and delicious.

name: Vintage Port
review: Loads of currants, with hints of dried flowers in this young Vintage Port. Full-bodied, medium sweet, with fine tannins and a lovely fruity finish. Serious effort here. Best after 2010. 4,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Dark berry, blueberry and licorice aromas follow through to a full-bodied, medium-sweet palate, with soft, silky tannins and a clean finish. Not a big or powerful young Vintage Port, but polished and pretty. Best after 2015. 1,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Prune and coffee aromas. Even aniseed. Subtle. Full-bodied, medium-sweet and very rich. Soft and velvety. Long and balanced. Turns a little chewy. Will improve for many years, but it's ready. '77/'85/'97 blind Port retrospective. Drink now.

name: Vintage Port
review: Aromas of plums and black pepper follow through to a full-bodied palate, with fine tannins and a medium finish. Medium sweet. Best after 2010. 1,400 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: More elegance, power and class than the '85. Deep purple, with enchanting crème de framboise aromas, full-bodied, with an abundance of tannins and concentrated fruit flavors, slightly hard but with a very good, long finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: A complete wine with a bounty of fruit and tannins to give it great longevity. Red with a ruby center, intense black cherry and leather aromas, medium-bodied and full of tannins, with velvety, sweet fruit flavors and a long finish. Very good backbone.

name: Vintage Port
review: A young Port with lots of roasted fruit and tobacco character, medium body and firm tannins. Lightly sweet. Slightly better than when tasted from barrel. Best after 2003. 3,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Medium ruby-garnet. Aromas of fresh cherry and hints of custard pie. Medium-bodied and medium sweet. It shows some alcohol and nutty character. At its peak. '77/'85/'97 blind Port retrospective. Drink now.

name: Vintage Port
review: Firm and well made, with a sufficient structure of fruit and tannin for long-term aging. Medium to deep ruby, light tomato and boysenberry nose, medium- to full-bodied, with medium tannins, spicy, peppery fruit flavors and a lingering finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: This is a sweet, velvety wine that beckons you to drink it. Deep red with a garnet edge, light coffee and berry nose, medium-bodied, with plenty of tannins, but the velvety, ripe fruit flavors soften the wine.

name: Vintage Port
review: Another well-crafted, firm wine. Medium ruby-red, with focused aromas of violets and perfume, medium-bodied, medium tannins and racy, lean fruit flavors.

name: Vintage Port
review: Not holding together very well. Decent fruit but starting to fade. Medium red with a garnet hue, slightly volatile chocolate and spice aromas, medium-bodied, with light tannins and rather hot, spicy fruit flavors on the finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: Both bottles of this wine that I have tasted were poorly corked. One bottle was vinegar and the other was slightly tired. Medium brick red with a garnet edge, a nose of cherries and blackberries, light-bodied, with peppery, medium sweet fruit flavors, light tannins and a short finish. The alcohol is showing on the finish.

name: Ruby Port Club
review: Light in color, amber, very woody, but not as smooth or silky as a tawny wo uld be. Flavors lean toward the spicy-woody end of the spectrum, with littl e hint of fruit. On the dry side.

name: Vidal Blanc Lake Erie Ohio
review: Dilute, with faint lemon, lime and onion notes.

name: Merlot Washington
review: Velvety and ripe, a supple wine with simple black cherry fruit and cedary overtones. Drinkable now, but better around 1991.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Distinctly herbal, lean and tannic, ripe but not as concentrated as it could be.

name: McLaren Vale
review: Smooth and polished, tightly packed with berry and pomegranate fruit shaded with shots of herb and mocha. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Shiraz and Grenache. Drink now through 2012. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Reserve
review: Smooth and generous. A bit chewy and hot, but supple underneath, with pretty red cherry and blackberry flavors on a polished frame. Drink now through 2005. 400 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Bright and flavorful, with firm texture and sharply focused blackberry and dark plum fruit, shaded with hints of pepper and anise. Solid finish. Best after 2002. 850 cases made.

name: Brut Central Otago
review: Vibrant, crisp green apple, pear and peach flavors are accented by notes of lemon zest, toasted biscuit, honeycomb and dried white flowers. Finishes with a refreshing jolt of acidity. Drink now. 5,500 cases made.

name: Brut Central Otago Methode Traditionnelle
review: Precise, offering crisp, fresh apple, strawberry and lime sherbet flavors, with floral highlights, a hint of brine and a long, crisp finish. Balances intensity with elegance. Drink now. 5,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Firm and very intense, with muscularity to ripe black cherry, pomegranate and spice box notes. Crushed stone flavors underscore the concentrated fruit, with cedary oak and cut tannins honing the persistent finish. Drink now through 2011. 2,000 cases made.

name: Rosé Central Otago
review: The dried raspberry, lemon curd and Asian pear flavors are crisp and detailed, with notes of white flowers, five-spice powder and toast leading to a long, lingering, juicy finish. Offers an appealing mix of power and finesse. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Brut Central Otago Methode Traditionnelle
review: Shows impressive clarity, with crisp lemon, grapefruit and lime zest flavors that are fresh and vibrant. Hints of lemon verbena and pickled ginger linger on the finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Brut Central Otago Methode Traditionnelle
review: Toast and quince notes are elegant and refined, with a delicacy to the details of dried flowers, saline, yellow apple and Meyer lemon on the finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Methode Traditionnelle Central Otago
review: A complex mix of apple, pear and melon flavors,  with nutmeg, honey and lime accents. Elegant and airy, this is spicy on the finish. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Bendigo Estate
review: Dense, espresso-laced black cherry flavors have a gutsy intensity, with black walnut and sandalwood notes and a whiff of smoke on the finish, where the tannins firm up and the flavors linger. Drink now through 2026. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Single Vineyard
review: Perfumed, with dried violet and peppery accents to the tangy strawberry and raspberry flavors. The tannins have some density to complement the savory details of loam and black tea on the finish. Drink now through 2027. 4,000 cases made.

name: Brut Central Otago-Marlborough Chauvet
review: Light, airy and creamy flavor and texture, with pretty quince, lime and spice notes that last on the round finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: New Zealand Central Otago Methode Traditionnelle
review: Toast, spice, honey and dried floral notes add a rich level to the core of zingy green apple and lemon zest flavors, finishing crisp. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Central Otago Bendigo Single Vineyard
review: Fresh apple, melon and peach flavors are spicy and complex, offering almond skin and a supple texture. Finishes juicy. Drink now. 910 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Ripe and fleshy, with wild raspberry, cherry, cranberry and cola flavors that are complex and spicy, accented by red licorice and tobacco leaf details, finishing firm. Drink now through 2025. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Bendigo Estate
review: Bright and lively, this is generous with its mint-inflected raspberry, earth and spice flavors, lingering easily on the refined finish. Drink now through 2015. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Bendigo Single Vineyard
review: A mix of toast, spice and herb flavors give this wine an aromatic profile, with clove and rosemary accents to the firm core of plum and black cherry. Finishes with black tea accents. Drink now through 2030. 2,400 cases made.

name: Rosé Central Otago Methode Traditionnelle
review: The wild strawberry, cranberry and yeasty cinnamon toast notes are focused and elegant, with a touch of rhubarb pie on the refreshing finish, complemented by a gentle fizz. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Central Otago Bendigo Single Vineyard
review: Apple, pear and melon flavors are sleek, finishing with an appealing crunch of acidity. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Ripe, with silky depth to the cherry pie, wild berry, dried herb and spice flavors. Violet, sandalwood and slate nuances add intrigue, with lithe tannins, cedar and lingering lemon thyme tones. Drink now through 2011. 1,400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Ripe and open-textured, generous with its cherry and bittersweet chocolate flavors, lingering nicely on the fine-grained finish. Best from 2006 through 2010. 1,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Bendigo
review: Pretty floral aromatics are distinctive, with dried lavender notes that play well with the velvety plum and raspberry flavors. Black tea and kirsch flavors crescendo on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 2,750 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Bendigo
review: Focused and charming, with cherry and raspberry flavors at the core, persisting nicely on the lively finish. Drink now through 2014. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Bendigo Estate
review: Blackberry, sage and black licorice notes have a firm, earthy side and a firm texture. Pepper and cedar accents linger on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 130 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Bendigo Estate
review: The firm, dusty tannins lend good structure to the cranberry and pomegranate flavors. Juicy and round, with spice and tobacco details on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 118 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Bendigo Single Vineyard
review: Fresh green notes of tomato leaf and sage mingle with talc, pepper and cedar details. Cherry and plum flavors linger, with fleshy tannins. Drink now through 2026. 2,000 cases made.

name: Rosé Central Otago
review: Crisp, offering lime and strawberry flavors that are transparent and vibrant, with fresh thyme notes and a whiff of toast on the finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Methode Traditionnelle Bendigo Central Otago
review: Yeasty, spicy notes of strawberry, citrus and apple have a terrific nutty quality and nice depth, especially on the finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Deep in color, with bright wild berry and floral aromas and flavors, finishing with a slightly metallic tang. Drink now through 2005. 1,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: A crisp texture, and appealing for its raspberry and strawberry fruit, lingering nicely as the finish darkens. Drink now through 2004. 900 cases made.

name: Brut Central Otago Chauvet
review: A zippy style, with tangy green apple and mineral flavors that are appealing if low key. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Central Otago
review: Bright and tangy, appealing for its bracing acidity and pretty fruit character. Drink now. 510 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Loam and talc notes frame the trim wild berry and cherry flavors, with cedar and spice details and dusty tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 2,300 cases made.

name: Methode Traditionnelle Bendigo Central Otago
review: Baked apple, spicy clove and nutmeg notes have a strong yeasty note, with nutty flavors and a slightly coarse texture. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Central Otago
review: Bright and crisp, with tangy citrus acidity and green peach flavors. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Bendigo
review: Overly gripping, tart, earthy and mineralissimo.   2,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County
review: Round, with ripe black currant, spicy cherry, raspberry and plum tones, underscored by generous toasty oak and modest tannin through the lively, focused finish. Drink now through 2005. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
review: Light and appealing, with sour cherry, spicy nuances and a cola edge. Drink now. 2,432 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County
review: Barely ripe, with a mild green streak to the plum and berry flavors. Lean and trim, it could use a little more stuffing; finishes with firm tannins. Available in restaurants only. 850 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma County
review: Delivers a range of enjoyable mineral, plum and anise notes. Finishes slightly short. Drink now through 2002. 2,245 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley
review: Light but refreshing, with juicy lemon-lime notes accented with rosemary nuances. Drink now. 1,615 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma County
review: Nice touches of spice, smoke, plums and cinnamon lead the way in this wine. The herbal core is followed by a hint of bitterness, however. Drink now. 950 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Brawny notes of berries and oak clamp down and refuse to let go. Drink now. 2,234 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma County
review: Light smoke and beef notes announce this wine. On the palate, an herbal core dominates, finishing with hints of cherry and spice. Drink now. 1,400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma County
review: Somewhat tight and a bit smoky, this won't offend--or inspire, either. Lean, with hints of anise and black currant, some bitterness on the finish. 1,200 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma County
review: Black cherry flavors turn weedy and metallic. 3,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A smooth red, with a vibrant structure underscoring cherry, iron, tobacco and raw beef aromas and flavors. Elegant, pinching in on the finish. Best from 2014 through 2023. 500 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Shiso and wasabi pea accents add interest to this cherry-flavored red. Persistent and balanced in a chewy, rustic style. Fine length. Best from 2013 through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet South Eastern Australia
review: A spicy style, folding some earthy notes into the mix of berry and anise flavors, lean and smooth. Should benefit from cellaring until 1999. 55 percent Shiraz, 45 percent Cabernet Sauvignon. 2,400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Fresh and fragrant, a nice package of pear, spice and slightly resinous flavors, balanced and appealing. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Spaetlese Lexia South Eastern Australia
review: Light, sweet and aromatic, with honey, pear and floral flavors competing for attention, folding together harmoniously on the finish. Made from Muscat Gordo Blanco. Drink now through 2004. 350 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Light and lively, refreshing for its pretty apple and floral aromas and flavors. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet South Eastern Australia
review: Light, fruity and easy to drink, adding a streak of gamy Shiraz character to increase the depth. Ready now. 3,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Light and bright, with pretty green apple and spice flavors. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir South Australia
review: Very light in color and flavor, but the plum and spice flavors are nice. Finishes with a touch of bitterness. Ready to drink.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet South Eastern Australia
review: Ripe in flavor, crisp in texture, a tightly wound wine that should be at its best from 1997. 60,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Soft, almost sweet, with a fruity character that emphasizes peach and pear notes. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Fresh and light, showing pleasant appley and grassy flavors. 7,600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Fresh and fruity, flavors similar to fruit cocktail, light and refreshing. Ready now. 150,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet South Eastern Australia
review: Crisp and fruity, a lively wine with a narrow band of berry and herb flavors. Drinkable now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc South Eastern Australia
review: Soft and simple, with hints of earth and herb around the edges. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County
review: Sour cherry, herb, citrus peel and strawberry notes are pleasant and straightforward. Drink now. 3,358 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Bracing in texture, with fine tannins and lively acidity to support bright, focused blackberry, cherry and subtle earth flavors, with savory overtones of sage and other dried herbs. Has balance and refinement. Best from 2010 through 2014. 256 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Columbia Valley
review: Smooth and bracing, balancing its mocha-accented cherry and raspberry fruit against lively acidity and a touch of heat, lingering on the juicy finish. Drink now through 2012. 312 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Offers dried cherry and flowers on the nose and palate. Medium-bodied, with firm and woody tannins that follow through to berry and vanilla flavors. A little tough, should soften with bottle age. This is a new winery. Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2011. 540 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Herbal and spicy, displaying fruity, peppery flavors. It's full bodied and concentrated, with loads of tannins and a fruity finish. Still aggressive and needs time to come around. Best after 1998.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Interesting plum, prune and leather aromas follow through to a medium-bodied palate, with a lot of wood and a medium finish. Slightly austere. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Berry and cedar aromas and flavors. Light, tangy palate. Crisp finish. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: A delicate, aromatic wine, with dried cherry and honey aromas and flavors, medium body and a light finish.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Ripe but crisp with an interesting combination of black cherry, currant and tobacco flavors. Yet very hard and tannic, showing a funky chestnut character on the finish. Drink now.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A bit rustic and clumsy, with very ripe—almost raisiny—fruit, full body and round tannins. Not going anywhere.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Slightly stemmy, herbal character, with hints of tomatoes. Medium body. Light tannins. Short, woody finish. Disjointed. 1,200 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Slightly tired chestnut, berry and tomato character. Medium-bodied and round, adding an herbal chocolate finish. Drink now.

name: Merlot Toscana Podalirio
review: Dark in color, with amazing aromas of crushed berry, violet and raspberry. Turns to mineral and fresh spices. Full-bodied, with ultrafine tannins and a long, caressing finish. Complex, rich and refined. An amazing wine from this producer. Best after 2010. 300 cases made.

name: Toscana Podalirio
review: This is nicely oaky, yet has the fruit to match, with black cherry, blackberry, vanilla, toast and mineral flavors permeating the smooth texture. Firm, refined tannins follow through as the aftertaste evokes iron and tar. Best from 2015 through 2028. 500 cases made.

name: Merlot Toscana Podalirio
review: This is complex, exhibiting black cherry, black currant, violet and spice aromas and flavors. Both exuberant and restrained, with a long aftertaste of black cherry, cedar and mineral. Best from 2014 through 2024. 350 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Belvedere Riserva
review: Rich and dense, but marked by toasty oak, offering spice and resin accents to the cherry and plum flavors. This is on the rustic side, with fine intensity and length. Drink now through 2022. 900 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico L'Aura
review: Mineral and blackberry aromas follow through to a full body, with velvety tannins and a dark chocolate, coffee bean and cigar box aftertaste. Drink now. 2,100 cases made.

name: Merlot Toscana Podalirio
review: Wonderfully opulent aromas of crushed blueberries and violets follow through to a full-bodied palate, with very silky tannins and bright acidity. The brilliant nose earns this wine an outstanding rating. Best after 2010. 350 cases made.

name: Toscana Podalirio
review: Balanced and vibrant, with black cherry, black currant, spice and tobacco aromas and flavors. This has drive and builds to an excellent aftertaste of mineral and tea. Merlot. Drink now through 2020. 830 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico L'Aura
review: This red shows black cherry, earth, tar and bitter almond flavors, backed by a firm structure. The dusty tannins leave a tactile sensation on the long finish. Drink now through 2020. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Sei Gran Selezione
review: Vanilla and toast aromas lead off, with cherry, leather and tobacco flavors underneath. Stays firm and slightly austere, yet balanced, on the lingering aftertaste. Best from 2018 through 2024. 625 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Sei Gran Selezione
review: Pure and intense, offering black cherry, raspberry, tar and mineral aromas and flavors, this tightens up but remains fresh, and the flavors stretch out on the mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2022. 625 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Vigneto Belvedere Riserva
review: Dried, dark fruits and toasty oak lead to a full body, in this balanced red, with silky tannins. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico L'Aura
review: Cherry flavors combine with leather, tobacco and resin notes in this beefy red. Balanced toward the dry, dusty tannins, but there's nothing here a good piece of beef or a long-simmered meat ragù can't handle. Drink now through 2020. 2,900 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico L'Aura
review: This solid red offers berry and chocolate aromas and flavors. A little chewy, but juicy and fruity. Drink now. 2,165 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico L'Aura
review: Interesting nose, with refined aromas of ripe plum, berries and hints of oak and mineral. Medium- to full-bodied, with fine tannins coated with freshly picked blackberry and a pronounced spicy oak note that draws out the finish. Nice now, but needs a bit more harmony. Big improvement here, with winemaker Gioia Cresti. Best after 2009. 2,200 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Vigneto Belvedere Riserva
review: A powerful and polished red, displaying black currant, black cherry, spice and tobacco flavors. A good dose of tannins draws attention to the finish. Best from 2013 through 2018. 600 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Vigneto Belvedere Riserva
review: Smoke, toast, green olive and clove aromas and flavors meet cherry and iron in this international style. It's a bit oaky, but tight and long. Best from 2012 through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Vigneto Belvedere Riserva
review: Dark-colored, with blackberry, blueberry and mineral. Full-bodied, with chewy, ripe tannins and a medium finish. Best after 2010. 480 cases made.

name: Merlot Toscana Podalirio
review: This very ripe red displays dark plum, black cherry and spicy oak flavors. This is soft, with dense tannins that are mouthcoating in the end. Best from 2012 through 2016. 420 cases made.

name: Merlot Toscana Podalirio
review: Beautiful aromas of blackberries and coffee, with a full body, round tannins and a long, toasted oak aftertaste. Best after 2007. 625 cases made.

name: Toscana Podalirio
review: A vibrant, cherry- and berry-scented red, picking up earth and iron accents on the palate, this is firm, lively and long on the finish. Merlot. Drink now through 2020. 420 cases made.

name: Toscana Podalirio
review: Gorgeous aromas of blackberries, black olives and toasted oak follow through to a full-bodied palate, with soft tannins and a medium finish. I like this better than their 2001. Sangiovese and Merlot. Best after 2006. 625 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico L'Aura
review: A ripe version, offering raisin, plum, black cherry and subtle chocolate notes. Gets lift more from the tannins than the acidity, with a dusty feel on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 2,900 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico L'Aura
review: Elegant and firmly wrought, featuring a backbone of tannins that shores up the strawberry, cherry and wild herb notes. A tad dry on the finish. Best from 2013 through 2018. 2,300 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico L'Aura
review: A fruity red, bursting with cherry, raspberry and a hint of licorice flavors. It's straightforward and open, with a moderate finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Viognier-Roussanne Toscana Livia
review: Apricot, nutmeg, clove and lychee aromas and flavors highlight this fragrant white, ending with a grapefruit peel note. Drink now. 180 cases made.

name: Merlot Toscana Podalirio
review: Fresh black fruit and flowers on a light layer of oak. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a fresh and lingering mineral finish. Best after 2008. 670 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico L'Aura
review: Blackberry fruit, with floral and herbal notes. Medium-bodied, with light tannins and a medium finish. Drink now. 1,920 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico L'Aura
review: Ripe and decadent aromas here. Full-bodied, round and soft with lots of fruit. Slightly funky but likable. Drink now. 1,400 cases made.

name: Toscana Cinque
review: A straightforward, fruity red, offering currant and strawberry flavors matched to moderately firm tannins. Sangiovese. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico L'Aura
review: A simple red, with cherry and mineral character. Medium-to-light body. Fresh acidity and a light finish. Lemony. Drink now. 2,100 cases made.

name: Viognier-Roussanne Toscana Livia
review: Ripe orchard fruit, spice and toasty oak mark this plump, soft white. Drink now. 170 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico L'Aura
review: Lean and green, with tough tannins and leafy tobacco flavors. Astringent finish. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 3,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Podalirio
review: A cherry jujube note is overshadowed by leafy flavors and dry tannins. Merlot. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 600 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Very clean fruit aromas, with hints of toasted oak. Medium- to full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long finish. Slightly austere right now. Give it time. Best after 2003. 700 cases made.

name: Toscana Le Cataste
review: Pretty combination of currants, cherries and flowers in this friendly red. Medium- to full-bodied, with silky tannins and a long, berry, minty aftertaste. Austere now. Needs bottle age. Sangiovese and Cabernet. Best after 2004. 700 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Slightly cooked fruit on the nose, with plum and rhubarb character. Full-bodied, soft and fruity. Medium finish. A little simple, but very good. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Attractive dried cherry and raspberry aromas follow through to a medium-bodied palate, with very polished tannins and a fresh, polished finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Toscana Le Cataste
review: Interesting aromas of spices, berries and tobacco follow through to a medium-bodied palate, with fresh fruit and a long finish. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2002 through 2006. 400 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Plum, berry and mineral character, with a hint of Earl Grey tea. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a bitter chocolate fruit finish. Drink now. 1,300 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Delicious and balanced Sangiovese, with cherry, mineral and fresh mushroom aromas and flavors. Medium body. Fine tannins. Clean finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Well-crafted, delicate red. Beautiful dried cherry and plum character. Medium-bodied, with rounded tannins and a fruity, smooth-textured finish. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Spicy black fruit, with a hint of basil and light tea. Light- to medium-bodied, with light tannins and a fresh finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Another pretty wine with vanilla, coconut and berry aromas and flavors, medium body and a silky finish. Drinkable now.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Spicy, meaty aromas follow through to a smooth, medium palate, with fine tannins and a mineral and fruit finish. A bit funky and earthy, but interesting. Drink now through 2004. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Some berry and plum character with light hints of vanilla. Light- to medium-bodied, with a fresh finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Rather thin, with light cherry and a bit too much new wood. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: A very delicate wine with petrol, truffle, berry, mushroom aromas and flavors, light body and supple mouth feel. Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Bright aromas of strawberry, leather and citrus. Medium-bodied, with fresh acidity and a light, fruity aftertaste. Already starting to fade. 1,250 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Light and simple, with some cherry fruit and a slightly austere finish. Some decent fruit, but short. Drying texture. 500 cases made.

name: Toscana Palafreno
review: Tightly wound and linear in profile, this rich red is focused on cherry, leather, menthol and mineral flavors with precision and intensity. The dusty tannins flex their muscles on the finish, which is long and fresh, echoing fruit, spice and mineral notes. Merlot. Best from 2016 through 2035. 15 cases imported.

name: Toscana Camartina
review: Aromas of black currant and flowers follow through to a full body, with a solid core of ripe fruit and silky tannins. Long and beautiful. Chewy right now. Solid and long. Needs time. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Sangiovese. Best after 2010. 2,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Turpino
review: Enticing aromas and flavors of cherry, leather, licorice and mineral are the hallmarks of this polished, intense red. Beautifully balanced, but requires a little more time for the dense tannins to soften. Shows terrific length and a complex aftertaste. Cabernet Franc, Syrah and Merlot. Drink now through 2023. 16 cases imported.

name: Toscana Camartina
review: The flavors are as much about herb and earth notes as blueberry and black currant fruit. Dense and muscular, yet also juicy, fresh and firmly structured. Vanilla and toast notes grace the lingering finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese. Drink now through 2024. 150 cases imported.

name: Toscana Camartina
review: A vivid, fresh style, whose berry and cherry flavors are focused and augmented by tobacco, underbrush and iron notes. Tight and intense, presenting a long, mineral-inflected finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese. Best from 2015 through 2025. 70 cases imported.

name: Toscana Camartina
review: Blackberry, blueberry and lavender aromas follow through to a full body, with supersilky tannins and a long, caressing finish. Polished and beautiful. Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese. Best after 2011. 2,400 cases made.

name: Toscana Camartina
review: Gorgeous aromas of fresh wild raspberries, with hints of underbrush and wet earth. Very complex. Full-bodied, with soft and caressing tannins, ripe fruit and a long, long finish. Better with age, but hard not to drink now. Nearly always an outstanding wine. Best after 2003. 2,400 cases made.

name: Toscana Camartina
review: A big and juicy red. Always a blockbuster. Dark in color, with chocolate, berry and cherry character. Full-bodied and very chewy, with loads of fruit and tannins. Long finish. Cabernet. Needs time. Best after 2002. 1,250 cases made.

name: Toscana Camartina
review: A massive super Tuscan red, though slightly coarse. California Cab lovers rejoice. Terrific aromas of black currants, cherries and dried herbs. Full-bodied, with full, velvety tannins and masses of fruit. Long, slightly austere finish. Best after 2001.

name: Toscana Palafreno
review: Graphite and blackberry aromas lead off in this complex, sophisticated red. The spicy, toasted oak accents are well-integrated, concentrated and balanced. A light, cocoalike dusting of tannins lines the lingering finish. Merlot. Drink now through 2023. 3 cases imported.

name: Toscana Camartina
review: Still showing some oak, with hints of resin and vanilla, along with plum, blackberry, iron and tobacco notes. Dense and beefy, finishing long and concentrated. Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese. Drink now through 2023. 100 cases imported.

name: Toscana Camartina
review: A stylish combination of currant and cassis on the nose, with a hint of rose petal, turning to licorice. Full-bodied, with chewy yet polished tannins and a long, flavorful finish. Polished and very pretty. Tight and holding back. Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese. Best after 2010. 1,400 cases made.

name: Toscana Camartina
review: Smells like a bouquet of flowers, with hints of passion fruit. Full-bodied and very polished, with fine tannins and a long, complex finish. Love this wine. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah. Best after 2004. 3,000 cases made.

name: Toscana White Batàr
review: An intense, minerally nose, with notes of bitter almond, sultana and ripe melon, leads to a full-bodied palate, with rich mineral character and lemony acidity. There's a velvety, almost tannic texture on the long finish. Compact. Powerful and impressive. Pinot Bianco and Chardonnay. Drink now. 1,415 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: A rich, round wine, with plum and berry character and soft tannins. Full-bodied, with berry and dark chocolate character and a long finish. Juicy. Outstanding value. Drink now through 2012. 12,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Camartina
review: A wine with lots of new wood, yet also plenty of currant and chocolate character underneath. Full and very tight, with chewy tannins, but the fruit density is impressive. Best after 2011. 1,165 cases made.

name: Toscana Camartina
review: Attractive coffee, blackberry and tobacco character on the nose. Full-bodied, with loads of velvety tannins and a long, caressing finish. Beauty. Very well-crafted, especially for the vintage. Best after 2006. 2,500 cases made.

name: Toscana Turpino
review: Driven by a lively structure, this rich red exhibits cherry and plum flavors that show a touch of leather, tobacco and dried herbs. This stays persistent and long, tightening up on the dense finish. Drink now through 2018. 170 cases imported.

name: Toscana White Batàr
review: Starts out reserved, revealing white peach, apple and spice flavors, gaining steam and fleshing out as this comes together on the finish. Shows fine harmony, intensity and length. Chardonnay and Pinot Blanc. Drink now through 2024. 450 cases imported.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Rich cherry flavors are underscored by a firm structure in this intense, powerful red. Tightfisted tannins carry the finish for now, but there is ample sweet fruit and lively acidity for the future. Best from 2018 through 2028. 200 cases imported.

name: Chianti Classico
review: A fruity style, this exhibits cherry, raspberry, tobacco and loam flavors. Tightens up on the finish, yet the leafy, tobacco notes persist. Drink now through 2020. 2,800 cases imported.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Slightly dark, revealing black cherry, black currant, licorice and mineral flavors. On the savory side, with a long, intense and salty aftertaste. A traditional style. Best from 2015 through 2023. 7,750 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Sweet berry and raspberry aromas follow through to a full body, with soft, silky tannins and a clean, caressing finish. Harmonious, with pretty fruit. Drink now. 17,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: A firm, fruity red, with oak-tinged black currant and a hint of roasted spice. Medium-bodied, with good spicy fruit flavors and a firm mineral finish. Gorgeous and subtle. This estate is going places. Best after 2006. 11,600 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: A thick and structured Chianti, its aromas of very ripe fruit, bark and wet earth leading to a medium- to full-bodied palate, with full, chewy tannins and a big finish. Needs bottle age. Best from 2000 through 2002. 8,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Wonderfully fragrant, with overpowering fruit. Has enticing mint, raspberry and fruit aromas, with smoky berry and raspberry flavors, medium tannins and a velvety finish. Full-bodied. Drink now to 1995.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Shows wonderful finesse and the texture of a fine Bordeaux. Offers plenty of fruit flavors, but hints of chocolate and vanilla give it wonderful complexity. Drink now.

name: Maremma Toscana Mongrana
review: This ripe red boasts flavors of cherry, cedar and herb matched to a medium-bodied frame. The acidity and tannins are in the correct proportions, offering a lingering finish. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best from 2015 through 2024. 10,800 cases made.

name: Toscana Camartina
review: Slightly one-dimensional but very impressive. Aromas of currants, licorice and plums. Full-bodied and chewy, with thick tannins and medium finish. A serious Cabernet. Best after 2003. 2,200 cases made.

name: Toscana Mongrana
review: The harmony and texture of this red sets the pace for cherry, strawberry, anise and spice flavors. Gains purity in the glass, offering a refined structure and lingering aftertaste. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2018. 250 cases imported.

name: Toscana Palafreno
review: Slightly earthy and meaty on the nose, with hints of tarragon and orange peel. Full-bodied, with silky tannins and a long finish. Racy. Merlot. Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2009. 600 cases made.

name: Toscana White Batàr
review: This is bright, offering peach, melon and subtle orange peel flavors and spicy oak nuances. Balanced and integrated, gaining harmony with air, so decant now. Shows fine intensity and a lingering finish. Chardonnay and Pinot Blanc. Drink now through 2020. 185 cases imported.

name: Toscana White Batàr
review: Offers focused aromas of bread dough, beeswax, grilled almond and white peach, with spicy flavors. The oak is toned down and this is vibrant and persistent, showing harmony and a supple texture. The lingering finish suggests lemon cake and baking spice details. Chardonnay and Pinot Blanc. Drink now through 2020. 1,000 cases made.

name: Toscana White Batàr
review: A buttery style, with butterscotch, toast and spice details accenting the melon and apple flavors. Stays spicy, echoing the toast note on the lingering finish. Chardonnay and Pinot Blanc. Drink now through 2020. 170 cases imported.

name: Toscana White Batar
review: Toasty, displaying vanilla, clove, nutmeg, butterscotch and baked apple flavors. Balanced, this is rich in texture, with a long finish. Needs some air to blossom. Chardonnay and Pinot Blanc. Drink now through 2016. 1,080 cases made.

name: Toscana White Batàr
review: Displays lots of apple, vanilla and mango character, with hints of piecrust. Full and rich, with layers of fruit. Very long and beautiful. One of Tuscany's best whites. Pinot Bianco and Chardonnay. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Toscana White Batàr
review: Fresh apple, flower and light toffee aromas follow through to a full body, with a round texture and a long, rich finish. There's loads of fruit and character, yet this is refined. Pinot Bianco and Chardonnay. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Delicious, with ripe plum and damson and hints of chocolate. Medium- to full-bodied, with fine, fruit-coated tannins and a delicate, minerally finish. One of the finds of the vintage. Better than the 2001. Best after 2005. 8,400 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: A serious '96 CC. Blackberry, bark and wet earth character gives this wine a sophisticated style, with medium body, velvety tannins and a long finish. Drink now through 2003. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: A well-crafted wine, with lovely tobacco and chocolate character. The plum, cherry and tomato aromas are elegant. Medium-bodied, with plum, cedar and berry flavors, fine tannins and a rich finish. Drink now.

name: Maremma Toscana Mongrana
review: Though lean and taut, this red stretches cherry, strawberry, earth and spice flavors from beginning to end. A bit jangly on the finish for now, but needs a year or so to settle down. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best from 2015 through 2022. 6,500 cases imported.

name: Toscana Camartina
review: Very ripe and rich, with loads of plum and milky coffee character. Full-bodied, with lots of ripe fruit and a long vanilla and fruit finish. Turns jammy, but very good. Sangiovese, with Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Best after 2005. 9,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Mongrana
review: This red is slightly tart, offering sour cherry, currant and earth notes. Elegant, with mineral and graphite accents that extend on the long finish. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Toscana Palafreno
review: Elegant, sporting cherry, black currant, spice and tobacco notes, this is vivd and fluid at once, with firm tannins for support. Merlot. Drink now through 2020. 250 cases made.

name: Toscana Palafreno
review: Lots of toasty oak and ripe berry character. Full-bodied, with soft, round tannins and a long, caressing finish. Delicious. New from Querciabella. Merlot and Sangiovese. Best after 2005. 3,000 cases made.

name: Batàr White
review: A well-made Chardonnay with interesting aromas of toasted oak and ripe fruit, a hint of honey, too. Medium-bodied, with moderate acidity and a toasted finish. Drink or hold.

name: Chianti Classico
review: A rich, fluid red, embedded with cherry, herb and mineral flavors. Ripe and balanced, with moderate length. For enjoying on the early side. Drink now through 2016. 2,700 cases imported.

name: Chianti Classico
review: A juicy, rich wine, offering lots of fruit. Full and velvety, with sliced plum and chocolate flavors. A big Chianti Classico. Needs a little time to mellow. Best after 2010. 11,665 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Slightly reserved, but there's good black currant character, with a light backbone of oak. Medium-bodied, with well-balanced fruit and mineral flavors, fine tannins and a lightly firm finish. Promising, but needs a bit of time to open. Best after 2008. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: A plummy red, with hints of tarragon and basil. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a smoky, berry and plum aftertaste. Delicious. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Opulent for a Chianti with its berry, grilled meat and fruits on nose and palate. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a long, succulent finish. Delicious.

name: Maremma Toscana Mongrana
review: Rich, featuring good shoulders, this red sports cherry, plum, briar and tobacco flavors. The tannins are on the rustic side, with a dense, dusty finish. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2019. 16,600 cases made.

name: Toscana Camartina
review: Reserved, this lightweight red sports cherry and strawberry flavors and earthy, spicy notes. It's held together by a tightly woven structure. Moderate length. Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese. Best from 2013 through 2020. 150 cases imported.

name: Toscana Camartina
review: Subtle aromas of violet, dark chocolate and coffee. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a pretty, sweet fruit finish. Delicious. Refined. Best after 2006. 3,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Mongrana
review: Shows richness and well-defined black cherry, blackberry, leather and tobacco flavors. An intertwined mineral element persists on the finish. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2017 through 2023. 6,667 cases made.

name: Toscana Mongrana
review: This attractive red features dried strawberry and light cedar aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins. Lovely now. Best from 2011 through 2015. 10,000 cases made.

name: Toscana White Batàr
review: Tightly knit, revealing apple, lemon and oak spice flavors, turning to grilled nuts and anise notes by the finish. Stays fresh and lingers. Chardonnay and Pinot Blanc. Drink now through 2013. 250 cases imported.

name: Toscana White Batàr
review: A rich and powerful white, with lots of apple and vanilla character. Full-bodied, with medium acidity and a toasted oak finish. Chardonnay and Pinot Bianco. Drink now through 2006. 2,200 cases made.

name: Toscana White Batàr
review: Very good, very rich white. Attractive aromas of lemons, vanilla and apples. Medium-bodied, with lovely fruit, and apple on the long finish. Well-done. Pinot Bianco and Chardonnay. Drink now through 2003. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: A bit shy in aroma, yet the palate offers cherry, plum and spice flavors. Vibrant, with a light dusting of tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 2,400 cases imported.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Pretty and seductive. Aromas of ripe fruit and coffee follow through to a medium body, with light tannins and a fresh finish. Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico
