review: A lively and well-structured red. Plenty of crushed blueberry on the nose and palate. Medium-bodied, with sleek tannins and a silky texture. Best after 1999.

name: Maremma Toscana Mongrana
review: Currant and berry aromas, with a medium body and silky tannins. Straightforward. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2009. 8,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Palafreno
review: Coffee and blackberry aromas follow through to a medium-bodied palate, with pleasant spices and leather. Fine tannins. Slightly high acidity. Merlot and Sangiovese. Best after 2005. 3,000 cases made.

name: Toscana White Batàr
review: A big and waxy white, with creamy vanilla and apple pie character. Full-bodied and very woody, this has dried apple and a toffeelike finish. A little hot, this is slightly overdone this year. Drink now. 1,266 cases made.

name: Toscana White Batàr
review: Straightforward apple and vanilla character. Medium-bodied, with good acidity and a medium finish. Always very good. Chardonnay and Pinot Bianco. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Toscana White Batàr
review: Attractive lemon and honey character with a full-bodied, milky apple character. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Toscana White Batàr
review: A good Chardonnay, with pretty aromas of toasted oak, almond and apple. Medium-bodied, with apple pie and vanilla flavors and a medium finish. Drink now.

name: Camartina
review: Good berry, tobacco character in this medium-bodied wine. Shows medium, chewy tannins and has a short finish. Bit tough. Better after this year.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Aromas of dried cherry, prune and tangy spice follow through to a medium- to full-bodied palate, with good tannins and a medium plum finish. A good effort for the vintage. Best after 2005. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: An enticing nose, with ripe plum, berry, mineral, light oak and fresh herb. Medium- to full-bodied, with nicely poised tannins and a medium, slightly herbal finish. Best after 2004. 9,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Plum and berry aromas, with leafy and earthy undertones. Medium-bodied, with silky tannins and a medium, fresh fruit finish.  Best after 2002. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: A Chianti Classico with a good core of berry, mint and cherry character. Medium to full body. Medium tannins and a long finish. Slightly short for Querciabella. Drink now through 2005. 2,000 cases made.

name: Camartina
review: Big and thick with tobacco, cedar and berry character. Full-bodied with full tannins and a slightly astringent finish. Made from Cabernet and Sangiovese.  Drinkable now.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Some good fruit flavors of berry and plum, with a mild stemmy note. Medium in body, with medium, chewy tannins and a moderate finish. Better after this year.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Well made, with plenty of fruity, minty aromas and flavors, medium body, fine tannins, long silky finish.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Plenty of dried cherry and cigar-box aromas in this red. Medium-bodied, with soft tannins and a fruity, grilled meat finish, which is slightly diluted. Drink now. 2,250 cases made.

name: Toscana White Batàr
review: Pleasant apple and pineapple character, with a hint of coconut. Medium-bodied, with good fruit and a simple finish. Chardonnay and Pinot Bianco. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Toscana White Batàr
review: Very woody--like a white Rioja--with some waxy, apple skin character, too. Still, it's stylish and rather interesting on the finish. Medium-bodied. Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Lean and slightly chewy in texture, with modest cherry, tobacco and briar notes. Drink now through 2018. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 7,250 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Silky and soft with some nice spicy plum, dark chocolate flavors, but the tannins turn a bit drying on the finish. A wine with some depth. Drinkable now.

name: Maremma Toscana Mongrana
review: Lots of dark chocolate, meat and ripe fruit. Medium-bodied, with soft tannins and a medium finish. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 5,800 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Good blackberry and fruity aromas. Medium-bodied, with polished tannins but a slightly short, austere finish. Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Handsome aromas and flavors of licorice and fruit, with a woody note. Has a medium body and fine tannins, but a slightly austere finish. Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Simple red, with plum and tobacco character, medium to light body and a light finish. A bit tart. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Armonia
review: Marked by intense aromas of fruit and meat with a hint of smoke. Medium-bodied, with medium, chewy tannins and a chocolate finish. Needs time in the bottle; try after 1999.

name: Chianti Classico Querciavalle
review: Lots of raspberry and tart cherry flavors give this medium-bodied Chianti a generous profile. It is moderately tannic, firm in texture and lingering on the finish. Drinkable now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Very modern Chianti with an abundance of new wood. Medium- to full-bodied, it has big vanilla flavors and a medium, fruity finish. A bit too much new wood? Wait and see.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Offers bright red cherry and strawberry aromas, and a medium to light body with high, crisp acidity. Citrusy finish. Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Medium-bodied with light tannins and a slightly peppery, berry character. Fresh on the finish. First time tasted. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Ripe plum aromas, with hints of earthiness. Light to medium in body, with soft tannins and a simple, sweetish finish. A bit cloying. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: A bit light, with a stemmy berry and leather character. Tart finish. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Old-style, with slightly cheesy, leathery and plummy aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with light tannins and finish. A bit tired. 1,000 cases made.

name: Val d'Arbia
review: Aromas and flavors of canned fruit salad dominate. Medium-bodied, with moderate acidity. Hard to like.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Rather light, and its fruity character verges on tomatolike. Light-bodied, with light tannins. Short finish. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Russian River Valley Top Chef Selection
review: There's good intensity to the broad lime peel and green apple flavors in this medium-bodied white, which offers floral notes and a smooth texture, with a juicy, refreshing finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Top Chef Selection
review: Offers smoky wild berry and cinnamon aromas as well as juicy cherry, fresh anise and white pepper flavors. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape Project 4MC Cuvée Marlé
review: A broad, rich, creamy style, with flattering flavors of creamed pear, peach and yellow apple, laced with a honeyed note and backed by a rounded, buttery finish. What you see is what you get. Fans of the style will love this. Drink now. 280 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape Project L348 The Agulhas Rains
review: An open, friendly style, with a mix of creamed green apple and pear flavors backed by a faint buttery echo on the finish. Drink now. 280 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Polished, focused and generous, with red plum and cherry flavors in an elegant package, framed with fine tannins. A savory, meaty note runs through this at a subterranean level. Lingers beautifully. Drink now through 2028. 4,125 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Pure and impressively expressive, with focused currant, plum, blackberry and black olive aromatics turning on the palate to a more complex profile, weaving in coffee, crème brûlée and chai tea notes, all wrapped in a polished texture. The finish doesn't want to quit. Best from 2015 through 2024. 3,985 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Polished, vibrant and distinctive, with coffee and jasmine tea accents around a supple core of cherry and red plum fruit. The nubby tannins rub gently against the long finish. Shows tremendous depth while holding its power in check. Best from 2015 through 2025. 4,150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Velvety and generous. A supple, insinuating style, with coffee and bittersweet chocolate accents around a beautifully contained core of ripe currant, plum and cherry fruit. Has great presence, balance and harmony. The finish expands impressively against a veil of firm tannins and well-integrated oak flavors. Best from 2010 through 2020. 3,400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Richly layered with gorgeous, focused currant, plum and blackberry fruit, shaded with touches of dusky spice and smoky notes from oak, but it's almost subliminal to the harmonious, seamless fruit character. The wine glides over the palate, submerging its tannins to let the flavors soar. Best from 2008 through 2020. 3,400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Reserve
review: A titanic wine, packed with flavor and built to age gracefully. Firm and chewy at first, it bristles with blackberry, black cherry and coffee flavors that build up momentum through the solid finish. Tannins are firm but integrated. Best from 2000 through 2003. 150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Refined and structured, with expressive dark berry and toasted clove aromas and richly layered plum, stony mineral and thyme flavors that gain depth toward polished tannins. Drink now through 2026. 4,050 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Broad and expressive, layering black cherry, plum, pear and black tea flavors into a beam that focuses the finish against well-managed but present tannins. Has depth, marvelous expression and length. Best from 2018 through 2025. 3,705 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, with sandy tannins around a supple core of ripe, plush cherry, tobacco and tar flavors. Finishes with persistence and flashes of sage and bay leaf. Long and inviting, this is built for the cellar. Best from 2014 through 2020. 3,625 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Firm, with a light grip of tannins around a core of dark berry, currant, smoke and tobacco flavors. This has elegance and depth, with a welcome sense of reticence that doesn't push the flavors too strong. Finishes very long, with a silky texture. Drink now through 2017. 4,250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Very ripe and generous. Not a big wine, but brims with plum, currant, black olive, cedar and roasted meat flavors, all playing against crisp tannins and lingering on the tight finish. Needs time in the cellar in order to open and flourish. Best from 2012 through 2020. 3,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Richly aromatic, this brims with dark berry and currant aromas and flavors, shaded with espresso and dark chocolate overtones set against somewhat gritty tannins. A meaty note adds extra depth as the finish lingers on and on against the tannins. Best from 2010 through 2017. 3,400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Intense and remarkably harmonious, this wine hangs its broad and generous flavors on a very fine, polished texture. It brims with spice-scented cherry, red currant and herb flavors, lingering impressively on the plush finish. Drink now through 2010. 3,150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Dense and beautifully focused, firm texture, with bay leaf-scented cherry and currant flavors that last and last on the chewy finish. Built for the cellar, this has the intensity, length and depth to go on. Best after 2003. 2,300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Dense, deep and powerful, a many-layered red that piles on its rich currant, plum, black cherry and peppery spice flavors, finishing with touches of cedar and mint. A glorious, cellar-worthy Cabernet with plenty of superrefined tannins. Best from 2004 through 2015. 2,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, with a layer of drying tannins around a brilliantly focused core of blackberry and currant, coming together on the finish and persisting well. Has the goods to age. Best from 2016 through 2021. 2,250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Firm and taut, with dusky spice and freshly ground pepper nuances to the dark berry, currant and cherry aromas and flavors, lingering impressively on the chewy finish. Doesn't have the pure fruit of previous vintages, but it should soften and broaden, developing more depth with cellaring. Best from 2008 through 2015. 3,400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Announces itself as a serious red from the first whiff of earthy, smoky notes weaving through the licorice-scented dark berry flavors. This firm, chewy wine expands on the long finish under a layer of fine-grained tannins, holding it all together seamlessly. It begs for time in the cellar to develop. Best after 2006. 2,925 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Bright and flavorful, a generous mouthful of blueberry, blackberry and currant shaded with spicy oak notes on the persistent finish. Fine-grained tannins need cellaring. Best from 2000 through 2005. 1,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Dense, rich and dynamic, packed with mouth-filling blackberry, currant and blueberry flavors with hints of anise and sweet spices. A glorious mélange of flavors that shows both substance and subtlety. Best from 2002 through 2005. 950 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Smoky, toasty flavors and firm tannins almost mask the pretty berry tones that emerge gradually in the glass, growing polished and almost plush. Needs some time to see if the fruit can make itself heard. Best after 2000. 1,300 cases made.

name: Merlot Washington
review: Ripe, round and complex, layering its spice, toast, berry, plum and tobacco flavors with depth and harmony. A bit chunky now, but should develop well through 1999 or 2001. 50 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Firm and chewy, a solid wine with appealing blackberry, plum and currant flavors poking through the thin veil of tannins draped over the finish. Flavors linger impressively. Best from 2000 through 2005. 2,250 cases made.

name: Columbia Valley
review: Broad, open-textured and impeccably balanced, with a tingle of tannins wrapping around a plump core of currant, plum and cedary spice flavors that persist on the finish, with hints of pepper. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2008 through 2013. 1,325 cases made.

name: Merlot Washington
review: Ripe and distinctly spicy, a plush mouthful of cinnamon- and nutmeg-accented plum and currant fruit, lingering nicely on the open finish. Drink now through 2010. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Ripe in flavor, open in texture, with a real sense of elegance surrounding the juicy currant, mint and sweet spice flavors that echo nicely on the round finish. Drink now through 2004. 1,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Tight and firm, with a cedary aroma and ripe currant, toast and berry flavors on the palate. Elegant and well balanced, drinking well now but with depth and intensity to carry it through the decade. Drink now through 2000. 925 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Firm, ripe and concentrated, with a rich, supple core of black cherry, currant, anise and oak that's sharply focused and tightly tannic. A young, intense, complex wine from a first-rate vintage. Drinkable now, but has the potential to gain through 2000. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Firm and generous, with wild plum and currant flavors poking through a layer of chewy tannins and hints of spicy oak. Needs cellaring to bring everything into balance, but it has the goods to get there. Best from 2002 through 2008. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Firm, tight, intense and tannic, but rich and concentrated, with a solid core of herb, spice and currant-scented Cabernet flavors. Needs time for the tannins and rough edges to soften, but this one has fine potential. Best after 1995. 950 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Champoux Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, with spicy berry, black cherry and smoke flavors that weave through the layers of fine tannins. Best from 2002 through 2008. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Ripe, grapy and tannic, with a bitter edge to the finish and clumsy feel to the structure.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Notably well-oaked, with a strong cedary vanilla-bean presence that's distracting, a flavor enhancer that's not enough to carry the modest fruit core. Drink now through 2025. 2,725 cases made.

name: Rias Baixas Rosal
review: Lively, firm and focused, this racy white delivers green apple and quince flavors, with mineral, briny and floral accents. Balanced and expressive. Albariño, Caiño Blanco and Loureiro. Drink now through 2019. 4,166 cases made.

name: Albariño Rias Baixas Turonia
review: This vibrant white shows ripe peach, melon and persimmon flavors, supported by juicy tangerine acidity and briny, leesy accents. Peach and floral notes linger on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 2,100 cases made.

name: Albariño Rias Baixas Turonia
review: Floral, yeast and apple blossom aromas follow through on the palate of this full yet lively white, with pear, pine and rose water flavors. It has very firm acidity and a fresh, leesy finish. Expressive. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Albariño Rias Baixas Turonia
review: Peach, lime, pine and light herbal flavors mingle in this round white. It's balanced and quite solid, with firm acidity and menthol, floral and honey notes on the finish. Can stand up to food. Drink now through 2010. 1,500 cases made.

name: Rias Baixas Rosal
review: This firm white features mineral, herbal and light earth notes that add depth to the pear fruit and interest to the juicy finish. Well-structured, yet remains lively. Drink now through 2012. 6,000 cases made.

name: Rias Baixas O Rosal
review: Crisp and firm, this white shows almond, pear and herb flavors. The texture is generous, but lively acidity keeps the finish fresh and clean. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Albariño Rias Baixas Turonia
review: Nicely balanced, this white offers pear, peach, lime and mineral notes in a generous texture with gentle but lively acidity. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Rias Baixas
review: Crisp and tangy, this firm white shows smoke and hazelnut flavors, with a hint of spritz that emphasizes the lemon-lime acidity. Drink now. 6,600 cases made.

name: Albariño Rias Baixas Turonia
review: Light and crisp, showing simple apple and pear flavors, with herbal accents. Drink now. 1,300 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A ripe, meaty aroma and fairly rich flavors of dark plum and blueberry, with mineral notes, make this a red you can sink your teeth into. Good medium-weight tannins carry spice notes and a touch of elegance on the finish. Drink now through 2004.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Sweet, spicy aromas and flavors give this red an easygoing allure, with flavors of plum and berry. Vanilla bean notes linger on the finish. Drink now through 2003.

name: Arinto Tejo
review: Crisp, with fresh-cut apple and citrus flavors that feature notes of anise and almond. Very clean and pure-tasting on the minerally finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Tejo
review: This supple red shows lots of dried and smoked cherry flavors. Savory earth and spice notes extend on the finish. Tinta Roriz, Castelão, Syrah and Alicante Bouschet. Drink now. 26,000 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon Tejo Reserva
review: Ripe and well-rounded, with plush dark plum and berry flavors that are well-spiced. Finishes with mocha and dark chocolate notes. Drink now. 14,000 cases made.

name: Ribatejo
review: This has a peppery aroma, with plenty of Asian spice accents to the kirsch and plum pudding flavors. Features minty notes on the tannic finish. Drink now through 2013. 25,000 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Ribatejo Rosé
review: Fresh and juicy. Medium-bodied, with pretty plum, berry and cherry flavors and a spicy finish.  Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Arintho Ribatejo
review: A fresh, juicy white, offering flavors of lemon curd and banana cream pie, with a vanilla-infused finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Ribatejo Casa da Alorna
review: Fruity aroma, with plenty of blackberry and dark plum flavors that turn sappy on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Arintho Ribatejo
review: Firm, with peachy flavors and spicy notes. Chalky finish.  Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Ribatejo
review: On the syrupy side, with blueberry and roasted plum flavors. Tinta Roriz, Castelão, Syrah and Alicante Bouschet. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon Ribatejo Reserva
review: Minty, plummy aroma, with flavors to match. Kirschlike on the sappy finish. 6,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Concentrated, rich and powerful, with notes of dried beef to the raspberry, cherry tart and roasted plum flavors, and mushroom and forest floor elements in the midpalate. The finish offers accents of dried mint.  Drink now through 2020. 420 cases made.

name: Douro Campo Ardosa
review: Rich and concentrated, with well-defined blackberry, plum, pepper and spice flavors, layered with toasty oak and sandalwood. A finely crafted and voluptuous red. Drink now. 1,330 cases made.

name: Douro Campo Ardosa
review: A lithe, yet muscular, red that is quite Bordeaux-like, with aromas and flavors of black olive, plum and raspberry and a seductive smoky essence as well, which lingers on the long finish. Well-structured, with medium-weight tannins. Drink now through 2005. 5,000 cases made.

name: Douro Ardosino
review: Cedary plum and spice blend well in this fresh, lively red. Mineral and smoke notes shade nicely as well. Tannins build on the finish, but not out of bounds. Drink now through 2007. 1,500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A balanced and muscular red, with dried berry, cream and currant flavors joined by notes of raspberry tart and dried sage. The tannic finish features mineral and espresso accents. Drink now through 2016. 100 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old
review: Fresh, with an open-knit feel to the mix of warmed raisin toast, cinnamon, tea and singed orange peel notes. Lightly sweet, relying on zip through the finish. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Tawny Port Reserve
review: This has good zip and focus, with notes of cinnamon, tea, singed sandalwood, rose water and roasted almond, followed by an echo of bergamot through the refreshing finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Ruby Port Reserve
review: Friendly, with a rounded feel and juicy plum and raisin compote notes. The open-knit finish has just enough grip to stay honest. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Estremadura
review: A concentrated red, with a deep vein of blackberry, cassis and wild plum flavors and notes of mineral and tobacco leaf. Loads of chocolate and spice on the seductive finish. Distinctive. Impressive for the appellation. Drink now through 2012. 16,000 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Estremadura
review: Very juicy and bright, with vibrant flavors of cherry, plum and dark chocolate. There's also a typical Touriga herbal and mineral edge to this, with lots of iron. Drink now through 2012. 1,650 cases made.

name: Estremadura Vinha Conchas Special Selection
review: Lively and juicy, with a mineral cast to the red plum and crushed berry flavors. Shows fresh-cut herb and appealing earthy notes as well. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Estremadura Vinha Conchas Special Selection
review: Firm and structured, with an iron and mineral cast to the deep well of plum and berry fruit. Crisp finish. Drink now through 2009. 4,400 cases made.

name: Estremadura Reserva
review: Lots of blueberry and red berry flavors in this supple red, with notes of anise and cardamom. Smoke and paprika linger on the finish.  Drink now. 2,700 cases made.

name: Estremadura Vinha Conchas Red
review: Medium-bodied, with concentrated red plum and pepper flavors that are crisp and well-defined. Zesty finish. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional and Trincadeira. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Estremadura Vinha Conchas White
review: Fresh and juicy, with pippin apple flavors that are accented by bright citrus notes, including Meyer lemon. The finish is crisp and spicy. Fernão Pires and Arinto. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Fernão Pires-Arinto Lisboa Vinha Conchas White
review: Offering lots of grassy notes to the citrus and green apple flavors, this is firm, with plenty of acidity and a tangy, lightly spiced finish. Clean and refreshing. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Estremadura Vinha Conchas Red
review: A meaty aroma, with flavors of red plum and mineral. Red cherry and spice notes fill the light finish.  Drink now. 13,300 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Estremadura Rosé
review: Well-structured, showing intense red plum and red cherry flavors, with notes of tobacco and spice on the finish.  Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Lisboa Vinha Conchas
review: A peppery red, showing notes of slate to its dried berry and plum pudding flavors. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional and Trincadeira. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Estremadura White
review: Taut, showing some interesting mineral components, with appley notes on the tart finish.  Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Estremadura
review: A brawny red, with dried berry and meat flavors and some tar notes. Short, firm finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Lisboa Reserva
review: Spiced cherry and plum compote flavors taste a touch flat. This has a short finish, with some dark chocolate notes. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Estremadura Vinha Conchas White
review: Simple, with apple and citrus notes. 4,400 cases made.

name: Ribatejo Late Harvest
review: A very honeyed, dessert-style white, offering lots of bright peach, apricot, mineral and spice flavors. Gingersnap finish. Drink now through 2015. 100 cases made.

name: Alfrocheiro Tejo
review: Snappy, bursting with licorice overtones to the vibrant red cherry and raspberry flavors. Shows slate and sea salt on the lively finish. Drink now. 425 cases made.

name: Ribatejo Cima
review: Fresh, jammy-tasting and delicious. A medium-bodied, full-flavored red with lots of strawberry and cherry flavors and plenty of charm. Drink now.

name: Tejo Late Harvest
review: Peachy-tasting off-dry white, with plenty of crisp, spicy notes and hints of honey on the finish. Riesling and Gewürztraminer. Drink now through 2017. 45 cases made.

name: Alfrocheiro Ribatejo
review: Firm, with a mature edge to pomegranate, berry and red plum flavors. The supple finish features notes of sandalwood and smoke. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Tejo Espírito White
review: Nectarine flavors and spicy notes fill this medium-bodied white, which finishes with notes of honey and touches of cream. Drink now. 700 cases imported.

name: Tejo Rosé Espírito
review: Bright cherry and melon flavors provide plenty of juiciness in the medium-bodied rosé. Spicy finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Ribatejo White
review: All dressed-up with buttery flavors and aromas, it has some modest fig and pear flavors, too. Enjoyable, but a bit one-dimensional.

name: Syrah Ribatejo
review: A touch rustic and briny-tasting, with dark plum and bacon fat flavors, which linger on the finish. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Syrah Tejo
review: Medium-bodied, with raspberry and sweet cherry flavors that finish on a light, sappy note. Drink now. 425 cases made.

name: Ribatejo
review: Charming, almost sweet, like a fruit wine, packed with strawberry and cherry flavors. Unusual, but good, from the intense aroma through the easy texture and lingering fruity finish.

name: Ribatejo Cima
review: Rustic, delivering plenty of hearty game, earth and ripe plum flavors. The finish kicks in some tobacco and cedary notes. Simple and satisfying.

name: Arinto-Chardonnay Ribatejo
review: Canned fruit flavors dominate this medium-boded white. Soft finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Ribatejo
review: Focused and firm, with decent cherry and dark plum flavors. Drink now.

name: Ribatejo Cima
review: There's a beefy flavor to this wine, and some dried cherry notes as well. Smooth and straightforward. Drink now.

name: Ribatejo Espírito White
review: Canned fruit flavors mark this medium-bodied white. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Syrah-Touriga Nacional Ribatejo
review: Resinous and tart, with intense menthol-like flavors. 500 cases made.

name: Tejo Espírito Red
review: Red plum and berry flavors turn stewy on the finish here. The better of two bottles tasted. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Ribatejo
review: Coarse and a bit astringent. Extremely earthy and gamy aromas give way to plum and jam flavors.

name: Ribatejo Espírito Red
review: A muddled red, with a volatile aroma and stemmy flavors of plum and berry. Touriga Nacional and Castelão. 3,500 cases made.

name: Alvarinho-Trajadura Vinho Verde Aromas das Castas Grande Escolha
review: Firm and savory, with lemon drop accents to the dried green herb and apple tart flavors. Light, smoky accents show on the crisp finish. Drink now. 3,700 cases made.

name: Alvarinho Minho Pouco-Comum
review: A medium-bodied, fruity white, with fresh-cut Gala apple and white cherry flavors. Offers a spicy finish, delivering notes of passion fruit. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Alvarinho-Loureiro-Trajadura Vinho Verde Escolha
review: A spritzy white, with straightforward green apple and ripe citrus flavors. Light and spicy on the finish.  Drink now. 7,300 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Traditional, with plenty of character. Espresso aroma, dried cherry and plum flavors. Has a nice heft, with silky, creamy notes on the finish. Try with roast chicken. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Monterrei Gorvia
review: A firm structure carries the silky texture in this alluring white. Shows mature flavors of dried apple, vanilla and spice, but remains fresh and focused, with a clean, spicy finish. Doña Blanca. Drink now. 160 cases made.

name: Monterrei Red Berrande
review: A silky texture and a lithe structure carry delicate, alluring flavors of tart cherry, licorice, flint, fresh herbs and mineral in this focused red. Not powerful, but intense. Drink now through 2016. 100 cases made.

name: Monterrei Gorvia
review: This supple red offers delicate flavors of berry, rose, spice, dried herb and orange peel that mingle pleasantly, kept fresh and vibrant by lively acidity. This expressive version favors harmony over structure. Mencía, Bastardo and Caiño Redondo. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 145 cases made.

name: Monterrei Red Alanda
review: This polished red is supple, showing a firm backbone that supports black cherry, cranberry, smoke and light earthy flavors. Bright acidity keeps the smoky finish fresh and clean. Mencia, Bastardo and Tinta Fina. Drink now through 2016. 440 cases made.

name: Monterrei Alanda
review: Firm and lean, this maturing white shows almond, wax and ginger flavors, with quince and pear flavors that add depth and richness. Godello, Doña Blanca and Treixadura. Drink now. 440 cases made.

name: Monterrei Alanda
review: This light white offers distinctive flavors of dried herb, smoke and petrol, earthy yet focused, with firm acidity and good drive through the finish. Not a fruity wine, but expressive. Doña Blanca, Treixadura, Verdello and Monstruosa de Monterrei. Drink now. 660 cases made.

name: Monterrei Red Muradella
review: Light and crisp, this savory red offers tart cherry, orange peel, fresh herb and saline notes. Light tannins and bright acidity keep it focused. Refreshing, and deceptively complex. Mencía, Bastardo and Caiño. Drink now through 2014. 333 cases made.

name: Monterrei Red Alanda
review: Ripe cherry and black cherry fruit mingles with licorice and fresh herb notes in this silky red. It has lively acidity and modest tannins, nicely integrated and fresh. Mencía, Bastardo and Tinta Fina. Drink now through 2014. 440 cases made.

name: Bucelas
review: Orange and glazed citrus flavors give this good lift. Very fresh, spicy notes mark the midpalate, carrying through to the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Dão Vineaticu
review: Peppery up front, with dried berry and mineral notes that are long and sinewy. Shows vanilla notes on the savory herb finish. Touriga Nacional, Jaen and Tinta Roriz. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: Pronounced leathery aromas and flavors, with dried cherry notes, give this red plenty of character, but not much finesse. Tannic finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Spicy, fruity aromas lead to flavors of blackberry, dark plum and hints of peat. Vibrant acidity carries through to the finish, which features notes of chocolate. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Dão Carrocel Late Release
review: A minerally and powerful red, full of richly spiced and smoky flavors of dark plum, dried blackberry and boysenberry. Cocoa powder details show midpalate, leading to a long finish of pepper and forest floor notes. Drink now through 2020. 2,156 cases made.

name: Dão Pape
review: Lush and spicy, with dense, concentrated flavors of red plum, boysenberry and dried raspberry that are matched to notes of paprika and white pepper. Intense accents of iodine and white pepper show on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 5,207 cases made.

name: Dão Carrocel
review: A rich, lush and vibrant red, with concentrated minerality to the flavors of roasted cherry, plum tart and dried berry, matched to plenty of leafy notes. Smoky and dark chocolate details emerge on the rich finish. Drink now through 2020. 3,986 cases made.

name: Dão
review: Loads of fresh-crushed plum and macerated cherry flavors are matched with rich, savory notes. Crunchy acidity gives this plenty of cut. The juicy finish is pure and lively, with refreshing minerality. Drink now through 2018.

name: Dão White Primus
review: Offers notes of sage cream to the ripe apple and honeysuckle flavors, supported by ample acidity. Luscious tropical fruit accents show on the well-spiced finish. Drink now through 2020. 3,296 cases made.

name: Dão
review: Full-bodied, with a leathery and smoky aroma, and delicious flavors of dark plum, blackberry and pepper. Well-structured red, with plenty of fine-grained tannins as well. An impressive effort for this appellation. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and others. Drink now through 2005.

name: Tinta Roriz Dão
review: Aromas and flavors of dark plum and spice make this a seductive red. Medium- to full-bodied, with a firm structure, nice grip and well-integrated tannins. Finishes with notes of cassis and pepper. Drink now through 2004.

name: Dão
review: There are some lively citrus notes to the fresh-crushed plum and cherry flavors. Hints of chestnut and juniper show on the fresh finish. Drink now through 2018. 5,095 cases made.

name: Dão
review: A robust, well-structured red, with flavors of dried cherry, red plum and raspberry. Loads of Asian spice and orange peel on the tannic finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Dão White Primus
review: A fresh and zesty style, with kiwifruit, green apple and lemon curd flavors, accented by dry tarragon and anise notes. Taut finish. Drink now through 2020. 3,317 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Dão
review: A fine, medium-bodied Touriga Nacional, with a smoky, violet-tinged aroma and lovely flavors of berry, red plum, leather and spice, which linger on the finish. Drink now through 2003.

name: Alfrocheiro Dão
review: Aromas and flavors of hot spice and fresh-crushed red fruit make for a lively mix in this crisp, juicy red. The lip-smacking finish features some savory notes. Drink now.

name: Jaén Dão
review: A lithe red, with plenty of savory notes to the dried red berry and damson plum flavors. Accents of dried thyme and tarragon linger on the crisp, direct finish. Drink now.

name: Touriga Nacional Dão
review: Aromas and flavors of red cherry, raspberry and spice are fresh, lively and distinctive in this medium-bodied red. Tobacco-box notes linger on the finish, with a slight spritziness. Drink now through 2003. 1,500 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Dão
review: A tightly wound, medium-bodied red with dark plum, mineral and tobacco-box flavors. Turns a bit lean on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 2,000 cases made.

name: Dão Pape
review: Dried berry, coffee and spice box notes are accented by leather details in this maturing red. The finish is marked by mineral aromas and chewy tannins. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Dão
review: Ripe cherry, tomato and herb aromas and flavors are vibrant, accompanied by light, firm tannins and crisp acidity; could use depth and roundess. Drink now.

name: Borba Alentejo
review: Plum and berry flavors are well-balanced in this easygoing red. Spicy notes linger on the finish.  Drink now. 4,800 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Concentrated and finely structured, with mouthcoating flavors of cassis, raspberry, boysenberry that are nicely matched with notes of truffle and mineral. Firmed up by fine-grained tannins. Dark chocolate notes ooze from the finish. Drink now through 2006. 250 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Crisp, with an aroma of olive and herb, with good red plum and berry flavors. Firm structure with a clean finish with roasted notes. Drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Douro
review: This has nicely defined flavors of plum, dried cherry and spice, with leather and meat notes. Mature-tasting, with some smoky notes on the finish. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Ripe, with red plum and red cherry flavors, and assertive leather and meat notes on the finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: An exuberantly fruity style, with floral-infused raspberry, dark cherry and currant flavors that are pure and fresh. Minerally midpalate, showing mocha and peppery notes on the long, muscular finish. Pure, complex and almost monolithic. Best from 2030 through 2050. 750 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Offers a refined mix of meat, spice and fruit flavors that are seamlessly woven together. Fine-grained tannins and plenty of Asian spice notes are also on display. The finish is smoky, seductive and juicy. Drink now through 2015. 40 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: This full-throttle red offers impressive minerality, extraction and verve. Rich, ripe flavors of dark plum, blackberry, dark cherry and spice rub elbows with mocha, chocolate and cream on the robust finish. Drink now through 2015. 600 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A dense, powerful red from Portugal, offering a smoky nature to the ripe flavors of blackberry, dark plum pudding and fig. There's plenty of mincemeat in this as well, with a muscular finish of mocha and spice. Needs time in the cellar. Best from 2012 through 2018. 25 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: Firm and well-structured, this is filled with graphite, dark plum and dark chocolate notes. The intense finish offers espresso and Asian spice. This is a powerful yet graceful red from Portugal. Drink now through 2015. 40 cases imported.

name: Douro Reserva
review: This brooding red sports plenty of muscle, with concentrated spiced plum, blackberry torte and licorice flavors. Details of dark chocolate, herb and smoke impart depth through the structured finish. Drink now through 2025. 750 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Rich, spicy notes are wrapped inside a savory mix of ripe berry and dark chocolate flavors. Offers a lively texture, with plenty of juiciness and punch. An accent of raspberry jam lingers on the finish. Luscious and elegant. Drink now through 2019. 500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Deeply colored, with a dark plum aroma leading to cassis, raspberry and dark chocolate flavors. Very harmonious, with rich notes of mineral and spice, followed by a polished finish. Best after 2017.

name: Douro
review: This full-bodied red offers a polished, concentrated profile of raspberry tart, spiced plum and dark chocolate flavors. Tangy acidity weaves through the herb, floral and mineral elements on the licorice-tinged finish, structured by full tannins. Drink now through 2022. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A ripe and muscular red, featuring plenty of beefy notes to the roasted plum and dark cherry flavors. Offers a crisp and pure-tasting finish, with lively minerality and hints of slate. Drink now through 2020. 2,708 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A suave red, with impressive concentration to the red plum, boysenberry and cardamom flavors, joined by rich slate and spice notes. Chocolate mousse accents appear on the lively finish. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A suave and refined red, with sanguine notes to the red currant, raspberry and red plum flavors, featuring a firm juiciness. Crisp and well-focused, offering hints of dried beef and pepper on the minerally finish. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz and Tinto Cão. Drink now through 2019. 5,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: This offers an engaging sinewy texture, with espresso and mocha flavors flanked by plenty of smoky notes. Asian spice and hoisin sauce accents show on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 415 cases made.

name: Douro Sino Da Romaneira
review: This well-sculpted red resonates with flavors of dark cherry, red plum and boysenberry that are supported by firm acidity and medium-grained tannins. Details of cream and molten chocolate linger on the rich and expressive finish. Drink now through 2017. 1,250 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port Unfiltered
review: Rich, spicy and full of concentrated dark plum, cherry and boysenberry flavors. Hints of walnut show midpalate, with plenty of grip on the long, chocolate- and mocha-infused finish. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Syrah Duriense
review: Refined and well-structured, with suave floral notes leading into rich flavors of chocolate, beef, kirsch and allspice. Offers silky tannins, presenting a voluptuous finish that features notes of forest floor. Drink now through 2020. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 291 cases made.

name: Syrah Duriense
review: An elegant and suave red, with luscious flavors of dark cherry, red plum and boysenberry that are long and rich midpalate. Lithe and minerally on the finish, showing notes of pepper. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: A rich, refined red, with well-sculpted flavors of damson plum, raspberry and cherry that are matched to forest floor and porcini mushroom notes. Offers lively spice details on the minerally finish. Drink now through 2020. 250 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional-Syrah Duriense
review: Shows an ironclad structure, built on concentrated flavors of raspberry, dark plum, tar and green olive. The lithe tannins are balanced yet forceful, accenting the pure-tasting finish of savory herb and spice that extends with details of hot stone. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Big, ripe and juicy, offering luscious flavors of dark cherry and red plum, with hints of paprika and light smoke. Features medium-grained tannins and juicy acidity. The finish lengthens out with spicy and toasty notes. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Cão. Drink now through 2018. 3,333 cases made.

name: Douro R de Romaneira
review: A bit shy a first, but opens up with an array of plum and red berry flavors that are accented by coffee and spice notes. Finishes with plenty of briar and mocha notes. Best from 2011 through 2014. 100 cases imported.

name: Douro R de Romaneira
review: Plush, with vibrant red plum, berry and currant flavors accented by plenty of rich, spicy notes. Seductive finish of raspberry and dark chocolate, with hints of cream. Drink now through 2013. 250 cases imported.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Roasted plum and dried red berry flavors fill this muscular, full-bodied red, supported by fresh acidity. Slate and white pepper notes dominate the finish, which features plenty of tannins. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A plush and lively red, with concentrated cherry, wild plum and currant flavors that are etched with luscious, spicy notes. Cardamom and cream accents usher in a long, rich and well-sculpted finish, which lingers with cocoa powder and coffee bean hints. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Douro Sino Da Romaneira
review: A suave red, with meaty accents to the dark plum, cherry tart and raspberry preserve flavors. Creamy notes linger alongside milk chocolate hints on the complex finish, showing details of forest floor and slate. Drink now through 2019. 2,833 cases made.

name: Petit Verdot Duriense
review: Dark plum, kirsch and savory herbal flavors are supported by fresh tannins in this ripe red, with dark chocolate and spice notes emerging on the muscular finish, accented by creamy hints. Drink now through 2018. 333 cases made.

name: Syrah Duriense
review: Ripe, with a deep well of dark plum, blackberry and dark cherry flavors full of cocoa powder and spice notes. Long, juicy finish features dark chocolate and cream. Drink now through 2018.

name: Vintage Port
review: This bottle came from the owners of Taylor, which formerly used Romaneira's wines in its vintage blends. Deep ruby with a garnet edge, ripe raspberry aromas, medium-bodied, with sweet fruit and earth flavors and a great backbone of tannins and acidity. An impressive wine.

name: Douro R de Romaneira
review: This lively, medium- to full-bodied red offers delicate berry, plum and currant flavors that are fresh up front, with lingering notes of chocolate mousse and spice. Drink now through 2015. 200 cases imported.

name: Late Bottled Port Unfiltered
review: Ripe, offering dark cherry and roasted plum flavors that are fresh and direct. Mocha and coffee bean notes linger on the rich finish. Drink now through 2020. 500 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port Unfiltered
review: Taut, offering sanguine notes to the plum, cherry and dried berry flavors. Hints of graphite show on the finish, with chewy tannins. Drink now through 2020. 750 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Quinta das Liceiras
review: Best ever from here. Very powerful wet earth and ripe fruit character. Medium- to full-bodied, medium sweet, exhibiting sleek tannins and a medium finish. Try in 1999.

name: Douro R de Romaneira
review: Medium-bodied, delivering red currant and roasted plum flavors that feature notes of green olive. The spicy finish offers good lift, with accents of hot stone.  Drink now through 2018. 2,500 cases made.

name: Douro Sino Da Romaneira
review: Concentrated flavors of blueberry, raspberry and red plum make for a juicy blend. Well-balanced and fresh, with a good structure. Slate and white pepper notes show on the lively finish. Drink now through 2018. 6,000 cases made.

name: Douro Sino Da Romaneira
review: Shows touches of elegance to the red plum, berry and spice flavors, supported by silky tannins. Presents concentrated cinnamon midpalate, with creamy notes that linger on the plush finish. Drink now through 2016. 6,250 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: Rich and very creamy, displaying concentrated pear, melon, apricot and apple tart flavors. Quite spicy on the fresh finish. Drink now through 2013. 100 cases imported.

name: Late Bottled Port Unfiltered
review: Medium-bodied, with very pretty sweet plum and berry aromas, medium sweetness and a chewy finish. There's almost a new wood character underneath. Needs a little bottle age to mellow. Best after 2012. 440 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Very sweet and grapey, with plum and cherry aromas and flavors. Full and soft, with medium sweetness and a straightforward finish. Best after 2014. 1,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Very grapey and jammy on the nose. Full-bodied, medium sweet, soft and caressing. Very well made, but a little short. Best after 2013.

name: Douro Rosé
review: A rich rosé, offering plenty of fresh, spicy wild berry and ripe cherry flavors. Meaty notes mark the finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Douro Sino da
review: This supple, medium-bodied red shows good definition to the red berry, cherry and wild plum flavors, which feature plenty of spice notes. Chocolaty finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro Sino Da Romaneira
review: A tangy profile of raspberry and boysenberry flavors is accented by mineral and floral elements. Moderate tannins give texture to the crisp, herb-tinged finish. Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional. Drink now through 2020. 6,500 cases made.

name: Ruby Port Fine
review: Milk chocolate and sweet berry flavors mix easily in this balanced, fruity version. Notes of sandalwood and spice emerge on the finish. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old
review: Crisp, with good structure to the hazelnut cream and dried berry flavors. Finishes with notes of roasted almond. Drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Medium-bodied, with mineral and white pepper accents to the roasted plum and dried cherry flavors. Features portobello mushroom on the finish. Drink now.

name: Palmela Tradição
review: Dense and backward, with a firm structure and plenty of roasted flavors and red cherry notes. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Earthy and well structured, showing aging potential. Medium to deep purple, with earthy grape aromas, full-bodied, with lots of tannins and a good depth of earthy fruit flavors.

name: Arinto Bucelas
review: Modest white, with simple melon and herbal flavors, with some mineral notes on the finish. 5,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Very rustic in style. Medium ruby, with an earthy licorice nose, medium-bodied, with round tannins, good fruit flavors and some grip on the finish.

name: Arinto Bucelas
review: A crisp, juicy white, with lemon curd and cream flavors and notes of almond and spice. Touches of richness on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 20,000 cases made.

name: Arinto Lisboa Prova Régia
review: Lively yet focused, this light-bodied white delivers crispy peach and apple flavors strung together by mineral and herb accents and a beam of acidity. Offers a lingering, salty finish. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Palmela Tradição
review: Zin-like, with berry and plummy flavors, notes of pepper and spice. Medium-bodied, with some pretty blueberry notes on the finish. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Arinto Bucelas
review: Clean and focused white, with flavors of mineral and peach. Herbal notes bring focus to the finish. Nice aperitif. Drink now. 5,750 cases made.

name: Moscatel Graúdo-Arinto Estremadura Calhandriz
review: Aromatic white, crisp and fresh, with flavors of white peach, nutmeg and a touch of honey. Would be a fine aperitif. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Moscatel-Arinto Estremadura Calhandriz
review: Fruity aroma, with zippy citrus and green peach flavors, and notes of smoke and spice on the finish. Drink now. 11,000 cases made.

name: Arinto Bucelas
review: Crisp fruity white, with lemon and peach flavors, and mineral notes on the finish. Drink now. 2,750 cases made.

name: Palmela Tradição
review: Smooth and supple, with dried plum and leather flavors and hints of clove and cinnamon. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Estremadura Prova Régia
review: Plum, berry and pepper flavors are nicely balanced in this medium-bodied red, which has tobacco leaf notes on the finish.  Drink now through 2004. 2,205 cases made.

name: Arinto Bucelas
review: Lemon and citrus flavors dominate this light white. Salt and pepper notes on the finish. Drink now.

name: Arinto Bucelas
review: Medium-bodied, with pear and apple flavors, and a touch of citrus on the finish. Drink now. 17,000 cases made.

name: Arinto Bucelas
review: A straightforward white, with toasty pear and spice flavors and a touch of richness. Drink now.

name: Brut Bucelas
review: Straightforward and on the rustic side, with floral aromas and baked apple flavor. Drink now.

name: Bucelas Morgado de Sta.-Catherina
review: Exaggerated style, with buttery and spicy flavors, which linger on the tangy finish. Drink now. 2,750 cases made.

name: Arinto Bucelas
review: This soft white offers broad, rather flat flavors of beeswax and almonds, with just enough lemony acidity to give it a refreshing edge. 17,000 cases made.

name: Bucelas Morgado de Sta.-Catherina
review: Lumbering and heavy on the toast, with decent ripe pear and apple flavors that turn cloying on the finish.

name: Bucelas Morgado de Sta.-Catherina
review: A rustic white with toasty flavors, turning cloying on the finish.

name: Bucelas Morgado de Sta.-Catherina
review: This has apple flavors, butter notes and a somewhat coarse finish. 1,200 cases made.

name: Bucelas Morgado de Sta.-Catherina
review: An exaggerated style. Quite caramellike in taste, with waxy, doughy and spicy flavors. 1,200 cases made.

name: Estremadura Aristocrata
review: A light red with some plummy flavors, which turn a bit stemmy on the finish.

name: Palmela Tradição
review: Fading dried cherry and rhubarb flavors dominate this mature red. Past its prime. 6,000 cases made.

name: Palmela Tradição
review: A stale edge overwhelms the modest cherry and berry flavors. Castelão. 15,000 cases made.

name: Palmela Tradição
review: Rustic yet alluring, with firm, almost mature flavors of dried cherry, smoke and spice. Good balance and structure, with pepper, mineral and leather on the finish.  Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Douro Cado
review: Medium-bodied. Good plum and smoke flavors turn ripe on the finish, with vanilla and mincemeat notes.  Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Estremadura Lomedo
review: Ripe, black fruit aroma, with flavors to match. Balanced, with interesting smoked meat and raspberry notes extending into the finsh. Drink with pork or game.  Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Alentejo Gaião
review: A ripe, muscular red, showing flavors of dark plum and espresso, with hints of mushroom. Tannic, with a lively spiciness on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 16,000 cases made.

name: Alentejo Portas da Herdade
review: Medium-bodied, with plum and berry flavors, followed by tobacco box notes on finish. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Arinto Bucelas Prova Régia
review: This has a nice juiciness, with plenty of green peach flavors followed by tropical fruit notes on the finish. Drink now. 8,900 cases made.

name: Douro Chã
review: Rich and ripe, with fresh, concentrated flavors of dark plum, cherry and spice. The long, lush finish features plenty of notes of dark chocolate, backed up by medium-grained tannins. Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2015. 225 cases made.

name: Dão
review: Intense aromas and flavors of red plum and berry provide a fresh juiciness that's alluring and delicious. There's a good grip of tannins on the finish. A fine match for roasted poultry. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Dão Reserva
review: Very fresh and lively, with an array of red plum, cherry, currant and spice flavors that make this a good quaff for the barbecue. Crisp finish. Drink now through 2009. 350 cases made.

name: Dão
review: Full-bodied and firm, with plenty of red currant, red plum and berry flavors that are supported by a muscular frame. Finish lingers with smoke and spice. Drink now through 2009. 400 cases made.

name: Dão Porta Fronha
review: Straightforward, with some plum and berry flavors that linger with tobacco leaf notes on the finish.  Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Douro Qta. Velha Grande Reserva
review: Intense kirschlike aromas, with flavors of dark plum, cherry, currant and spice, fill this full-bodied red, which features a zesty finish of cardamom, chocolate and mocha. Drink now through 2014. 200 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Very supple, with elegant, silky flavors of red cherry, plum, berry and mocha. The finish is a bit tight, with plenty of tannins and notes of dark chocolate. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde Arca Nova
review: Richly flavored, with buttery notes to the plush, juicy ripe apple and pear flavors. There's a light honey and spice element on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde Arca Nova
review: Exhibits bright apple and rich citrus flavors, with plenty of spritz. The juicy finish features melon and pepper notes. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde Arca Nova
review: This shows good definition to the mineral, peach and apricot flavors, which linger with touches of richness on the spicy finish. Fresh and crisp. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Alvarinho Minho Arca Nova
review: A taut style, with graphite and mineral notes to the green peach and crunchy apple flavors. The crisp finish features hints of smoke. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Loureiro Vinho Verde Arca Nova
review: Lots of citrusy notes join the crunchy green apple, peach and melon flavors. Light accents of nutmeg mark the juicy finish. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde Arca Nova
review: This fresh and fruity white from Potrugal has a slight spritz, with zesty flavors of peach, citrus and melon followed by a zippy finish. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde Arca Nova
review: Slightly spritzy, with peach and citrus flavors. A touch rustic on the finish. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde Arca Nova
review: A light, pleasant white, showing citrus and peach flavors, with smoky notes on the finish.  300,000 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde Arca Nova
review: On the tart side, with canned fruit flavors and a flat finish. 50,000 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde Arca Nova
review: Yeasty, sour smell. Tastes malty.  100,000 cases made.

name: Bruto Natural Portugal Reserva
review: A firm sparkler, laced with gingerbread spices and flavors of apple pastry and quince. There's enough richness for balance, and a lingering finish of sour cherry, almond and smoke. Drink now through 2013. 200 cases imported.

name: Bairrada Reserva
review: Snappy red, almost spritzy, with red plum and leafy flavors, and a good wallop of tannins on the finish.  Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Douro Passagem Reserva
review: A sumptuous and luscious red, with a briary character to the rich dark and red fruit flavors, layered with savory and minerally notes. Medium-grained tannins emerge on the supple finish, accented by cream and cocoa powder details. Drink now through 2020. 750 cases made.

name: Douro White Passagem Reserva
review: An elegant and well-spiced white, with unctuous pear, apricot tart and ripe apple flavors that feature lush buttery accents. Pastry notes linger on the long and rich finish. Drink now through 2020. 500 cases made.

name: Douro Passagem Reserva
review: Violet notes accent the plush dark cherry and blackberry flavors in this refined, pure red. Sanguine details show midpalate, with a finish that offers spice and bittersweet chocolate elements. Drink now through 2020. 500 cases made.

name: Douro Passagem The Crossing
review: Robust, with well-structured flavors of roasted plum, coffee and dried berry, backed up by plenty of zesty acidity. Features violet and spiced cherry on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 300 cases made.

name: Douro Passagem The Crossing Reserva
review: Suave, with violet notes to berry, currant and red plum flavors that feature touches of richness and elegance. Elegant and well-structured finish of light smoke and spice. Drink now through 2016. 250 cases made.

name: Douro Passagem
review: Very juicy and crisp up front, showing red plum and berry flavors that are backed up by fresh acidity, with milk chocolate and spice on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Douro Passagem The Crossing Reserva
review: Dried cherry and berry flavors mix harmoniously in this supple, balanced red, which shows lots of plum pudding notes, with a finish filled with mocha and spice. Drink now through 2015. 250 cases made.

name: Douro White Passagem The Crossing
review: Lots of gingery notes join the ripe apple and guava flavors. Hints of honey cream mark the finsh, which features savory herb accents. Drink now. 260 cases made.

name: Tawny Port Very Old
review: Walnut and hazelnut husk notes streak through this intense Port, followed quickly by racy dried orange peel, date, brown sugar, powdered ginger and green tea flavors. The long finish has terrific tension and drive, with a twinge of iodine adding lift and cut. Exotic and beautiful. Contains a majority of wine from 1867, blended with 7 percent wine from 1900. Drink now. 21 cases made.

name: Douro Vinhas Velhas
review: Rich and complex, with plenty of power to the fresh and pure-tasting flavors of dark currant, red plum and dried blackberry. Concentrated minerality lingers on the finish, showing hints of cocoa powder and white pepper. Best after 2022. 1,100 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: A powerful, refined and minerally white from Portugal, with concentrated apple, pear and lemon drop flavors, accented by plenty of rich, smoky notes. Anise and savory herbal details show midpalate, leading to a ripe, cream-filled finish. Drink now through 2022. 1,500 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old
review: Refined and richly spicy, offering luxuriantly creamy flavors of dried apricot, dried meat, roasted plum and butterscotch. The suave finish is long and rich, with vibrant minerality. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Features plenty of grip to the blackberry, dark plum and raspberry flavors, loaded with Asian spice notes. Hints of dried mint show on dark chocolate-filled finish. Best from 2020 through 2030. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro Vinhas Velhas
review: A big, generous red, offering well-sculpted flavors of red currant, crushed red plum and dried berry, all flanked by notes of mineral and white pepper. Paprika accents show on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 2,000 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Redolent of red currant and dark plum, this offers plenty of violet and leafy accents that are textbook Touriga. Sinewy tannins show on the finish, presenting notes of cocoa powder and spice. Drink now through 2019. 5,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A medium-bodied red, with supple, concentrated raspberry, strawberry and plum flavors well-accented by spice, anise and mineral details. Herb and floral aromas mark the finish. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz. Drink now through 2022. 5,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A lush and juicy red, with hints of red licorice to the flavors of raspberry, plum tart and red currant. Notes of slate and white pepper show midpalate. This finishes with cigar box and leafy overtones. Drink now through 2019. 5,000 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: A fruity style, showing good grip and length to the flavors of cherry, crushed plum and raspberry. Notes of baker's chocolate and slate linger on the rich and spicy finish. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Floral and savory spice notes accent the fresh-crushed cherry and plum tart flavors in this late bottled Port, which delivers crisp acidity, with a finish that offers hints of spice and white pepper. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Tawny Port Reserva
review: This is suave, with baked plum, cherry tart and brick flavors that are rich and well-rounded. The spicy finish offers engaging minerality. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Tinta Francisca Douro
review: Concentrated cherry and fresh-crushed plum flavors are zesty, filled with juniper berry notes. Cedary accents show midpalate, leading to a lithe finish of forest floor. Drink now through 2019. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,000 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Supple but tightly knit, this focused red offers blackberry and currant fruit woven together with black olive, anise and grilled herb accents. Black tea and mineral notes chime in on the firm finish. Drink now through 2022. 7,500 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Ripe and richly spiced, with plenty of inky notes to the dark plum, dried blackberry and cherry tart flavors, accented by graphite hints. The lush finish is filled with dark chocolate and cream nuances. Drink now through 2020. 800 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Very suave, with notes of forest floor to the powerful red and dark fruit flavors, supported by firm acidity and ripe tannins. The lithe, minerally finish is long and rich, filled with concentrated accents of paprika and spice. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: This has a smoky edge and plenty of mocha notes to the burly flavors of roasted plum and dark cherry. Chocolate and spice details linger on the finish, with some peppery details. Drink now through 2035. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: The fresh-crushed red fruit flavors are full of pepper and spice notes. Juicy midpalate, with a lively finish that lingers with violet and floral accents. Drink now through 2018. 1,500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Concentrated red currant and raspberry flavors are backed by crisp acidity in this medium-bodied red. Violet and forest floor notes linger on the tannic finish. Drink now through 2019. 5,000 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: A vibrant style, redolent of violet, cherry and plum flavors, this is laced with fresh acidity. Slate and chocolate notes linger on the finish, with plenty of pepper nuances. Drink now through 2020. 3,000 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old
review: This offers concentrated red plum and dried cherry flavors that feature plenty of cocoa powder notes. The finish is fresh and well-spiced. Drink now. 2,300 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old
review: Velvety and lush, with notes of cinnamon and maple to the bright plum, cherry and boysenberry flavors. Almond and citrus zest accents linger on the crisp, spicy finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Supple-edged and maturing nicely, with notes of cinnamon, warm raisin bread and toffee holding sway over a core of gently mulled plum and currant fruit. The finish has toffee and singed sandalwood accents. This is among the more approachable '97s right now.--1997 Vintage Port retrospective (January 2017). Drink now through 2026. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A full-bodied, creamy red, with bright flavors of red currant, cherry and spice that linger midpalate. Finishes with milk chocolate accents. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: This open-knit, full-bodied red packs in blueberry, boysenberry and pomegranate fruit underscored by licorice, soy sauce and mineral details. Integrated tannins show grip on the finish. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz. Drink now through 2020. 5,000 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Robust, with a light charcoal frame around steeped plum, blueberry and blackberry fruit flavors. Warm cobbler details underscore the finish, while a licorice root note lingers. Drink now through 2024. 5,000 cases made.

name: Ruby Port Reserva
review: Supple, with notes of chocolate and spice to the plum tart and dark cherry flavors. Clean and spicy on the finish. Drink now. 2,100 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old
review: Shows notes of underbrush to the dried plum and roasted cherry flavors. Graphite and spice accents show on the finish, with bittersweet chocolate details. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: The red plum and raspberry flavors are short and sweet in this straightforward style. Chewy tannins show on the finish, bolstered by graphite notes. Drink now through 2022. 300 cases made.

name: Douro QV
review: A lithe and minerally style, with notes of slate and tar to the crushed red fruit flavors. The juicy finish has some floral accents. Drink now. 10,500 cases made.

name: Douro QV
review: A sinewy red, with leather, earth and tobacco notes to the dried berry and roasted plum flavors. Forest floor accents show on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 5,000 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: This has plenty of smoky notes to the dried pear, baked apple and ripe melon flavors. Buttery and spicy on the finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Tawny Port Reserva
review: The roasted plum, sweet cherry and buttery notes are supple and fresh, with nutmeg accents lingering on the finish, accented by citrus peel hints. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Douro QV
review: Flavors of slate and dried berry are accented by notes of white pepper in this firm style. Mocha and spice details show on the broad finish. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Douro QV
review: A taut style, with flavors of dried plum and dark currant, carrying plenty of iron and graphite notes. Chewy tannins show on the crisp finish. Drink now through 2017. 5,000 cases made.

name: Ruby Port Reserva
review: This had dense flavors of dark plum, dried cherry and graphite that feature powerful tannins. Bittersweet chocolate notes show on the finish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Jaén Dão
review: Medium-bodied, with red cherry and spicy flavors that linger on the broad finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Encruzado Dão
review: This distinct white has a broad profile, sporting mineral, warm apple and dried pear aromas that are well-spiced and supported by solid acidity. Beeswax and almond skin elements line the finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,500 cases made.

name: Estremadura
review: Mature red offering decent plum, chocolate and cherry flavors. It finishes on a dried fruit note. 4,000 cases made.

name: Alenquer White
review: There are some nice mineral and stony notes in this medium-bodied white from Portugal, mixed in with assertive grapefruit and green apple flavors. This is a clean-tasting, well-structured wine with plenty of backbone; drink with fish. Drink now through 2000.

name: Alenquer
review: Aromas and flavors of kirsch and cassis dominate this fun, easy to drink red. Firms up a bit on the finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Alenquer
review: Sweet cherry and spice flavors dominate this quaffable red. Medium-bodied and exuberant, with some cola and cardamom notes on the finish. Drink now.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Powerful, rich and robust, with concentrated flavors of dark chocolate, dark plum and mocha. There's plenty of lift on the finish, with loads of spice, pepper, smoke and cream. Distinctive. Drink now through 2012. 2,250 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Lush, suave red, with deep layers of crushed red fruit, blackberry and cassis flavors, with delicious mineral and tobacco notes. Firmly structured, with a lingering finish of French roast and dark chocolate. Should age nicely. Best from 2006 through 2009. 250 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: This red shows beautiful mineral notes spiraling through cherry and red plum fruit. Fresh pine and floral accents add a graceful approach to the long finish, supported by firm, youthful tannins. Best from 2019 through 2025. 875 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A crisp and minerally red, with dark cherry, raspberry and blackberry flavors that feature a heady snap of licorice and Asian spice. Dark chocolate notes on the luscious and creamy finish.  Drink now through 2020. 600 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: An elegant red, packed full of red raspberry, cherry and blackberry flavors that are crisp and nuanced, with plenty of rich, spicy notes. The lip-smacking finish is filled with chocolate-covered cherry, mocha and pepper  notes. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, Tinta Barroca, Touriga Franca and Tinto Cão. Best from 2016 through . 1,250 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: An elegant, supple red with a lively core dark of cherry, damson plum and blackberry. Powerfully structured, with a long, firm finish filled with plenty of graphite and pepper. Drink now through 2012. 150 cases imported.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Lovely fruity aroma, with effusive flavors of red cherry, berry and spice. A well-structured and fresh-tasting red that is hard to resist. Drink now through 2007. 6,000 cases made.

name: Douro Flor das Tecedeiras
review: Red berry and dark chocolate flavors extend with plenty of creamy notes. The spicy finish is lush and juicy. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Barroca, Tinta Roriz, and Tinto Cão. Drink now through 2015. 5,000 cases made.

name: Alenquer
review: A luscious wine with good fruit flavors of plum and black cherry with notes of cinnamon and vanilla that build through to the finish. It is well balanced and rich. Drink now. 2,665 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde
review: A light white, with fresh and zesty lemon-lime flavors. Very clean and vibrant, showing some saline notes on the finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Dão Reserva
review: Intense and rich, with a deep well of dark plum, dried blackberry and dried beef flavors, featuring plenty of leafy and underbrush notes. Focused midpalate, with Asian spice and slate details. Drink now through 2024. 17,000 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Dão
review: Rich, powerful and sculpted red, with a Rhone-like, leathery aroma and loads of dark plum, dark cherry and smoky flavors. This has plenty of muscle and fine tannins, which combine seamlessly with leathery and spicy notes on the finish. Best from 2003 through 2007. 3,000 cases made.

name: Dão
review: A crisp and minerally red, with concentrated flavors of dark cherry, roasted plum and dried raspberry, layered with rich, spicy notes. White chocolate details show on the finish, accented by hints of pepper. Drink now through 2020. 208,000 cases made.

name: Dão
review: A well-structured, muscular red, with a touch of Asian spice to the wild plum and dried raspberry flavors. Beef and mineral notes mark the finish. Distinctive, with a very sauvage allure. Drink now through 2015. 10,000 cases imported.

name: Dão 25
review: An elegant red, with peppery notes to the red plum and raspberry flavors that lengthen out with hints of sandalwood. The zesty finish is fresh and juicy. Drink now through 2019. 208 cases made.

name: Dão c Virgílio Loureiro
review: Full-bodied and refined, with a rich, smoky aroma and lip-smacking flavors of blackberry, cassis and spice. An interesting mix of international style and traditional flavors. Finish is filled with notes of tobacco, chocolate and spice. Drink now through 2005. 1,500 cases made.

name: Dão Escolha
review: Gorgeous aroma of violets, anise and crushed berry introduces this intense and exotic red. Dark plum, cassis and blackberry flavors dominate, framed by loads of structure and tannins. French roast and mineral notes fill the finish. Needs just a touch of age to integrate. Best from 2006 through 2008. 665 cases made.

name: Dão Licoroso Ímpar
review: Reminiscent of tawny Port, with plenty of hazelnut, cream and roasted peach flavors, this is loaded with seductive buttery notes. The structured finish is spicy and long, showing white chocolate elements. Drink now. 380 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Dão
review: Very lively and peppery, with gobs of red plum, cherry and mineral notes. Essence of Touriga, unalloyed by oak and very well-structured. The crunchy, juicy finish completes the package. Drink now through 2013. 416 cases made.

name: Dão
review: A focused red, with minerally cut to the dried cherry and wild plum flavors that feature interesting savory herbal notes. The lithe finish is juicy and well-structured. Drink now through 2015. 15,000 cases imported.

name: Dão Reserva
review: Rich and full-bodied, delivering luscious dark plum, raspberry and lingonberry flavors that are still fresh and vibrant. Snappy licorice and spice fill the ripe finish, with hints of dark chocolate. Drink now through 2016. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Dão Reserva
review: Ripe, with rich, dark plum and mocha flavors. The spicy finish oozes dark chocolate and smoke notes. Drink now through 2012. 6,000 cases made.

name: Dão Reserva
review: Lush and ripe, with a hint of maturity. Full-bodied, with plenty of dark plum, baker's chocolate and raspberry flavors backed up by supple tannins and plenty of spice. Flavors linger with cola notes on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 300 cases imported.

name: Dão Reserva
review: Fresh-tasting for its age, with red plum and berry flavors and a dollop of cigar box. Distinctive, with mineral elements and alluring brick notes. Elegant finish of spice and cream. Touriga Nacional, Alfrocheiro and Tinta Roriz. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Dão White
review: Juicy and fruit-forward, with flavors of passion fruit, melon and red peach that offer a firm minerally streak. Spicy and elegant, showing hints of smoke. Drink now through 2019. 33,333 cases made.

name: Encruzado Dão
review: A firm and taut white, with flavors of pear tart, dried apple and tangerine, supported by fresh acidity. The well-structured finish lingers with ginger and allspice details. Drink now through 2018. 34,000 cases made.

name: Dão
review: Well-defined red fruit flavors of cherry, plum and raspberry are supported by fresh acidity and some meaty richness. Spicy finish. Drink now through 2011. 48,000 cases made.

name: Dão
review: Crisp, well-structured red, with hearty berry, plum and mineral flavors, with notes of savory herbs. Smoke and spice elements give a good lift to the finish. Drink now through 2007. 10,000 cases imported.

name: Dão Reserva
review: Notes of raspberry preserves, red plum and flowers have a zesty edge in this plump, tangy red. Licorice snap and sweet spice details linger into the lip-smacking finish. Drink now. 16,750 cases made.

name: Dão Rosé
review: Crisp and minerally, with notes of dried green herbs to the dried raspberry, fresh-cut apple and peach flavors. Hints of juniper show on the finish. Drink now. 4,166 cases made.

name: Dão Superior
review: Ripe red, with concentrated currant, red plum and smoke flavors. Forward tannins, with mineral and appealing earth and beef bouillon notes.  Drink now through 2006. 6,500 cases made.

name: Dão White
review: This has some floral notes to the fruity and juicy flavors of dried apple, lavender and green peach. Lots of lanolin in the midpalate, with a finish that lengthens out nicely, with lemon curd accents.  Drink now through 2018. 34,000 cases made.

name: Dão White Reserva
review: A juicy white, with plenty of peach, fresh-cut apple and dried apricot flavors. Bright acidity lingers on the finish, showing some flinty notes. Drink now through 2018. 3,333 cases made.
