name: Touriga Nacional Dão
review: Dried berry and grilled plum notes are matched to fresh earth and herbal accents in this zesty red. Peppery details linger on the grippy finish. Drink now. 1,750 cases made.

name: Dão Reserva
review: A minerally red, with violet overtones to the red plum and berry flavors. Hints of cream mark the spice- and licorice-laced finish. Drink now through 2013. 10,000 cases made.

name: Dão Rosé
review: Fresh raspberry and spice flavors are bright and lively in this crisp rosé, with notes of cream on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Dão White
review: Creamy peach and apple notes have a salty undertone in this medium-bodied white, with spice and floral aromas. Herbal details linger into the finish. Solid acidity. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Dão
review: Muscular, medium- to full-bodied red, with plenty of stuffing as well. This has firm flavors of red currant, plum and spice, with appealing herbal notes on the finish. Tempting now, but best to wait. Best from 2003 through 2006.

name: Dão
review: Plum and blackberry flavors weave together with dark chocolate, black olive and herbal elements in this open-knit red. Spice notes add detail to the moderate, mineral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2020. 210,000 cases made.

name: Dão White
review: Offers lots of savory herb overtones to the broad flavors of apple, gooseberry and Asian pear, with minerally notes on the finish. Cerceal, Encruzado, Bical, and Malvasia Fina. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Bruto Dão
review: A light-bodied sparkler, featuring subtle notes of ripe yellow apple, white peach and smoke. This is lightly creamy, with a delicate, floral finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Dão
review: Notes of iron and stone fill this medium-bodied, mellow-tasting red, with baker's chocolate and spice lingering on the finish. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Dão Reserva
review: Medium-bodied, with berry, savory herb and baker's chocolate flavors, followed by a mineral- and iodine-filled finish. Drink now. 39,000 cases made.

name: Dão White
review: Light on its feet, with lively candied ginger flavors as well as plenty of apricot and pear notes. Soft finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Dão White
review: Very fresh, with crunchy mineral, apple and pear flavors. Notes of nutmeg on the fresh finish. Drink now. 60,000 cases made.

name: Encruzado Dão
review: Ripe tropical fruit flavors dominate this medium-bodied white, which features notes of mineral and spice that linger on the firm finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Malvasia-Fina Dão
review: This refreshing white has good, firm green peach and slate flavors. Smoky and spicy notes chime in on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Alfrocheiro Preto Dão
review: Leathery aromas and flavors, accented by dried cherry tones, give this red a rustic edge. Drying tannins on the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Bruto Dão
review: A fruity bubbly, with red currant and cherry flavors that turn a touch cloying on the finish.  Drink now. 34,000 cases made.

name: Dão White
review: Canned fruit flavors dominate this somewhat simple, cloying white. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Bical-Cerceal Dão
review: Straightforward. Tart, with lemon and lime flavors that linger on the finish. 2,000 cases made.

name: Dão
review: Medium-bodied, with plum and berry flavors, which turn astringent on the finish. 25,000 cases made.

name: Encruzado Dão
review: A bit meager. Decent apple and citrus flavors, but they turn quite tart on the finish. 2,200 cases made.

name: Lisboa CH
review: A spicy, rich and open-textured red, with a lively minerality to the dried raspberry, red plum and dark chocolate flavors. Features firm acidity, with a finish that lingers with pepper and spice accents. Drink now through 2018. 150 cases made.

name: Lisboa Vinha Mãe
review: A minerally and powerfully fruity red, with dense dark plum, boysenberry and black licorice flavors. Asian spice and graphite notes fill the firm and pure finish, accented by hints of cacao nib. Drink now through 2020. 453 cases made.

name: Estremadura
review: Ripe, rich and full-bodied, with nicely concentrated dark plum, chocolate truffle and raspberry flavors. Luscious, lively finish of cocoa and hints of mint. Impressive for the appellation. Drink now through 2008. 600 cases made.

name: Estremadura Reserva
review: Full-bodied and full-flavored Portuguese red, with concentrated dark plum, chocolate and kirsch elements that are supported by medium-grained tannins and plenty of spicy notes. Finish drips with mocha and creamy notes. Drink now through 2012. 600 cases made.

name: Estremadura Reserva
review: An elegant red from an up-and-coming region. Intense and pure-tasting, with raspberry, red plum and red cherry flavors that are flanked by refined spicy notes. The luscious finish shows licorice and cocoa. Drink now through 2011. 600 cases made.

name: Lisboa
review: Intense red berry and crushed red plum flavors are supported by fresh acidity and firm tannins. Shows good grip midpalate, featuring a finish loaded with slate, graphite and pepper accents. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, Castelão, Touriga Franca and Alicante Bouschet. Drink now through 2020. 2,790 cases made.

name: Lisboa CH
review: A medium-bodied and buoyantly fruity red, with flavors of raspberry, blueberry and red plum, supported by firm acidity. Vanilla and spice notes show on the finish. Touriga Nacional. Drink now.

name: Lisboa Mar de Lisboa Atlantic Coast
review: Balanced, fresh and loaded, with fresh-crushed red fruit flavors that include plum, dark cherry and raspberry. The medium-grained tannins turn silky on the lush finish, which features cream and dark chocolate notes. Suave. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Estremadura
review: Rich and ripe, with delicious dark plum, blackberry and cassis flavors. Iron-clad structure, with mineral and chocolate on the finish. Drink now through 2011. 2,500 cases made.

name: Lisboa
review: Redolent of blueberry preserves, this red offers mouthcoating acidity and tannins. Tar and kirsch flavors combine to give this a ripe allure. The finish is filled with spice and baker's chocolate details. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional, Castelão, Syrah and Alicante Bouschet. Drink now through 2017.

name: Lisboa Reserva
review: A well-focused, muscular red, with firm dark fruit flavors of kirsch, blackberry and plum compote, showing dashes of dark chocolate and pepper. The suave finish lingers with cardamom and sinew. Drink now through 2017.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Estremadura
review: A lithe Cabernet, with good definition and structure to the red plum and berry flavors. The tannic finish features savory herbal notes. Drink now through 2010. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Estremadura
review: Well-crafted and nicely structured, with pure-tasting red plum, berry and beef flavors that linger on the crisp, fresh finish. Impressive balance and focus with cru bourgeois quality. Drink now through 2010. 470 cases made.

name: Estremadura
review: Suave and robust, with a well of dark plum and kirsch flavors enlivened by supple Asian spice notes. The plush finish features dark chocolate and sweet cherry. Drink now through 2012. 3,500 cases made.

name: Estremadura
review: Firm and focused, with a heady aroma and lively blueberry and red plum flavors. Notes of meat and spice on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 330 cases made.

name: Lisboa
review: Lively and exuberantly fruity, with blueberry, red plum and raspberry flavors backed by plenty of fresh acidity. Firm tannins show on the lithe finish, with hints of graphite. Drink now through 2017. 2,000 cases made.

name: Lisboa CH
review: This offers plenty of fresh acidity and tannins behind the dark currant, red cherry and plum tart flavors. Cedary notes linger on the finish.  Drink now through 2018. 431 cases made.

name: Lisboa Vinha Mãe
review: A fruity aroma leads to flavors of boysenberry, red plum and raspberry in this red, backed by zesty acidity. Asian spice and cocoa powder notes linger on the juicy finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Lisboa White Reserva
review: A buttery, seductive style, with apple pastry notes flanked by cherry and white chocolate. Dried mango lingers on the broad finish. Drink now. 340 cases made.

name: Alenquer
review: Good intensity and concentration to this full-bodied red. Dark plum and tobacco leaf notes dominate, with firm tannins on the dark chocolate finish.  Drink now through 2008. 1,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Estremadura
review: Well-defined crushed red fruit flavors, including plum and cherry, fill this lively red. Fresh, mineral-filled finish. Drink now through 2011. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Estremadura
review: Firm, taut red, in a cru bourgeois style with finely crafted flavors of red plum and berry, with some cigar box notes on the finish. Should age nicely. Drink now through 2009. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Lisboa
review: A savory red, showing some herbal notes to the red plum and wild berry flavors. The firm finish delivers notes of granite, with chewy tannins. Drink now through 2015.

name: Estremadura
review: This vibrant red shows raspberry, blueberry and red plum flavors, with appealing shadings of graphite and smoke. Finishes with olive and chocolate. Drink now. 3,700 cases made.

name: Estremadura White
review: Very crisp, in a Sancerre style, with concentrated flavors of Granny Smith apple, lime and grapefruit. Finishes with slate, white pepper and sea salt. Drink now through . 500 cases made.

name: Lisboa Mar de Lisboa Atlantic Coast
review: Well-spiced, with snappy notes of white pepper and nutmeg to the lively blueberry and blackberry flavors. The supple finish shows hints of vanilla and chocolate. Drink now.

name: Arinto Lisboa
review: There's lots of citrusy freshness in this snappy white, which features lemon-lime, green apple and snap pea flavors. The crisp finish delivers some spicy notes. Drink now. 880 cases made.

name: Lisboa White Reserva
review: A buttery-tasting white, with ripe apple and melon flavors that are supple and well-spiced. Marshmallow notes show on the broad finish. Chardonnay with Viosinho. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Arinto Lisboa
review: Herb and lemongrass flavors give this white a buoyant appeal. Saline and mineral notes emerge on the finish. Drink now.

name: Arinto Lisboa
review: A floral aroma leads to ripe apple and peach flavors that feature plenty of spicy and creamy accents. The fresh finish is crisp and juicy. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Castelão Lisboa
review: Redolent of raspberry jam, this red is straightforward and fruity. The spicy finish has some melon notes. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Estremadura White Reserva
review: Minerally white, with an interesting array of baked fruit flavors such as pineapple, apple and pear. Finishes with rich spicy notes. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Lisboa Mar da Palha
review: An inky red, with dense flavors of dark plum and blackberry, with some maple overtones. Mincemeat notes mark the finish. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Syrah. Drink now. 760 cases made.

name: Lisboa White
review: A firm white, with stony notes to the green peach and apple flavors that turn richly spiced on the juicy finish. Viosinho, Sauvignon Blanc and Arinto. Drink now. 390 cases made.

name: Lisboa CH
review: Very spicy, with hints of sweetness to the dark plum and wild cherry flavors. Oaky finish. Drink now.

name: Lisboa White Reserva
review: Ripe and aromatic, with peach, dried apple and mango flavors, ending on a custard note. Drink now.

name: Avesso Vinho Verde
review: A minerally white, with lots of tropical fruit notes to the peach and green apple flavors. The spicy finish has touches of richness.  Drink now through 2018. 2,500 cases made.

name: Minho Rosé
review: The dried berry and currant flavors are firm and well-rounded in this rosé. Stony notes on the muscular finish.  Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Minho White
review: A rich, vibrant white from northern Portugal, offering ripe apple and tropical fruit flavors, with rich, spicy notes. The finish is filled with melon and spice. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Minho
review: An inky red, showing intense red plum and blueberry flavors, with notes of graphite on the spicy finish. Excellent match for pork chops. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Minho White
review: Fruity, with touches of richness. Has pretty peach and Granny Smith flavors, with vanilla and spice. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Minho White Colheita Seleccionada
review: Ripe and robust, displaying loads of tropical fruit flavors and lots of smoky notes, with a very spicy finish. Mature-tasting. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Minho Colheita Seleccionada
review: Medium-bodied, with red plum and berry flavors and a crisp finish featuring notes of savory herb. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Minho
review: Crisp red, with plum, red cherry and spice shadings. Beef bouillon notes on the finish.  Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Minho White Colheita Seleccionada
review: Medium-bodied white filled with caramel apple flavors and spicy notes, which linger on the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Rios do Minho White
review: Crisp and quite citrusy in taste, with good focus, a touch of richness and a clean finish.

name: Rios do Minho
review: Tart, with dried cherry flavors and cranberry overtones, with leather notes on the finish. Touriga Nacional, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Rios do Minho White
review: Lemon and citrus flavors. Dull finish. Chardonnay, Avesso and Gewürztraminer. 650 cases made.

name: Vinho de Mesa
review: A fruity aroma is followed by leather and gamelike flavors. Doesn't quite mesh.

name: Minho Colheita Seleccionada
review: Basic, with plum and berry flavors, with some green notes on the finish.  3,000 cases made.

name: Vinho de Mesa White
review: Thick and mature-tasting, with oddly decayed flavors, overripe notes of pear and apple. Comes off unbalanced. Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Avesso.

name: Minho White Colheita Seleccionada
review: Rustic, with lots of smoke and popcorn butter notes. Leesy finish. 800 cases made.

name: Loureiro Vinho Verde
review: A floral and juicy white, with ripe citrus, honeysuckle and honeydew melon flavors, backed by racy acidity. Creamy notes show on the rich finish. Drink now through 2018. 6,000 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde Superior
review: This has some spritzy notes to the green apple and citrus flavors. Savory details show on the fresh finish. Drink now. 17,000 cases made.

name: Douro White Reserva
review: Medium- to full-bodied, with decadent glazed apple and creamed peach flavors detailed with sweet spice and mineral elements. The solid acidity keeps this focused through the creamy, floral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2021. 500 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A dense but supple red, with ripe cherry and raspberry notes detailed with gingerbread, berry tea and olive accents, supported by full tannins and well-integrated acidity. Baking spice and mineral elements bind together on the finish. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2022. 1,000 cases made.

name: Beira Atlântico White
review: Richly spiced, with plenty of smokiness to the ripe apple and roasted peach flavors. Minerally and creamy midpalate, showing some dried herb details on the finish. Cerceal. Drink now through 2019. 450 cases made.

name: Beiras Santa Maria Vinhas Velhas
review: This shows good power to its flavors of blackberry, dark plum and wild cherry, which extend with plenty of smoky notes. Black olive and Asian spice accents linger on the rich finish. Impressive for the appellation. Baga. Drink now through 2018. 175 cases made.

name: Beiras Santa Maria Vinhas Velhas
review: Well-structured, featuring plenty of muscle behind the dark cherry-, plum- and violet-tinged flavors. Pure and minerally, with lots of crushed red fruits on the vibrant finish. Baga. Drink now through 2015. 400 cases made.

name: Beira Atlântico Vinhas Velhas de Santa Maria
review: This sinewy red offers well-defined flavors of candied plum, cherry and dried currant, with accents of cardamom. Hints of citrus zest show on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 300 cases made.

name: Beiras White
review: Distinctively spicy and rich, with ripe melon, apricot and tropical fruit flavors that feature a smoky essence. Rich notes of glazed fruit and spice mark the finish. Cerceal. Drink now through 2014. 165 cases made.

name: Beira Atlântico
review: Supple, with boysenberry and smoked almond flavors that impart easygoing allure. Tobacco leaf accents on the finish. Baga and Touriga Nacional. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Beira Atlântico
review: A juicy, medium- to full-bodied red packed with dark cherry, red plum and licorice notes that are fresh and spiced. Hints of herb and mineral match the moderate tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 2,500 cases made.

name: Beiras
review: A savory and brawny red, with roasted plum and dried cherry flavors, featuring inky and tarry notes. Offers a spicy, tannic finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Beiras
review: Sweet wood notes pervade this medium-bodied red, which features flavors of red berries that linger on the finish, with plenty of spice. Baga and Touriga Nacional. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Beiras White
review: Candied basil, baked pineapple and ripe melon flavors give this an exotic edge. Spiced finish. Drink now. 225 cases made.

name: Beiras Santa Maria Vinhas Velhas
review: Juicy and fresh-tasting, with berry, plum and cherry flavors. Soft, spicy finish. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Beiras
review: Taut, with dried plum and floral flavors that turn chewy on the finish. Baga and Touriga Nacional. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Beiras White
review: Mature, rustic style, with Sherry-like aromas and flavors. 25 cases imported.

name: Douro La Rosa Reserva
review: A powerful red, with a luscious spiced aroma and rich, ripe and intense flavors of blackberry, dark plum, boysenberry and black licorice. This is backed by plenty of fresh acidity, presenting a crisp finish filled with zesty spiced cherry notes. Drink now through 2022. 833 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Refined, with flavors of dark plum, dried blackberry, mineral and tar. This offers lively hints of dried mint, showing some cedary accents. Features impressive lift on the finish, accented by chocolate notes. Best from 2030 through 2060. 425 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Offers a spicy aroma, with luscious, well-knit flavors of dark plum and wild cherry. Pepper and milk chocolate notes show on the lush, spicy finish, featuring hints of dried mint. Drink now through 2040. 800 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: A creamy nose leads to effusively fruity flavors of raspberry and huckleberry, joined by accents of tangerine in the mix. Sweet, spicy cherry notes emerge on the crisp finish, which is filled with plenty of grip. Lip-smackingly fresh and juicy. Best from 2018 through 2038. 550 cases made.

name: Douro La Rosa Reserva
review: This plush red weaves pureed raspberry and cherry torte flavors together with cola, anise and floral details.  A mineral component lends definition to the minty finish. Drink now through 2022. 1,066 cases made.

name: Douro La Rosa Reserva
review: Lusciously spiced, with deep, rich flavors of dark cherry, plum tart and blackberry, backed by fresh acidity and medium-grained tannins. The long, creamy finish is filled with chocolate and slate notes. Drink now through 2020. 1,050 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Displays an intensely spicy aroma, with fresh, powerful flavors of red berries, plum and sage. Offers medium-grained tannins, with a firm midpalate of stone and iron, as well as baker's chocolate on the finish. Needs time. Best from 2011 through 2016. 200 cases imported.

name: Douro Reserva
review: There's precise focus and concentration to the raspberry, red cherry and blueberry flavors, which linger with minerally notes on the muscular frame. The rich, spicy finish is filled with buckets of cream and almond, completing the package. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca and Tinta Cão. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2012. 1,250 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Really raisiny, yet fresh and floral at the same time. Full-bodied and supersmooth, with fine tannins and a long, medium sweet finish. Sleek young Port. Best Vintage Port ever made here. Best after 2010. 1,200 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Just showing some maturity now, with grippy edges to the core of warm plum cake, blackberry cobbler and licorice root flavors, which meld slowly through the finish. Ends with Black Forest cake and Turkish coffee notes.--1997 Vintage Port retrospective (January 2017). Best from 2020 through 2035. 1,300 cases made.

name: Douro
review: An extracted, intense style, with plenty of red raspberry, mineral and chocolate flavors that are fringed by exotic Asian spice notes. The mouthfilling finish echoes the fruit and spice flavors, topped off by some cappuccino notes. Drink now through 2012. 5,000 cases made.

name: Douro La Rosa Reserva
review: A plush red, showing juicy flavors of dark plum, raspberry and dark currant, with concentrated Asian spice notes that are complex and alluring. The pure-tasting finish is filled with dark chocolate and cream accents. Drink now through 2019. 1,050 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A lush, spicy aroma leads to suave flavors of black currant, dark cherry and blackberry that are plush and well-spiced. The long finish is filled with chocolate and mocha. Drink now through 2017. 1,100 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Shows powerfully ripe and concentrated flavors of dark plum, mincemeat, red currant and spice. Intense dark chocolate notes come to the fore as well, with a minerally and peppery finish. Best from 2012 through 2018. 200 cases imported.

name: Douro White Reserva
review: Rich, succulent flavors of apple tart, pastry, salted almond and mineral blend easily with an engaging creaminess in this seductive white which offers light, smoky notes midpalate, with a long, lush finish filled with lively spiciness. Drink now through 2019. 1,830 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Beautiful aromas of plum and berries lead to a full body, with full sweetness and a very fine, silky tannin structure. Reserved on the palate now, but will deliver plenty of enjoyment with age. Best after 2017. 500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Currant, underbrush and boysenberry notes show a graphite undertone in this lithe red. Zesty acidity marks the peppercorn, grilled herb and pomegranate details on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 7,500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A big, strapping red, with well-rounded flavors of boysenberry and roasted plum, accented by concentrated spice and green olive notes. The finish lengthens out, with accents of dried beef and hoisin sauce. Drink now through 2018. 4,750 cases made.

name: Douro dou Rosa White
review: A vibrant and rich-tasting white, with plenty of baked apple, honey citrus and white currant flavors, supported by firm acidity. Intense minerality emerges on the spice- and cream-filled finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Rich and robust, with an inviting combination of red fruit flavors and notes of cardamom that are lithe and mouthfilling. Shows deft balance and clarity on the finish, which is filled with cocoa flavors. Drink now through 2007. 500 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: A rich, spicy and well-sculpted white, with good cut to the flavors of pineapple, mandarin orange and Bosc pear. This offers pastry notes midpalate, featuring accents of dried mint and shiso leaf on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,500 cases made.

name: Douro White Reserva
review: A powerful and structured white, with concentrated green plum, apple and gooseberry flavors. Hints of guava add an exotic element. Accents of anise and white pepper show on the firm finish. Drink now through 2020. 3,000 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Fruity and rich, offering red plum and dark cherry flavors that feature lip-smacking milk chocolate notes. The minerally finish is long and supple. Drink now through 2019. 2,500 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Smooth and well-rounded, showing rich notes of mocha and hints of caramel to the dark fruit and spice flavors. Lip-smacking chocolate mousse marks the finish. Drink now through 2020. 25 cases imported.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: This hip Port, which comes in a stout, clear bottle, shows delicate raspberry jam character on the nose, with some plum. Medium-bodied, with medium sweetness and a candied berry finish that turns fresh and balanced. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: This has shed the vibrancy of youth, showing light toffee and toasted sesame hints, backed by mulled plum, raisin, warm fruitcake and melted red licorice notes through the finish. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old Tonel No. 12
review: This is filled with plenty of peppery overtones to the dried white fruit and spice flavors. Chocolate and mincemeat notes mark the long finish. Drink now. 20 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Fresh and almost breezy in feel for Port, as violet and star anise notes lead the way, backed by rounded plum, blueberry and blackberry compote flavors. Open and inviting through the finish, with a nice echo of warm fruitcake. Best from 2020 through 2035. 700 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A spicy red, with a minerally spine supporting boysenberry, tea and underbrush flavors framed by integrated, moderate tannins. Currant and wild raspberry notes mesh with tangy acidity on the fresh, sandalwood-tinged finish. Drink now through 2023. 6,100 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Juicy, with notes of forest floor to the dark plum, dried savory herb and licorice snap flavors. Slate and white pepper details linger on the tannic finish. Drink now through 2019. 4,750 cases made.

name: Douro
review: There's a racy edge to this fresh red, with flavors of blackberry, dark plum and Asian spice. The supple finish lingers with hints of dark chocolate. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz. Drink now through 2016. 2,200 cases made.

name: Douro dou Rosa Red
review: Crisp, with a beam of fresh cherry and boysenberry fruit cutting through the savory dried herb, violet and dusty earth accents. Mouthwatering acidity and medium-grained tannins linger into the mineral-edged finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,500 cases made.

name: Douro dou Rosa Red
review: A lively, focused red, with concentrated flavors of dark currant, red plum and dried raspberry. Dried mint and tarragon notes emerge midpalate, followed by a powerfully crisp finish filled with dark chocolate accents. Drink now. 448 cases imported.

name: Douro dou Rosa White
review: Rich, with smoky aromas and flavors of ripe pear, citrus and baked apple. The decadently spiced finish shows some creamy notes. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro La Rosa Reserva
review: Delivers an aroma of rose petal, with well-proportioned spice and fruit flavors, including mincemeat, plum pudding and subtle cumin. The mocha and dark chocolate elements echo alongside some iron notes on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 833 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: An extracted style, showing intense flavors of dark cherry and raspberry, with plenty of minty notes. Fine-grained tannins support the chocolaty finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,200 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Nothing shy about this. Ripe and full-bodied, with a dense core of plum pudding and dark cherry flavors. Dark chocolate and French roast flavors extend on the finish. Drink now through 2006.

name: Douro White
review: Very rich, with a smoky aroma and ripe apple, pear and quince flavors that are well-integrated. There's lots of spice, with buttery notes. The long, stony finish is filled with squirts of lemon-lime. Drink now through 2013. 830 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Peppery, with red plum and dark cherry flavors that are firm and well-crafted. Chocolate and spice fill the fresh, fruit-forward finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: A fresh and juicy style, with medium-weight flavors of dark plum, cherry and dark currant matched to notes of mincemeat and chocolate mousse. Shows good lift on the finish. Drink now.

name: Ruby Port Lote 601
review: Features a supple, mouthfilling spiciness, with red currant and wild herb notes. Hints of cinnamon and paprika appear on the mineral-infused finish. Drink now.

name: Tawny Port
review: There's lots of hazelnut, spice and dark chocolate in this crisp yet plush tawny, whose lively finish of citrus peel shows hints of smoke. Drink now.

name: Tawny Port Colheita
review: Powerful and fruity, with caramel flavors that feature overtones of macadamia nut and underbrush. Ripe, long finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Balanced, with violets, berries and cherries. Follows through to a medium-bodied palate, with light sweetness and a fresh finish. Needs more punch. Best after 2009. 500 cases made.

name: White Port Extra Dry
review: Offers an elegant mix of peach, beeswax and creamy flavors, accented by plenty of minerally notes. Delivers a rich and spicy finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A pure and crisp red, with raspberry, mineral and slate flavors, supported by firm acidity. The lively finish lingers, revealing white pepper notes. Drink now through 2018. 4,750 cases made.

name: Douro
review: The notes of dried underbrush, herb and macerated plum and cherry feature some hints of tar and mocha. A touch rustic, with an appealingly muscular frame. Drink now through 2015. 4,750 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A firm, well-structured red, with lots of crushed red fruit flavors that are accented by notes of slate and graphite. The chewy finish features dusty and minerally notes. Drink now through 2012. 8,330 cases made.

name: Douro
review: There's fine balance and plenty of fresh acidity in this lively red from Portugal. Flavors of red currant, plum and berry dominate, and the intense, minerally finish features notes of dark chocolate. Drink now through 2013. 6,666 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Well-built medium-bodied red, with an enticing aroma of violets and cherries, and flavors of red plum, berry and cassis. Spicy notes pick up intensity on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro dou Rosa Red
review: A lithe and mineral-filled red, with good cut to the dried berry, slate and red plum flavors, featuring notes of black walnut. The chewy finish is dense, accented by hints of cast iron. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Douro dou Rosa Red
review: This is loaded with vibrant cherry and dark currant flavors, supported by muscular tannins and acidity. Baker's chocolate notes and plenty of meaty accents fill the finish. Drink now through 2019. 3,000 cases made.

name: Douro dou Rosa Red
review: Firm, with plenty of mineral and sage accents to the dried berry and cherry flavors. A graphite note emerges on the finish, joined by hints of dark chocolate. Drink now through 2014. 650 cases made.

name: Douro dou Rosa White
review: A crisp style, with apple, pear and lemon-lime flavors knit together. Hints of smoky richness extend on the spicy finish. Drink now through 2016. 500 cases made.

name: Douro dou Rosa White
review: A rich, juicy white, with lots of almond, spice and ripe apple flavor. Firm in the midpalate, finishing with tropical fruit notes. Drink now through 2014. 30 cases imported.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Ripe dark plum and blackberry flavors are concentrated and backed by balanced acidity, with spice and dark chocolate on the finish. Drink now through 2011. 666 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A rich, plummy aroma and flavors of cassis, blackberry, mineral and smoke make for a delicious red. Smoky notes and dark plum flavors, with a dollop of dark chocolate, extend on the on the finish. Drink now through 2004.

name: Douro White
review: Concentrated flavors of apple pie and pear tart are accented by luscious spice and cream notes. Fresh and pure-tasting on the spicy finish, with minerally hints. Drink now through 2015. 700 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: A creamy aroma leads into flavors of mineral, apple, glazed citrus and spice. This is powerfully smoky on the finish, with hints of slate and hickory. Drink now through 2014. 667 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Lively, with white pepper notes to the red plum and wild cherry flavors. Firm acidity lingers with licorice accents on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 4,000 cases made.

name: Tawny Port
review: The aromas and flavors of fresh-crushed raspberry and dark currant display some notes of ginger and mint. Features a crisp finish, with white pepper and spiced cherry details. Drink now through 2016.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old Tonel 12
review: A spicy style, filled with intense, smoky mocha, caramel and dried herb flavors. The savory finish reveals some dried beef accents. Drink now.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old
review: The flavors of brioche, cherry and plum take on floral accents in this medium-weight tawny. Hints of iodine and sea salt appear on the crisp finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Tar, blackberry and mineral on the nose follow through to a medium- to full-bodied palate, where this is medium sweet and chewy. Slightly hollow midpalate. Best after 2012. 1,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Best La Rosa ever made. Very ripe, chocolaty, hot fruit character, medium body, racy tannins and long finish. Well integrated and elegant. Try in 2000.

name: Vintage Port
review: This is an elegant wine with focused fruit -- a very good example of a light vintage. Medium to deep ruby with a garnet edge, rich raspberry and perfume aromas, medium-bodied, with very good backbone, black pepper and raspberry flavors and a long finish.

name: Douro
review: A crisp red, with dried berry and dried cherry flavors that are flush with tannins. There's white pepper on the firm finish. Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Douro dou Rosa Red
review: Medium-bodied, with red plum and cherry flavors that show a good tannic punch. The firm finish features dried berry and spice. Drink now. 625 cases made.

name: Douro dou Rosa Red
review: Firm and sinewy, with bright red berry and currant flavors accented by mineral and mocha. The muscular finish features dark chocolate and spice. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Douro dou Rosa White
review: Features tangy acidity to the fresh-cut apple, dried pear, gooseberry and basil flavors. Mineral and spice notes carry through to the rich finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro Rosé dou Rosa
review: A robust rosé, with meaty undertones to the dark plum and ripe cherry flavors.The finish is plush and spicy. Drink now. 30 cases imported.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Offers aromas of berries and milk chocolate. Medium- to full-bodied, with velvety, round tannins. The aftertaste features nuts, berry and chocolate. A delicious LBV. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Port Finest Reserve
review: Very fruity and fresh, featuring loads of sweet red berry and plum flavors, with notes of currant and spice. Creamy finish. Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Ruby Port Lote No 601
review: Juicy and fresh-tasting, offering crisp, lively flavors of currant, red plum and spice. The spice finish is supple and sweet, with hints of milk chocolate. Drink now. 425 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: As classy as an old Bugatti automobile and probably even harder to find. It was one of three bottles left in the cellars of the owners of the quinta. Light ruby-garnet, showing earthy cassis and spice aromas, medium-bodied, with a balance of lovely cassis flavors, good acidity and plenty of sweet fruit on the finish.

name: White Port
review: An off-dry style, with mineral, almond and dried pear flavors that are fresh and juicy. Hints of melon show on the spice- and cream-filled finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Medium-bodied, with cherry, berry and red plum flavors. The fresh, spiced-filled finish offers dark chocolate notes. Drink now. 6,500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Forward and juicy, redolent of raspberry and cherry. Medium-bodied, with spicy notes that linger long into the finish. Drink now. 5,500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Nicely focused aromas and flavors of red cherry, plum and spice in this quaffable medium-bodied red. Smoke and mineral notes on the finish. Drink now through 2004.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Solid LBV. Attractive aromas of berries, wet earth. Medium-bodied, medium sweet, with fresh fruit and a velvety texture. Drink now or hold.

name: Vintage Port
review: Dark-colored, with cherry, cinnamon and berry aromas. Medium-bodied, lightly sweet, with a good amount of chewy tannins but lacking a lot of fruit on the finish. Best after 2004. 1,416 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Aromatic and pretty, with floral, berry and cherry aromas and fruity, citruslike flavors. Medium in body, sweetness and tannin. Best after 2005.

name: Vintage Port
review: Dark and inky, with green tea, tobacco and raspberry aromas. This is tight and tannic, with a sleek and steely structure. May still need time. This was the better of two bottles. Best after 1998. 1,600 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Ripe and jammy tasting with moderate tannins, a deep color and lasting fruit flavors. Young and exuberant; drink now for vitality.

name: Douro dou Rosa Red
review: Bright cherry and red plum flavors are well-spiced in this juicy red. The supple finish has chocolate and dried mint notes. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Douro White Reserva
review: This offers a mix of floral and creamy notes that accent the ripe pear and stewed apple flavors. Dried green herbs on the finish.  Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Good character, a bit lean. A medium-bodied young Port with spicy, earthy, mushroomy aromas and flavors. Medium sweet, with a rather short finish. Best after 2003. 600 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Ripe and raisiny, with layers of currant, plum and anise flavors. Is also a bit hot, with chewy tannins and a hint of cedar on the aftertaste. Was rough-edged, but may be better now.

name: Vintage Port
review: Very firm in the mouth, with ample fruit to keep on improving. Medium ruby with an amber edge, concentrated on the nose and palate, with a ripe blackberry character and a rather dry, medium finish.

name: Douro
review: Exuberant grape and plum notes lead to a light-bodied red, with raspberry nuances and a dusty finish. Drink now.

name: Douro Vale da Clara
review: Good structure and density to the dark plum and raspberry flavors, but it's spritzy. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca and Tinta Cão. Drink now. 3,750 cases made.

name: Vintage Character Port Finest Reserve
review: A lovely wood Port, with soft and luscious character. Medium ruby color, earthy, fruity, dusty aromas, medium body and sweetness, with a round mouthfeel.

name: Douro
review: Bright cassis and raspberry fruit give this soft, fleshy wine appeal for current drinking. It's fresh and likeable.

name: Douro Vale da Clara
review: Muted, with plummy flavors and slightly stewy notes on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old Tonel No. 12
review: Nutty aromas with hints of prunes and volatile acidity. Medium-bodied, medium sweet, with a hot and aggressive finish. Not very exciting. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Has good backbone but lacks a bit of flesh. Medium ruby-garnet, with a perfumed berry nose, medium-bodied, with lovely licorice and berry flavors but slightly short on the finish.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: This Port has very ripe fruit but is slightly disjointed, with aromas of baked fruit and raisin. Full-bodied and very sweet, with berry on the slightly dry finish. Drink now. 1,330 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Light but very drinkable. Ruby-garnet, with a light berry nose, light-bodied, with delicate berry flavors, light tannins and a rather dry, short finish.

name: Dão Dona Santana
review: Focused and pure-tasting, offering powerfully crisp flavors of dark currant, cherry and crushed red plum, accented by slate and white pepper notes. Medium-grained tannins show on the spicy finish. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, Jaen and Alfrocheiro. Drink now through 2019. 112 cases imported.

name: Touriga Nacional Dão
review: A fresh and fruity style, with loads of crushed red plum and dark cherry flavors. Lengthens out, with forest floor elements. Dark currant and spice hints show on the finish, which features some graphite details. Drink now through 2018. 67 cases imported.

name: Tinta Roriz Dão
review: Spicy and supple, with notes of cardamom and cinnamon to the red current and plum tart flavors. Reveals lots of vanilla and cedary accents as well. Snappy finish. Drink now through 2018. 23 cases imported.

name: Ribatejo
review: Ripe, fairly rich and rustic, offering plenty of tannins. Flavors are dominated by cherry and coffee, inserting a shot of licorice on the finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old
review: Cherry and red plum flavors dominate this fruity style. Mineral and sea salt notes show on the finish, with some dried herbal accents. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Mature and somewhat smooth, but the dried plum and cherry flavors are fading. Finish shows a gamy edge.

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde Casa do Capitão-Mor
review: There are touches of richness to the baked apple and white cherry flavors, which are supported by crunchy acidity. Creamy hints and plenty of spicy notes on the finish.  Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde Casa do Capitão-Mor
review: Fresh, with crunchy acidity weaving together the pear and melon notes, this light-bodied white shows a savory finish marked by herb and spice elements.  Drink now. 830 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Estremadura Special Selection
review: Well-structured and powerful. Impressive for its concentrated dark plum, cherry and cassis flavors, which need time to open up. Interesting leather and mineral aromas echo with spicy notes on the finish. Best from 2003 through 2006. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Estremadura
review: Fairly rich and nicely concentrated full-bodied red, with black cherry, plum and chocolate flavors, and coffee notes. Velvety tannins chime in on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 6,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Estremadura Special Selection
review: A nicely defined Merlot from Portugal, with dark plum, dark cherry and espresso flavors, and appealing herbal-gamy aromas that echo with roasted notes on the finish. Best from 2003 through 2006. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Estremadura Special Selection
review: A full-bore international style red, with lovely, supple flavors of red plum and dark cherry. Plenty of sweet, spicy notes on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Estremadura Special Selection
review: This crisp red offers well-defined berry and plum flavors, with firm but well-integrated tannins and balanced acidity. It's a juicy wine that brings you back for another sip. Drink now through 2001. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Estremadura
review: A ripe style with plenty of pear and caramel flavors, fairly rich and focused. Nice, spicy finish.

name: Alenquer
review: A hearty red wine that's packed with fruit flavor and accented with spice. Tannic and full-bodied, but probably best to drink now while the fruit is fresh. 12,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alenquer
review: Round and polished, this fruity wine has good balance and bright flavors of plum and licorice. Cabernet Sauvignon-based, but it's not made for long aging; drink now.

name: Touriga Nacional Estremadura Special Selection
review: Solid Touriga, with fresh red plum and pleasant mushroom and beef bouillon flavors. Crisp finish.  Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Estremadura
review: A deeply colored, ripe and flavorful red with solid cherry and berry flavors accented by spice. This is full-bodied and tannic but not harsh on the palate.

name: Chardonnay Estremadura Barrel Fermented
review: Ripe and almost honeyed apple and cinnamon flavors. Somewhat coarse but firm, adding spicy aftertaste and a nice lemony note as well. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Estremadura
review: Shows some nice concentration, with plum, herb and olive flavors predominant. Tannic on the finish; try in 1998.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Estremadura
review: Herbal aromas, with bell pepper flavors, mark this modest Cabernet.

name: Alenquer
review: Medium- to full-bodied, dominated by red fruit flavors. It has firm plum and red cherry elements, with some earthy and mushroom notes that extend on the finish. Periquita and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now.

name: Alenquer
review: Fresh and focused red, with red berry and cherry flavors, and herbal and spice notes on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Alenquer
review: The bright strawberry and cherry flavors remind us of Pinot Noir. This is easy-drinking, medium-bodied and charming, with plenty of fruit.

name: Alenquer
review: Bright cherry flavor animates this round, fresh red, adding black pepper accents and light tannins. It has personality, if not much weight.

name: Periquita Alenquer
review: Nice and spicy like a Cotes-du-Rhône, with plenty of plum and raspberry flavor accented by pepper. Moderately tannic, but smooth. Drink now. 9,500 cases made.

name: Alenquer
review: Extreme flavors of leather and game with a harsh finish. Not much fun.

name: Vital-Chardonnay Alenquer
review: Dull tasting, with little fruit flavor and a harsh finish.

name: Dão White Altitude
review: A fresh, fruity aroma leads to flavors of baked apple, white cherry and hints of black currant. The crisp finish is packed with saline notes. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Douro White Reserva
review: Mature-tasting, with a creamy edge to the apple and nectarine flavors. Rich and buttery on the finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Douro White
review: Fresh and minerally-tasting, with almond, green peach and lemon zest flavors. The firm finish features sea salt and herbal notes. Rabigato and Códega do Larinho. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Aromas of licorice, blackberries and flowers follow through to a full-bodied palate, with light sweetness and an incredible core of gorgeous raspberry fruit. Long finish. Another 1865 Roriz in the making? Best after 2014. 1,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: This is really fantastic. Wonderful aromas of grapes, berries and cherries. Full-bodied, medium sweet, with wonderfully refined tannins and a long, long finish. A gorgeous wine. Best after 2014. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Rich and deeply flavored, with brooding dark plum, dark chocolate and heady spicy flavors. Plenty of tannins, with good grip on the powerfully smoky and decadent finish. Needs time in the cellar. Best from 2003 through 2006. 1,300 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Focused and refined, with chewy tannins and a fruity, citrusy aftertaste. Full, medium sweet and racy. This is much better than what I tasted from barrel. From one of the most beautiful Port farms in the Douro Valley. Best after 2018. 350 cases made.

name: Douro Prazo
review: Rich and concentrated, with layers of mouthfilling red and black fruit flavors. Full-bodied, with blackberry, dark chocolate and licorice elements all in balance. Pure, minerally finish, with plenty of grip. Tempting now. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca, Tinta Barroca and Touriga Nacional. Best from 2007 through 2010. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Douro Prazo
review: Refined and pure tasting, with a powerfully spicy aroma and intense red cherry, plum and raspberry flavors. Impressive structure; finish oozes with dark chocolate and cassis notes. Drink now through 2005. 2,200 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Full-bodied, deep-colored and rich with lip-smacking flavors of dark plum, blackberry jam, cocoa and a hint of French roast as well. Tannins build on the finish, but with an appealing silkiness and dark chocolate notes that go on and on. Drink now through 2008. 1,320 cases made.

name: Douro Prazo
review: Elegant and creamy-tasting, with bright, well-defined flavors of raspberry, red plum and cinnamon. Finishes with mocha and silky tannins. Needs some cellar time to flesh out more. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Barroca, Tinta Roriz and Tinto Cão. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Douro Prazo
review: Beautiful aroma of crushed red fruits with loads of ripe plum, cassis and smoke flavors. Well-balanced, with plenty of structure as well. Long finish of white pepper and mineral. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro Prazo
review: Ripe red, with lots of pure raspberry, cherry and mulberry flavors accented by rich cream and spice notes. Dark chocolate and kirsch on the finish. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2018. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Douro Prazo
review: Red fruit aromas and flavors dominate this finely chiseled red, which shows rich raspberry and dark plum notes midpalate, with intense dark chocolate on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 1,200 cases imported.

name: Douro Prazo de Roriz
review: Medium-bodied, with sandalwood notes to the dried berry, cherry tart and damson plum flavors. Hints of violet and cinnamon appear on the finish. Drink now. 4,500 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Rich, ripe style, with dark cherry and kirsch flavors and plenty of chocolaty notes. Mineral- and spiced-filled finish. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinto Cão. Drink now through 2012. 2,083 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Concentrated and intense. Shows plenty of French roast flavors, with dark cherry, flanked plum, mineral and smoke. Silky tannins fill the caressing finish. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz. Drink now through 2010. 1,600 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Black in color, with powerful aromas of crushed blackberry and black licorice that follow through to a full-bodied palate, with medium sweetness. Has lots of licorice and berry character, with a medium finish. Best after 2011. 190 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: Rich, smoky aroma and flavors of dark plum, dark cherry and cassis. Plenty of chocolaty notes as well. Silky tannins build with intensity of the finish, which is filled with minerally elements. Tempting now. Best from 2003 through 2006.

name: Douro Prazo de Roriz
review: Juicy and crisp, with concentrated wild plum, boysenberry and smoked meat flavors. Medium-grained tannins bolster this midpalate, carrying into the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Douro Prazo
review: Crisp, with pure red plum, mineral and raspberry flavors. Lip-smacking finish of spice, red cherry and maple.  Drink now through 2009. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Douro Prazo
review: Spicy aroma, and toasty, milk chocolate flavors. Supple and smooth, with plum pudding and dark cherry notes emerging on the finish. Needs some time to settle out. Best after 2004. 2,500 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A ripe, exotic red. Medium- to full-bodied, with loads of decadent dark fruit flavors and sweet spicy notes.  Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Dão
review: Rich and meaty, with jammy plum and prune fruit flavors, this is straightforward, bright and lively. Drink now.

name: Dão Maxiais Red
review: This wine has game, leather and tealike flavors, with some dried cherry notes mixed in and an aroma of cardamom. A bit rustic, but enjoyable. Drink now.

name: Dão
review: There's a nice spiciness here, reminiscent of white pepper. Smooth, supple and round, delivering plum and dried cherry flavors which linger on the finish.

name: Dão Maxiais White
review: A crisp, lean white with some green apple and gooseberry flavors. Finishes on a fairly tart and slightly spicy note. Drink now.

name: Dão Reserva
review: A juicy red, on the light side, with plenty of appealing berry and currant flavors. Finishes with some pepper and leather notes. Drink now.

name: Dão
review: A fruity wine with good berrylike aromas and flavors. One-dimensional with a slightly astringent finish.

name: Dão White
review: Simple and sappy, with resinous flavors and some astringency on the finish.

name: Vinho Verde
review: Crisp, fresh and appley-tasting, with notes of citrus, especially lime. Shows hints of savory herb on the finish. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde
review: On the tart side, showing lemon zest flavors, with some spicy notes on the finish.  Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Minho White Escolha
review: Overripe, with some honeyed notes and peachy flavors. Flat finish.  540 cases made.

name: Alvarinho Lisboa
review: There's a crackling intensity to this white, with an aroma of lemon verbena and pure flavors of mineral, tarragon, lime and dried basil. The finish extends with rich, exotic spice. Drink now through 2017. 130 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Shows blackberry and black currant on the nose. Medium-bodied, with light sweetness, soft tannins and a simple finish. For early drinking.   Score range: 84-87

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde
review: This creamy and refined white boasts lots of rich peach and apricot flavors, with toasted coconut edges and plenty of spicy accents in the midpalate. The lush finish lingers with saline notes.  Drink now through 2020. 1,500 cases made.

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde
review: Features rich, lively flavors of sage honey, lemon zest and apple tart, with plenty of acidity. The luscious finish glistens with savory accents and jellied citrus notes. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde Assinatura de Família
review: A light effervescence highlights the melon and tropical fruit flavors of this light-bodied white. A salty acidity glides into an herb-tinged finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde Solar de Serrade
review: Spicy, with touches of richness and loads of ripe apple and butter. Fresh, with a broad finish filled with smoke and spice. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde Solar de Serrade
review: Bright and citrusy, with crisp acidity and plenty of mineral notes. Quite juicy on the finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde Solar de Serrade
review: Medium-bodied, with some savory herb overtones to the apple and green pear flavors. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Extremely well crafted, with a firm structure of medium tannins, fresh strawberry flavors and a floral finish. The fruit and tannins are well integrated and focused on the palate. Great potential here for a new Douro shipper.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Very suave, with rich, concentrated flavors of dark currant, violet, kirsch and dark cherry that ooze with intense spicy notes. Black licorice and blackberry linger on the finish, which is filled with dark chocolate notes. Pure and refined. Drink now through 2020. 3,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A rich, refined red, boasting an array of red berry, plum and cherry flavors flanked by rich smoke and spice notes, with good structure. The long finish is elegant, with cream and light smoke notes. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Well-sculpted and muscular, with plenty of red plum and red berry flavors that are just entering maturity. Balanced, with a bracing freshness. Licorice and mineral notes on the long finish.  Drink now through 2007. 7,000 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old
review: Rich aromas of caramel, raisin and light spice open to a medium-bodied palate, with a medium sweetness and a long toffee finish. Outstanding 10-year-old. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 1,665 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Elegant, with bright crushed red fruit flavors that are concentrated and well-structured. Offers raspberry and red cherry character, with notes of plum pudding, followed by spice and cedar box on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 2,000 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Rich, ripe and spicy, offering a deep core of dark plum and kirsch flavors. Still quite fresh-tasting, with notes of sandalwood and vanilla, followed by a lush finish of chocolate and mocha. Drink now through 2014. 1,666 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Displays extravagant aromas of tangerine peel, crushed blackberry and blueberry that turn to flowers and dark chocolate. Full-bodied and very sweet, with a nut, berry and raisin aftertaste. A little fiery, but opulent and very fun. Best after 2015. 300 cases made.

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: Concentrated mocha notes dominate this muscular, decadent red, which features dark plum, herbal and dark currant flavors. Notes of slate carry through to the finish. Best from 2013 through 2017. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Ripe and a touch brooding, with an abundance of mocha and spicy overtones to the dense dark currant and roasted plum flavors. Mocha-filled finish. Drink now through 2016. 1,500 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: This is filled with dark chocolate and dark plum flavors which are ripe and concentrated. Offers plenty of grip as well, with lots of chewy tannins and spice notes on the muscular finish. Drink now through 2015. 1,666 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old
review: Very old smell, almost dusty and varnishy but theres lots of ripe fruit. Full-bodied, with raisin, prune and treacle flavors. Long finish. A bit rustic but its got character. Tastes older than 20 years. Try it. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 830 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Minerally and sanguine-tasting, with lots of fig, iron and dark plum notes. The finish is filled with coffee and smoke. Drink now through 2010. 4,150 cases made.

name: Douro Cister da Ribeira
review: Interesting style, crisp and refined. Bright cherry and red berry flavors, with spicy notes and plenty of structure. A finish of bittersweet chocolate. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: This is firm and filled with jammy flavors of blackberry, raspberry and cherry. A spice and mineral note, with some orange rind, enlivens the finish. Drink now. 835 cases made.

name: Douro Ventozelo QV Red
review: A beefy red, with red currant, raspberry preserves, strawberry and guava flavors that feature a hint of smoke. Chocolate and French roast coffee notes mark the finish. Drink now through 2017. 15,000 cases made.

name: Douro Ventozelo QV Red
review: Peppery aromas, with flavors to match, are joined by dense dark plum and blackberry elements. Well-structured, offering mineral and dark chocolate on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 2,500 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: A minerally red, with layers of dense currant and plum flavors that are interwoven with graphite notes. Dense, with chewy tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 3,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Firm red, with minerally accents to its red plum and dried cherry flavors. Cedar and spice fill the sinewy finish. Drink now through 2014. 5,000 cases made.

name: Douro QV White
review: Crisp, with a salty allure to the flavors of fresh-cut apple, pear and melon. The spicy finish features hints of white chocolate. Moscatel, Viosinho, Gouveio and Cerceal. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: A firm red, with plenty of dried cherry and crushed red fruit flavors, followed by notes of iron and stone on the lively finish. Drink now. 835 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: Focused and structured, showing delicious red plum and berry fruit, with spice and mineral notes on the finish.  Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Medium- to full-bodied and loaded with zesty red berry and dried cherry flavors. Notes of Asian spice fill the tannic finish. Drink now. 835 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Firm and crisp, showing plum, red cherry and berry flavors, with notes of mineral and smoke on the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Douro Cister da Ribeira
review: A ripe style, with dried cherry and red plum flavors. The finish is filled with smoke, spice and hints of pomegranate. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Douro Vinzelo
review: Very juicy and fresh-tasting, with good structure and crisp red plum and raspberry flavors. Drink now through 2008. 8,000 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: A decadent red, with loads of ripe plum and blackberry flavors that linger on the long finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Medium-bodied, with dried red fruit flavors that are crisp and flanked by notes of shiso leaf and hints of bell pepper. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Douro Rosé Vinzelo
review: Firm and focused rosé, with dried cherry and berry flavors, and touches of smoke and spice on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro Ventozelo QV White
review: A medium-bodied white, with a floral aroma, peach and green apple flavors, and a crisp, spicy finish. Drink now. 4,166 cases made.

name: Douro Ventozelo White
review: This features lots of hickory overtones to the ripe apple and pear flavors. Soft, plush finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Douro Vinzelo
review: Medium-bodied, with dried raspberry, plum cake and dried cherry flavors that are well-balanced and end on a fresh note. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Touriga Franca Douro
review: Has a nice richness, showing red plum and raspberry flavors, with some tea and cola notes on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro QV Red
review: Medium-bodied, with a slightly astringent note to the dried red fruit flavors, followed by a short finish. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Mature, showing dried cherry and plum flavors, with smoke and spice on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Douro Vinzelo
review: A spicy, fruity red, with red plum and berry flavors and hints of maple and butter. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: A buttery style, with ripe apple and Meyer lemon flavors, which linger on the spicy finish. Drink now. 4,166 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Blackberry, blueberry and some floral aromas follow through to a medium body, with soft tannins and a round finish. Shows tarlike character on the finish. A little dull. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Touriga Franca Douro
review: Has a peppery aroma, with flavors to match, as well as red plum, berry and plenty of tannins. Drink now. 835 cases made.

name: Douro Cister da Ribeira
review: Medium-bodied, with plum and berry flavors that tail off with a slight stewy note on the finish. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca, Tinta Barroca and Touriga Nacional. Drink now. 8,333 cases made.

name: Douro Cister da Ribeira
review: Red plum and berry flavors dominate this medium-bodied red. Turns a bit astringent and stewy in the end.  Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Douro Vinzelo
review: Rough-hewn, with mocha and dried cherry flavors that take on some charry notes on the tart finish. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca, Tinta Barroca and Touriga Nacional. 15,000 cases made.

name: Douro White Cister da Ribeira
review: Peachy aromas and flavors dominate this soft white. Short finish. Drink now. 4,166 cases made.

name: Douro White Cister da Ribeira
review: Crisp, with assertive flavors of green peach, scallion and savory herb. Turns a touch metallic on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro Rosé Ventozelo QV
review: Dried berry and cherry flavors dominate this medium-bodied rosé, which features meaty notes on the finish. Drink now. 1,666 cases made.

name: Syrah Maipo Valley
review: Dark, ripe and rich, with lots of plum sauce, licorice and spice cake flavors. There's also plenty of fresh acidity and floral hints to keep this going through the creamy finish. Drink now through 2008. 900 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Reserva Especial
review: This solid red offers black currant and blackberry fruit backed by sweet toast, mineral and loam hints, with a nice juicy finish. Contains 10 percent Syrah. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Syrah Maipo Valley Reserva Especial
review: Round and juicy, with blackberry and boysenberry fruit offset by notes of cassis bush, loam and toast. The solid finish picks up a dark licorice note. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde
review: This is aromatic, offering aromas and flavors of pine and peach, with hints of melon and quince. The light, spicy finish is fresh and crisp. Loureiro. Drink now. 4,166 cases made.

name: Loureiro Vinho Verde
review: A crisp, fresh white, with mineral and citrus flavors and some pleasant herbal notes.  Drink now. 1,200 cases imported.

name: Minho White
review: A firm and minerally white, offering green apple and slatelike flavors, finishing with fennel and anise. Try this with oysters. Loureiro. Drink now. 416 cases made.

name: Minho White
review: Tastes of apple, with some ripe peach notes and a broad mulled wine finish.  Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Loureiro Vinho Verde
review: Peachy aromas and flavors, with citrusy notes, make this light and refreshing. Drink now. 3,300 cases made.

name: Minho White
review: Tart white, with some apple and citrus flavors. Short finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Bucelas
review: A cheesy aroma and sharp fruit cocktail flavors don't add up to much. Unbalanced.

name: Loureiro Vinho Verde
review: Ripe tropical fruit flavors are joined by baked peach and ripe pineapple flavors in this medium-bodied white. Shows creamy notes as well, with hints of anise on the finish. Drink now.

name: Godello Monterrei Terra do Lobo
review: This generous white offers pear and vanilla flavors in a silky texture, with gentle acidity and a slight, honeyed sweetness. Unusual but tasty. Drink now.

name: Douro Castelo Rodrigo
review: Ebulliently fruity and spicy, with lots of black pepper flavor, like a Rhône, but lighter in texture. Terrifically appealling for its berry flavors and great for short-term quaffing. 10,000 cases made.

name: Alentejo Reserva
review: Ripe and full-bodied, with an exotic flavor profile. Creamy and lush, with plenty of mocha, raspberry and cocoa flavors and hints of mango. Structured, with a tight finish of smoke and Asian spice.  Drink now through 2008. 400 cases imported.

name: Alentejo
review: Muscular, with plenty of dark plum and cassis flavors and notes of mineral and liquid smoke. Vanilla and coffee bean on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Alentejo Reserva
review: Full-bodied, muscular and ripe red, with pretty dark plum, smoke and bacon fat flavors. Tannins clamp down on the finish, but within bounds.  Drink now through 2005. 250 cases imported.

name: Alentejo Reserva
review: Intense and smoky, with a meaty aroma, and flavors of fig, cassis and dark plum. Rich bacony notes fill the finish. Good effort for the appellation. Drink now. 150 cases imported.

name: Alentejo
review: This chewy red shows good intensity, with plum, briar, coffee and game flavors and firm yet ripe tannins. It's both bitter and sweet, but has balance and a distinctive character. Drink now through 2002. 1,000 cases made.

name: Alentejo
review: Medium- to full-bodied, quaffable flavors of raspberry, dark cherry and spice. Clean finish, with milk chocolate flavors.  Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Alentejo
review: A nicely proportioned wine with good berry and spice flavors that hang together well, and some nice cinnamon flavors on the finish. Juicy and satisfying. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Alentejo Monte do Palmeiro
review: Ripe and creamy, with roasted plum and spice flavors and an herbal cast to the supple finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Alentejo Reserva
review: Plenty of smoke and spice, with loads of roasted notes, black currant flavors, and black olive. Dark chocolate fills the finish. Drink now. 650 cases imported.

name: Alentejo
review: Balanced, with the pretty plum and red cherry flavors, and some spicy notes on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Alentejo
review: Dark smoke and cassis notes give way to a firm and focused red that finishes on a bittersweet chocolate note. Should unwind more with either food or short-term cellaring. Drink now through 2001. 3,000 cases made.

name: Alentejo Dom Martinho
review: Medium-bodied, with dark cherry and French roast flavors, followed by notes of mint and sandalwood on the inky finish. Drink now. 4,500 cases imported.

name: Alentejo Dom Martinho
review: Supple, showing juicy red plum and berry flavors, with chocolate and bricklike notes on the finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Alentejo
review: Mature-tasting, with Lapsang Souchong flavors, and some caramel and anise notes. Turns a bit astringent on the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Alentejo
review: A well-preserved '88 that looks and feels like a serious, full-bodied, tannic wine. But the fruit flavors are subdued and it hasn't yet developed the complexity of age. Worth cellaring if you're a gambler. Best from 1996 through 1998. 1,500 cases made.

name: Alentejo Dom Martinho
review: Earth, currant, raspberry and coffee notes run through this medium-weight red, with light cedar shadings on the supple finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Alentejo
review: Full-bodied, with a leathery aroma and espresso and dark plum flavors, which linger on the finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Alentejo Dom Martinho
review: Pleasant, with dried cherry and cinammon notes that turn a tad astringent on the finish. Drink now. 5,500 cases imported.

name: Alentejo Dom Martinho
review: Mature red, nearing its peak, with red plum and dried cherry flavors, and smoked bacon notes on the finish.  Drink now. 5,500 cases made.

name: Alentejo Dom Martinho
review: There's a nice smoky, meaty flavor to this medium-bodied red. Smooth and supple, with a chocolaty note on the balanced finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Alentejo
review: The has red berry and plum flavors, with cranberry notes on the finish. Drink now. 1,350 cases imported.

name: Alentejo Dom Martinho
review: Firm red, with chewy red plum, cherry and berry flavors, with a good spicy lift on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases imported.

name: Alentejo Dom Martinho
review: Straightforward red, with red plum and berry flavors, and smoky notes on the finish. This was the better of two bottles. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Alentejo Reserva
review: A straightforward red, with red plum and berry flavors. Short finish. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Alentejo Rosé Dom Martinho
review: A mix of meat and red plum flavors, with some bacony notes. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Alentejo
review: Sturdy, tasty and toasty, with a definite cedary component to the basic cherry flavor. Finishes with modest length. Drink now.

name: Alentejo Dom Martinho
review: Berry and plum flavors are a bit coarse. Tannic finish. This was the best of three bottles. 4,500 cases imported.

name: Alentejo Dom Martinho
review: Dried out, with beef bouillon, dried cherry and mushroomy flavors. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Alentejo
review: Thick- tasting, with bitter chocolate and charred flavors, leather and earth notes on the finish. Over the top.

name: Tejo Terraços do Tejo
review: A languid red, with a smoke essence to the plum and dried berry flavors. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Arinto-Fernão Pires Tejo
review: An aromatic white, with crisp apple and salted almond flavors that feature touches of richness. Cream and spice accents show on the fresh finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Tejo Forma de Arte Reserva
review: A savory red, with firm flavors of dried berry, smoke and spice, lingering on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional-Merlot-Syrah Tejo
review: A juicy, meaty red, with cherry and dried berry flavors that feature notes of hickory and maple. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Tejo Colheita Seleccionada
review: Medium-bodied, with cherry and dried berry flavors, finishing on a slightly candied note. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Aromas of cooked fruit and hints of bacon. Very ripe strawberry. Full-bodied, with ripe very sweet fruit and a long sweet finish. Soft and tasty. '77/'85/'97 blind Port retrospective. Drink now.

name: Douro Grande Escolha
review: A well-polished wine that's loaded with flavor, made in an international style. Full-bodied, silky and intense, with gorgeous flavors of ripe cherry and spice. Finishes with burst of blueberry. A wine that glides graciously and sumptuously across the palate. Drink now through 2001. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro Grande Escolha
review: A lush and distinctive Portugese red with ample oak accents and full, ripe flavors. It has richness, concentration, lots of fine-textured tannins and a lingering finish. Worth searching for.

name: Douro
review: A delicious, hearty red wine with grapey, peppery aromas and flavors. It's smooth-textured, full-bodied and not too tannic. Drink now.

name: Douro
review: A focused and well-concentrated red with flavors of dark cherry, coffee, plum and blackberry. Smooth, with a good backbone of acidity and a touch of ripeness. Coffee and spice notes linger on the finish. Luscious, and finely crafted. Drink now through 2001.

name: Douro
review: Rich and juicy, with enticing berry, cherry and dark plum flavors. Also has an appealing leathery flavor which ties it all together. Smooth and supple, with vanilla and nutmeg on the finish. Delicious. Drink now through 2000. 4,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A complex, earthy style that has lots of ripe fruit and flirts with decadence in its cedary, leathery aromas. It is rich, firmly tannic and concentrated. Drink now through 1997.

name: Douro Grande Escolha
review: Thick and fruity, boasting blackberry and black plum flavors and aromas. It has big and strapping tannins and a dose of bittersweet chocolate and spice on the finish. Best to try in 1997.

name: Douro White
review: A wine of some power and finesse. Starts on a peachy note, then develops some intensity, with mineral and spice flavors that linger on the finish. A good alternative to Chardonnay. 1,200 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A straightforward red, with plum and berry flavors followed by spicy notes on the finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Douro Grande Escolha
review: Deep colored and aromatic, with a toasty, slightly earthy, black cherry and black pepper character that carries through the solid finish. Can use cellaring until 1992.

name: Douro Grande Escolha
review: Plummy- and stewy-tasting. Awkward.

name: Douro
review: Thin and a bit stewy, with modest red plum and berry flavors.

name: Douro
review: Herbal and tough-edged, but flavorful, with modest berry and leaf aromas and flavors. Not particularly generous.

name: Douro Vinha da Ponte
review: A complex, elegant red, with rich notes of Asian spice and Bourbon vanilla flanking the luscious flavors of Christmas pudding and hoisin sauce. Features intense accents of chocolate mousse midpalate, followed by a creamy finish. Drink now through 2024. 25 cases imported.

name: Douro Vinha da Ponte
review: Very rich and balanced, with a deep well of dark plum, kirsch and spiced cherry flavors joined by decadent Asian spice and mocha notes. This shows plenty of grip on the finish, which lingers with cocoa powder and cream. Drink now through 2017. 70 cases imported.

name: Douro Vinha Maria Teresa
review: Rich, pure and very silky, with a lavishly perfumed, floral aroma and concentrated dark plum and kirsch flavors that are intensely spiced. Mint and chocolate notes show on the refined finish. This should benefit from time in the cellar. Best from 2016 through 2022. 641 cases made.

name: Douro Vinha Maria Teresa
review: Delivers gorgeous aromas and flavors of chocolate, dark cherry and spice. Concentrated and refined, this luscious, unctuous red is filled with silky tannins and enough crushed red fruit and mineral notes to linger long after the last sip. Drink now through 2015. 435 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Seductive, with a deep, intense color and rich, loamy aromas and flavors of cassis, dark cherry and dark chocolate. Supple, fine-grained tannins, with a long, powerful finish of red pepper and smoke. Finely balanced and well-structured. A monumental Touriga. Drink now through 2015. 750 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: A full-bore, rich and ripe Douro red. Finely crafted, with loads of dark plum and dark cherry flavors and notes of mineral, graphite and underbrush. Suave and supple, with burnished tannins and a long finish of smoke, chocolate and spice. Makes a statement. Best table wine yet from Portugal. Drink now through 2010. 750 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva Old Vines
review: Deeply colored, with intense yet refined aromas and flavors of kirsch, boysenberry, dark cherry and spice. The fruit is supported by focused notes of mineral and graphite, and the finish is loaded with dark chocolate and medium tannins. Drink now through 2015. 7,000 cases made.

name: Douro Vinha da Ponte
review: Vibrant, lush and seductive, with a creamy core of boysenberry, dark cherry and cassis flavors. Mineral and smoke fill the long finish. Exquisite balance and a broad structure make this hard to resist. Like a dry Port. Drink now through 2014. 250 cases made.

name: Douro Vinha da Ponte
review: Full-bore, decadent red, with a smoky, spicy aroma and layers of rich blackberry, dark plum, cassis and meaty flavors that jump out of the glass at you. Concentrated notes of tar, dark chocolate and roasted meats dominate the finish; lush tannins complete the package. Tempting now. Best from 2004 through 2008. 250 cases made.

name: Douro Vinha Maria Teresa
review: Very creamy, ripe and rich, with a mouthwatering array of kirsch, raspberry tart and dark plum flavors. This has silky tannins, with a finish that's powered by dark chocolate, white pepper and plenty of fresh acidity. Hard to resist. Drink now through 2016. 75 cases imported.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Big and rich, this is full of Asian spice notes that are woven between ripe dark plum, blackberry and dried blueberry flavors. Chocolate mousse accents linger on the long, creamy finish, with some savory hints. Complex. Drink now through 2022. 775 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
