review: Very suave and silky, this is filled with fresh blueberry, boysenberry and cocoa powder flavors that are fresh and juicy, with notes of hot stone, cedar, paprika and dark chocolate on the lush, creamy finish. Drink now through 2020. 775 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Offers a heady violet aroma, with good grip to the crushed red plum and currant flavors, presenting a hint of black olive. The finely chiseled finish features mocha and chocolate mousse details and plenty of peppery notes. Best from 2035 through 2065. 800 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva Old Vines
review: Powerful, rich and refined, with a lithe mouthfeel and flavors of boysenberry, sandalwood, macerated cherry and damson plum. Very minerally as well, with loads of spicy notes on the well-structured, lingering finish. Very elegant. Drink now through 2022. 7,750 cases made.

name: Douro Vinha da Ponte
review: Ripe, rich and powerful, with a heady aroma, and layers of cassis, dark plum, mocha and French roast flavors. This is elegant and seductive, with loads of silky tannins and delicious licorice notes. Hard to resist. Drink now through 2009. 250 cases made.

name: Douro Vinha Maria Teresa
review: A lithe and elegant red, with hints of anise to the boysenberry and cherry flavors. Juicy midpalate, featuring loads of fresh acidity. Dark chocolate and peppery notes linger on the refined finish. Drink now through 2024. 480 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: This lithe red oozes with rich spiciness, showing concentrated flavors of kirsch, dark chocolate, mineral and allspice. Features a creamy core, presenting medium-grained tannins that lengthen out nicely. The unctuous finish is filled with a vibrant silkiness. Drink now through 2022. 741 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: A vibrant expression of Touriga, with intense, well-sculpted flavors of red plum, kirsch, red cherry and mineral. The long finish features medium-grained tannins, with layers of cream, spice and chocolate. Tempting now. Best from 2009 through 2014. 817 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva Old Vines
review: This red is luscious, refined and muscular, showing good cut to the creamy, well-spiced flavors. An intense midpalate of cocoa powder carries through to the finish, which features accents of hoisin sauce and plum pudding. Drink now through 2020. 10,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva Old Vines
review: A solid core of savory spice and leaf notes provides a supple overlay to the flavors of dried berry and smoke. The deft finish lingers, with touches of cream and vanilla as well as plenty of cocoa powder notes. Very elegant and suave. Drink now through 2017. 1,700 cases imported.

name: Douro Reserva Old Vines
review: This has a complex array of red and dark fruit flavors, led by blueberry, kirsch, dark plum and dark cherry. Very plush midpalate, with an elegant, caressing finish of spice, mocha and cream. Drink now through 2017. 750 cases imported.

name: Douro Reserva Old Vines
review: A ripe, full-bodied red packed with dark fruity flavors as well as plenty of paprika. Powerful, with a dense core of spicy elements that follow through to the long, cream-filled finish. Drink now through 2012. 6,000 cases made.

name: Douro Superior
review: Well-crafted and suave, with refined flavors of raspberry tart, red plum and cherry pastry, matched to cardamom and savory spice notes. Silky tannins and a plush, creamy finish offer chocolate mousse accents.  Drink now through 2022. 15,166 cases made.

name: Douro Vinha Maria Teresa
review: An elegant, refined red, with luscious flavors of dark currant, blackberry, boysenberry and spice. Shows interesting tar and chocolate notes as well, with lots of mineral and slate. The creamy finish has a dollop of mocha. Drink now through 2018. 10 cases imported.

name: Douro Vinha Maria Teresa
review: Ripe and full-bodied, with loads of dark cherry, dark plum and kirsch flavors that are coated by a rich concentration of dark chocolate and spice. The creamy finish features plenty of mocha notes. Drink now through 2013. 535 cases made.

name: Douro Vinha Maria Teresa
review: This lush, international-style red shows concentrated dark plum, dark cherry and Asian spice flavors. Supple, with creamy and smoky touches on the cocoa-laden finish that are long-lived and profound. Drink now through 2008. 500 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: Offers aromas and flavors redolent of red raspberry, with concentrated dark plum and blueberry notes. Presents supple tannins and a creamy, open-textured finish of dark chocolate and Asian spice. Very lush. Drink now through 2022. 440 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: This big and rich-tasting red is generously spiced, with luscious flavors of dark currant, black olive and damson plum, supported by crisp acidity. Dark chocolate and licorice notes appear on the firm, tannic finish, revealing hints of cardamom. Best from 2016 through 2020. 741 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: Powerful and racy Tinta Roriz, with pure aromas and flavors of tar, blackberry, dark plum and a nice mineral component as well. Medium-grained tannins and peppery elements fill the long, rich finish. Tempting now. Best from 2004 through 2007. 250 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Exhibits a dark color, with rich aromas and flavors of dried plum, kirsch, mocha- and baker's chocolate, featuring notes of smoked meat. Displays good lift midpalate, with a muscular, well-spiced finish that offers plenty of tannic grip. Drink now through 2020. 250 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Ripe, rich and deeply flavored, this full-bodied red is filled with an array of dark fruit flavors and plenty of chocolaty notes that are backed up by silky tannins and fresh acidity. The supple finish is long, with elegant kirsch and mocha notes. Drink now through 2015. 540 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Full-throttle Touriga, with an intense aroma of pepper and crushed red fruits. Amazing purity and structure to the blueberry and raspberry flavors, with loads of minerality as well. Long, caressing finish of cream and vanilla. Drink now through 2010. 780 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: This is really engaging, with a mix of boysenberry, açaí berry and blackberry fruit that has lots of energy, carried by brambly grip and backed by licorice snap, spearmint and ganache notes on the finish.  Best from 2028 through 2045. 1,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Gorgeous aromas of pepper, spices, chocolate and crushed fruit. Full-bodied, medium sweet and very, very chewy, with a solid core of fruit. Has ripe tannins and lots of grip. One of the best ever from this producer. Best after 2015. 800 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Wonderful concentration, with deep color and ripe fruit flavors accented by a hint of green bark. Full-bodied and moderately sweet, with big, chewy tannins, yet the finish is fine and elegant. A single quinta to watch in the future. Best after 2008.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Unctuous, with an alluring aroma of smoke and spice, and lovely dark plum, boysenberry and dark cherry flavors. These are firmed up by a crisp acidity and notes of cigar box, mineral and spice, which intensify on the long finish. Drink now through 2006. 3,800 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva Old Vines
review: A rich and powerful Portuguese red that features concentrated dark plum, cherry tart and dried berry flavors. Dried meat notes show on the tannic, mocha-lined finish. Drink now through 2022. 6,100 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva Old Vines
review: Rich and meaty, with cherry and dark chocolate flavors supported by a full flush of acidity and firm tannins. Mineral and slate details extend with plenty of muscle on the finish. Drink now through . 7,750 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva Old Vines
review: Aromas and flavors of kirsch, chocolate and dark plum are the hallmarks of this sumptuous Portuguese red. Very silky tannins and zesty acidity carry the long, sandalwood- and cherry-filled finish. Drink now through 2014. 7,016 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva Old Vines
review: Rich red, like biting into a German chocolate cake. There's a delicate, refined element with meat, mineral, dark plum and cassis. Long, luxuriant finish of chocolate and mocha spice. Best from 2006 through 2010. 4,500 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva Old Vines
review: Luscious and creamy, with deep dark plum, blackberry and dark chocolate flavors backed by impressive structure and medium-grained tannins. The finish is filled with notes of almond, smoke and spice that go on and on. Nicely done. Drink now through 2009. 200 cases imported.

name: Douro Superior
review: Very plush, with concentrated dark plum, Asian spice and dark currant flavors that are creamy and rich-tasting. Medium-grained tannins on the long finish are filled with dark chocolate and black licorice notes. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2020. 15,000 cases made.

name: Douro Vinha da Ponte
review: An elegant red, with juicy flavors of red currant, raspberry and boysenberry accented by notes of chocolate mousse. Sweet tobacco and kumquat elements linger on the soft, bright finish. Drink now through 2018. 200 cases made.

name: Douro Vinha Maria Teresa
review: Elegant, seductive red, with cassis, blackberry and dark cherry flavors. This has fine structure and balance, as well as finesse. Mineral and chocolate mousse elements fill the lively finish. Drink now through 2010. 450 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: Delicious for its refined plum, mineral and dark smoke flavors, nicely fringed with spice and chocolate notes. Refined and structured, with a fresh acidity and creamy finish. Drink now through 2008. 470 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Powerful, with concentrated slate and mineral notes to the dark currant, dried berry and raspberry ganache flavors. Very lithe midpalate, offering flint and black olive hints on the long, focused finish. Drink now through 2020. 16,083 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva Old Vines
review: A focused red, with supple, streamlined flavors of blackberry, bay leaf and steeped plum. Spice and iron notes show on the finish. Offers moderate, integrated tannins. Decant. Drink now through 2020. 6,400 cases made.

name: Douro Vinha da Ponte
review: A spicy red, with hot stone aromas flanking the ripe blackberry, plum and mocha flavors. Zesty, with ample white pepper aromas on the finish. Offers moderate, integrated tannins. Drink now through 2023. 375 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: This has a floral aroma, with flavors of raspberry, dark cherry and chocolate, layered with rich, spicy notes. Hints of pepper show on the finish, which offers moderate grip. Drink now through 2020. 4,460 cases made.

name: Syrah Duriense Superior
review: This red has an elegant, supple profile, with pure raspberry and currant fruit accented by mocha and floral details, all structured by fresh acidity and integrated tannins. Well-spiced, with a long, minerally finish. Drink now through 2022. 1,500 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: Suave and concentrated, this red has a layered core of plum and blackberry compote, with details of spice, smoke and mineral rounding out the structured finish. Decant. Drink now through 2022. 1,325 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: A plush red, with mouthfilling flavors of plum, cherry and raspberry accented by supple spice and cream notes. A balanced, fruity style, with a finish of milk chocolate. A rare varietal bottling of this grape. Drink now through 2018. 200 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: Very creamy, spicy and juicy, with plush flavors of blackberry, violet, dark cherry and spice. The finish is rich and zesty, with pepper and slate notes. Drink now through 2016. 15 cases imported.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Deeply colored, rich and powerful, with an exuberant aroma of Asian spice, dark plum and cherry. Shows lots of mineral and spice as well, with an exuberant finish of dark chocolate and cream. Drink now through 2017. 13 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Solidly built, with a muscular core of plum paste, warm blackberry confiture and licorice snap notes. Plush through the finish, with a mouthwatering fruitcake detail adding length and drive. Best from 2022 through 2034. 700 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Rich and ripe, with dark plum and dried raspberry flavors that feature some smoky notes. The tannins are quite silky, lingering on the well-spiced finish with hints of black olive and leafy herbs. Tinta Roriz, Tinta Barroca, Touriga Franco and Touriga Nacional. Drink now through 2016.

name: Douro Reserva Old Vines
review: Rich, fruity and lush, delivering well-defined plum and cherry flavors that are filled with plenty of cream and spice notes. A molten chocolate accent marks the finish. Drink now through 2017. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Douro Superior
review: A suave, juicy style, with taut, focused flavors of cherry, paprika, dark plum and beef. Firmly tannic, with some peppery notes that extend onto the dense, rich finish. Drink now through 2020. 15,166 cases made.

name: Douro Superior
review: Firm, balanced and filled with effusive fruit flavors of crushed wild cherry, dark plum and blackberry. The mineral-infused finish shows notes of violet and sage. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz and Sousão. Drink now through 2016. 250 cases imported.

name: Douro White Superior
review: Rich and filled with well-structured flavors of ripe pear, apple and lemon tart, loaded with luscious creaminess. Dried green herb and spice details show on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 1,615 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: A plush style, with a concentrated creaminess to the zesty dark cherry, wild plum and blueberry notes, showing some peppery accents. Delivers a hint of dried beef midpalate, offering plenty of freshness and tannic grip on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 3,100 cases made.

name: Syrah Duriense Superior
review: A plush and juicy style, featuring plenty of rich spice notes to the cherry tart and plum pudding flavors. Offers dried mint and sage accents midpalate, with some chocolate hints on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 800 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Lots of grapey character, with prunes. Follows through to a full-bodied palate, with very sweet fruit and a plummy finish. Soft and round. Best after 2010. 1,300 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Racy, young vintage Port. Intense aromas of raspberries and wet earth. Full-bodied and medium-sweet, with chewy tannins and a ripe, raisiny aftertaste. Best after 2007. 1,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Elegant, well-balanced Port, with floral, berry and mineral aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a long, caressing finish. Best after 2005.

name: Douro
review: Robust, with lively acidity and a firm structure behind the flavors of blackberry, dark cherry and currant. Espresso notes fill the finish, along with plenty of mineral and dark chocolate details. Drink now through 2019. 37,500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Offers an effusive aroma of red fruits, with intense, lively flavors to match, including boysenberry, blueberry and blackberry flanked up by expressive notes of underbrush and spice. The finish shows notes of spice and crushed stone. Drink now through 2017. 20,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Pretty red, with vibrant red cherry, plum and berry flavors. Good structure and supple tannins, with a lingering finish of coffee and spice. Just delicious. Drink now through 2004. 9,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Delicious medium-bodied red. Focused and fresh-tasting, with lovely red plum and berry aromas and flavors, and mineral notes as well. Firm finish, with lingering berry and dark chocolate elements. Drink now through 2004. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Douro Flor de Crasto
review: Pure and refreshing, with crisp flavors of raspberry, red currant and damson plum. Slate and white pepper details linger on the finish, supported by medium-grained tannins. Drink now through 2018. 19,416 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A voluptuous wine, rich and full-bodied, filled with vibrant fruit and spice flavors, notes of plum, cherry and leather. There's a nice juiciness too, and some appealing cinnamon and brown sugar flavors linger on the finish. 900 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: This savory white features flavors of onion tart, green fig and fresh-cut green apple, accented by plenty of green herbal notes. Shows minerally cut to the finish. Drink now through 2019. 7,500 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: Firm and well-focused. Berry and dried cherry flavors are the hallmarks of this easy-to-drink medium-bodied red. Notes of sandalwood, leather and spice liven up the finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: This young Vintage Port has a lovely nose, with sweet berry and wet earth notes and a minerally, almost gun flinty undertone. There's a superstemmy undercurrent as well. Full and very layered with fruit and tannins. Medium sweet, with a long, soft and clean finish. Needs a little more tannin backbone to be outstanding. Best after 2014. 220 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Wild blackberry and currant notes show grilled herb and minerally underpinnings in this medium-bodied, spicy red. Integrated tannins give texture to the smoky finish. Drink now through 2021. 33,333 cases made.

name: Douro
review: There's good focus and concentration to the well-spiced flavors of dark currant, cherry and raspberry. Firm in texture, with notes of nutmeg and chocolate on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 17,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Nicely balanced, with a rush of juicy red fruit flavors that announce an elegant array of spice notes, especially sandalwood. The firm finish shows some smoky elements, as well as cappuccino hints. Drink now through 2016. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: Aromas and flavors of raspberry, blueberry and dark cherry, backed by fine-grained tannins and plenty of spicy notes. The finish is long, with dark chocolate and clove. Tinta Roriz, Tinta Barroca, Touriga Franca and Touriga Nacional. Drink now through 2010. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: Lively and supple, with pretty red plum and raspberry flavors, with some pepper and spice notes. Meaty elements chime in on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Douro Flor
review: Taut and juicy, with red plum and currant flavors joined by notes of sandalwood. Licorice and black olive hints mark the finish. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca and Touriga Nacional. Drink now through 2014. 700 cases imported.

name: Douro Flor de Crasto
review: Shows notes of hot stone to the dried berry, red licorice and cherry flavors. Peppery details emerge midpalate, with a minerally finish. Drink now through 2018. 12,300 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Beefy tasting medium-bodied red, with a firm structure and flavors of plum, dried cherry and spice. Notes of mineral and leather linger with hot stone notes on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 500 cases imported.

name: Douro Superior
review: Ripe and medium-bodied, offering dark plum and smoked cherry flavors that drip with plenty of spiced apple notes, with a firm finish. Drink now.

name: Douro White
review: Well-rounded, with ripe tropical fruit flavors and lemon-lime notes that combine for a supple texture. Cream and spice details fill the fresh, crunchy finish. Drink now. 5,666 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: Ripe tangerine and pear flavors, with creamy accents, dominate this juicy style. The broad finish offers flan and cherry tart notes, revealing a hint of chamomile tea. Drink now. 5,666 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Aromas of plum and strawberry follow through to a medium-bodied, medium-sweet palate, with a soft, round finish. Shows a warm and cuddly character. Drink now. 2,715 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Delicate and medium-bodied, with fresh berry and cherry flavors and a hint of red-flesh peach and pepper. An easygoing red that's lively and clean-tasting. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: Well-balanced, medium- to full-bodied red, with pleasant red plum and berry flavors, and pretty vanilla notes. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Douro Flor de Crasto
review: This shows good snap to the red fruit flavors, which feature notes of savory herb and slate. Hints of licorice mark the crisp finish. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca, Touriga Nacional. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Douro Vinha Maria Teresa
review: A walk on the wild side, with flavors of mint, licorice and red plum, which turn just a bit lifted on the finish. Still, it has plenty of character and concentration. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: Good concentration to the ripe pear, apricot and apple flavors gives this white some depth. Melon, cream and spice notes linger on the finish. Rabigato, Gouveio and Roupeiro. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Douro White
review: This fruity white offers crisp, rich flavors of ripe apple and pear, with hints of butterscotch and spice, followed by smoky notes on the finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Dark brick red-colored, with ripe plum and earth aromas and flavors. Medium- to full-bodied with chunky tannins and a sweet, long, fruity finish. Tastes fresher than it looks. Rich and chewy. Drink now or hold.

name: Douro
review: Medium-bodied, with fresh and juicy flavors of boysenberry and blueberry that show hints of white pepper. The finish features accents of mocha and cream. Drink now. 16,083 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Fruity and juicy, with plenty of cherry, red plum and berry flavors. There's a nice creamy element that runs through to the finish. Drink now. 22,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Fairly ripe and concentrated, with lovely berry, cherry and plum flavors and a nice touch of cassis that gives it extra punch. Drink now for its generosity of flavor. 3,400 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: An interesting mix of dried herb and mint flavors gives this a zesty edge. Dried pineapple and pear notes join in, leading to a buttery accent on the finish. Drink now.

name: Late Bottled Port Traditional Unfiltered
review: Rather floral, with a berry and mineral undertone. Medium-bodied and medium sweet, with a balance of tannins and a sweet aftertaste. Very good indeed. Drink now.

name: Vintage Port
review: Fresh and spicy, with peppery and fruity aromas. Medium-bodied, medium sweet, with a light finish. Lacks a bit of grip. Early drinker. Best after 2006. 1,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Elegant and well made. Dark ruby colored with floral, berry aromas which follow through to a medium-bodied palate. Medium sweet with fine tannins and a fresh aftertaste. For early drinking. Drink now through 2003.

name: Douro
review: Lively aromas and flavors of blueberry and cherry are reminiscent of a cru Beaujolais. The light, spicy finish features sandalwood notes. Drink now. 35,830 cases made.

name: Douro Flor de Crasto
review: Juicy, with red berry and cherry tart flavors, complemented by spicy accents. The soft finish carries tobacco and cedar notes. Drink now. 10,166 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: A balanced yet very simple wine. Shows improvement from earlier vintages. Deep purple, with a black pepper nose, medium-bodied, with medium tannins and very grapy, black pepper flavors. One-dimensional.

name: Vintage Port
review: This was shipped as a Constantino vintage Port, although the cork was branded with "Crasto" on its side. Light fruit, with lovely, almost tawnylike flavors--not bad for a '58. Medium garnet, with a chocolate, cherry vanilla nose, light-bodied, with sweet spice, chocolate fruit flavors, light silky tannins and a short finish.

name: Douro Flor de Crasto
review: Overripe, with an inky aroma and candied red fruit flavors. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 4,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Short, simple and drinkable. Too light for a '85. Medium ruby, with a light, grapy, Gamay-like nose, medium-bodied, with light tannins and a light, spicy finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: Clean but not a vintage Port in structure. Medium ruby with a garnet edge, very strange, perfumed, crème de cassis nose, medium- to light-bodied, with very sweet and simple fruit flavors. Lacks structure.

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde Superior
review: Medium-bodied, with juicy apple, pear and spicy flavors that are clean and crisp. A step up for Vinho Verde. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde
review: Richer than most Portuguese whites, this has well-defined lemon, orange peel and almond flavors, with buttery notes on the crisp finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Bairrada Encontro 1
review: Refined red, with red plum, berry and raspberry flavors, with minerally elements and tobacco leaf notes. Dusty tannins on the finish, with white pepper and sanguine elements. Impressive for this appellation. Baga. Drink now through 2008. 233 cases made.

name: Merlot-Baga Bairrada Q do E
review: There's a firm snap to the dark currant, plum and blackberry flavors, showing some pastry notes. The lusciously spiced finish is powerful and rich, with hints of dark chocolate. Drink now through 2020. 8,333 cases made.

name: Bairrada Q do E
review: A supple Portuguese red, showing lush flavors of red cherry, licorice and blackberry. Balanced and well-structured, with finish of Asian spice. Try with roast duck. Drink now through 2012. 18,000 cases made.

name: Bical Bairrada Q do E
review: Rich and crisp, with concentrated ripe pear, apple tart and lemon curd flavors, filled with honeysuckle notes. The minerally finish delivers sea salt and dried savory details. Drink now through 2019. 1,666 cases made.

name: Bairrada Q do E
review: An inky red, exhibiting dense flavors of dark plum and raspberry, with plenty of mocha overtones. The ripe finish of chocolate and spice is well-proportioned. Merlot and Baga. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Bairrada
review: Dense and chewy, with flavors of mocha, licorice and dark plum. The muscular finish has plenty of dark chocolate. Drink now through 2010. 120,000 cases made.

name: Bairrada
review: A balanced red, showing berry and red plum flavors, with notes of milk chocolate on the juicy finish.  15,000 cases made.

name: Bairrada Q do E
review: A crisp red, this shows berry and plum flavors as well as dusty, minerally notes on the finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Bairrada Solão
review: Bright, with crushed red fruit flavors and some pepper notes. Clean, crisp finish. Baga, Castelão and Tinta Pinheira. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Alvarinho Minho Dorado
review: Fruity and ripe, with hints of richness to the peach, honeydew melon and dried apricot flavors, which feature plenty of creaminess. The plush finish shows apple tart notes. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Alvarinho-Trajadura Minho Auratus
review: Offers intensely ripe yet aromatic flavors of wild currant, gooseberry and guava, accented by juicy notes of  honey and custard. Crunchy finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Alvarinho-Trajadura Minho Auratus
review: Plenty of tropical flavors and spice notes, but they turn just a tad cloying on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Vinho Verde Avesso
review: Ripe and tinny-tasting, with modest tart apple and lemon rind flavors. Drink now. 3,335 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Massive and muscular, with plenty of grip and loads of dark plum and bittersweet chocolate flavors. Made in a no-holds-barred style, with powerful tannins and a cast-iron structure, yet retains an impressive elegance, especially on the long, spicy finish. Tempting now, but better to wait. Best from 2007 through 2012. 1,100 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Concentrated and still youthful despite its age, this red has rich and focused flavors of plum, dark cherry and berry that are intense yet supple. Loads of chocolate and spicy notes on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 930 cases made.

name: Douro Vinha do Fojo
review: A traditional-style red, with plum and dried cherry flavors and meaty, gamy overtones. Retains good balance and freshness. The long, supple finish is filled with brown sugar and cardamom. Drink now. 1,750 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Medium- to full-bodied, with red plum, licorice and berry flavors that extend into the firm and balanced finish. Drink with roasted meats. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Lisboa White
review: A fruity style, with red peach and Golden Delicious apple flavors that are supple and open-textured. Creamy midpalate, featuring a plush and well-spiced finish. Arinto, Fernão Pires, Chardonnay and Verdelho. Drink now. 100,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A creamy red, showing plenty of red plum and mineral flavors, with smoke and iron on the crisp finish. Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz and Tinta Barroca. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Very ripe and rich palate with a solid tannin structure below the fruit. Medium- to full-bodied and medium-sweet, with a good chewy finish. This is a new single-quinta wine from Rozes and shows potential.   Score range: 89-91

name: Douro Reserva
review: Very elegant and seductive, with a perfumed aroma of raspberry ganache followed by flavors of spiced red cherry, plum and pomegranate. Has fine-grained tannins on the sandalwood-filled finish. Drink now through 2012. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Bright, with a slightly high pitch to the mix of red currant, pomegranate and blackberry fruit, laced with a light menthol hint. Has solid flesh around the edges, backed by a racy detail on the finish. Best from 2022 through 2034. 60 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Plenty of delicate floral notes to the powerful red plum and raspberry tart flavors, remaining fresh and crunchy. Chocolate and spice details fill the luscious finish. Best from 2020 through 2030. 350 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Excellent, generous young Port. Fantastic aromas of crushed berries, licorice and flowers. Full-bodied, thick and rich with lovely fruit and soft, yet powerful tannins. Very long. Best after 2007. 1,100 cases made.

name: Douro White label
review: A violet aroma leads to focused and pure flavors of crushed cherry, raspberry and blueberry in this red, wich delivers vibrant acidity, offering a zesty finish of Asian spice and cocoa powder. Drink now through 2020. 56 cases imported.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Just like real Vintage Port. Serious LBV. Gorgeous. Black color. Very grapey, with lots of licorice and wet earth character. Medium- to full-bodied, with medium, chewy tannins and a long finish. Needs time. Best after 2003. 2,750 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: The rich, grapey aromas are lovely in this full-bodied, very sweet young Vintage Port, which is luscious and juicy, with loads of plum jam and big, velvety tannins. Best after 2015. 595 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: The best ever made at this estate and one to watch in the future. Like a lagar full of grapes fermenting; big and powerful tar and raisin character. Full-bodied, sweet, tannic, in an extracted style. Try in 2000.

name: Vintage Port
review: Round, juicy young Port, with lots of grape and berry character. Full-bodied, velvety and medium sweet. Pretty. Best after 2010. 1,660 cases made.

name: White Port
review: Dried apricot and savory spicy flavors are matched to firm acidity. Finishes with flourishes of butterscotch and smoke. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Shows plenty of licorice snap to the dried berry, cherry and raspberry flavors, accented by a hint of mint. The dense and muscular finish features powerful notes of iron and mineral. Drink now through 2016.

name: Tawny Port
review: Smoky and rich-tasting, with flavors of hazelnut, roasted plum and chestnut. Plummy notes on the finish.  Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port Colheita
review: Red berry and spiced plum flavors feature notes of green herb. Fresh on the short finish, with cinnamon accents. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: A soft and cuddly young Port. Black color, with grape, raisin and crushed raspberry character. Full-bodied and medium sweet, with velvety tannins and a medium finish. Best after 2005. 15,000 cases made.

name: Douro Green label
review: Medium-bodied, with a soft core of blueberry and raspberry jam flavors, featuring notes of cinnamon spice. Vanilla accents grace the broad finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port Unfiltered
review: Features aromas of licorice and raisin, with dark fruit. Medium-bodied and medium sweet, offering slightly drying tannins. This is fruity and pleasant. Give it a little more bottle age. Drink now. 2,750 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old
review: Light-colored and quite delicious with its good hazlenut, caramel and toasted almond flavors. Textbook tawny. You could try it slightly chilled.

name: Ruby Port
review: Fruity, with plum pudding and red berry flavors that have milk chocolate notes. Ripe on the finish.  Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: A thick and rich style, slightly heavy, with a serious concentration of blackberry and boysenberry character and a hint of earth. Medium- to full-bodied, with lots of sweet fruit and a slightly raisiny finish. Drink now. 1,330 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Deep and dark ruby, with wonderful dark chocolate and berry aromas and flavors. It's medium-bodied and quite sweet, with medium tannins and a fine finish. Try after 1998.

name: Vintage Port
review: This sweet, fruity, agreeable Port offers lots of blackberry and cherry flavors and a smooth finish. Should be at its best now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Pleasant on the palate, this '85 was quite forward as of '90. Deep ruby, with a very ripe and roasted nose, medium-bodied with very sweet fruit flavors and a soft mouth-feel.

name: Vintage Port
review: There are some lovely aromas and nice fruit on the palate but it is really dry on finish. Medium red with a garnet hue, and simple fresh cherry aromas, medium-bodied, with sweet berry flavors, light tannins, and short dry finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: Not much here, it is very simple and sweet, almost cloying. Medium red-ruby, with a roasted nut and beet nose, medium-bodied with sweet fruit flavors and a light finish.

name: Vinho Verde Vinha Verde
review: Light and lean white, distinctive in flavor, showing crisp apple and grapefruit accents. Spritzy enough to keep it lively.

name: Vinho Verde Vinha Verde
review: Simple and vinous, with modest apple and citrus flavors. A little fizz on the finish.

name: Syrah Lisboa 24
review: A polished red, with juniper berry notes to the deep well of roasted cherry, mocha and cherry pie flavors. Asian spice details show on the finish, revealing hints of black truffle. Impressive for the appellation. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2019.

name: Syrah Lisboa 24
review: Firm and juicy, with shadings of hot stone and paprika to the flavors of roasted plum and dried berry, this has good concentration, with a finish that offers a mix of cedary and creamy notes. Drink now through 2018.

name: Estremadura Reserva
review: Very plush and fresh-tasting despite its age. A core of raspberry, red plum and cherry flavors is joined by smoky and spicy notes on the crisp finish. Syrah and Viognier. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Lisboa Reserva
review: This rich version offers cherry and raspberry flavors, with a brambly texture, accented by sanguine notes. Finishes with ferrous details, as well as plenty of savory spice accents. Drink now through 2018. 1,665 cases made.

name: Lisboa Reserva
review: Robust and full-bodied, with a sense of power to the well-sculpted flavors of dried berry, plum compote and mincemeat. A touch gritty, but within bounds, delivering a finish filled with bittersweet chocolate notes. Drink now through 2016. 10,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Lisboa 24
review: A dense and muscular red, with a smoky edge to the ripe dark fruit flavors. Beefy accents chime in as well, lingering on the brooding finish with notes of ground coffee. Drink now. 75 cases made.

name: Syrah Lisboa Lybra
review: Suave, with vibrant cherry and boysenberry flavors that feature plenty of leaf accents. Notes of meat and spice mark the ripe, powerful finish. Drink now through 2016. 915 cases made.

name: Viognier Estremadura Madrigal
review: This rich wine is filled with ripe peach and glazed citrus flavors that are backed up by mineral, almond and spice. Full-bodied, with plenty of acidity and a slightly buttery finish. Drink now through 2012. 100 cases imported.

name: Viognier-Arinto-Marsanne Lisboa Lybra
review: Crunchy peach and pear notes are flanked by green herb and mineral details in this youthful white. Zippy acidity lingers into a salty finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Lisboa Reserva
review: Kirsch, plum and blackberry compote notes are matched to spice box and floral aromas in this lithe, full-bodied red. Licorice accents linger into the moderately tannic finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Viognier Lisboa Madrigal
review: Floral and lightly honeyed, this medium-bodied white is fresh and aromatic, with lingering creamed peach, herb and pear notes marking the finish. Drink now. 580 cases made.

name: Viognier Lisboa Madrigal
review: Medium-bodied and fresh-tasting, with red peach, celery root and lavender flavors that are balanced and well-structured. Spicy finish.  Drink now. 75 cases imported.

name: Syrah Estremadura Reserva
review: This full-bodied red has some nice crushed red fruit and berry flavors, which mix with spicy notes on the peppery finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Lisboa Lybra
review: Medium-bodied, with blackberry, cassis and dried cherry flavors sprinkled with spice and olive details. The moderate tannins lend texture to the herb-tinged finish. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Viognier-Arinto-Marsanne Lisboa Lybra
review: A crisp white, with an engaging savoriness to the fresh-cut apple and Key lime pie flavors. The crunchy finish has some minty accents.  Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Syrah Lisboa Lybra
review: The cherry and raspberry flavors are snappy in this fruity red. Licorice notes show on the finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Estremadura Vinha da Nora
review: Peppery-tasting red, with plum and red cherry flavors, which add to the lively finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Lisboa Têmpera
review: Notes of cinnamon and cardamom accent the plum and red currant flavors in this red. The spicy finish has some graphite hints. Drink now.

name: Tinta Roriz Lisboa Têmpera
review: A savory and rustic red, with sinewy flavors of dried berry and dark cherry that turn tart on the finish. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 80 cases made.

name: Viognier Estremadura Madrigal
review: Cloying peach and apricot notes fill this medium-bodied white. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Viognier Lisboa Madrigal
review: The ripe peach and apple flavors turn muddled, with spicy overtones on the finish. Drink now. 420 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Ripe, rich and full-bodied, with fine balance to the dark plum, kirsch and cherry flavors. Long finish of chocolate mousse and raspberry. Drink now through 2012. 236 cases made.

name: Douro
review: This full-bodied red has concentration and finesse, with crushed blackberry, blueberry and plum notes woven together by mineral, mocha and spice box details. Supple tannins frame the slate-infused finish. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Sousão. Drink now through 2022. 500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Ripe, with plenty of muscle behind the red plum and dark cherry flavors that feature notes of maple and cream. Pepper and mineral accents on the finish. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Sousão. Drink now through 2018.

name: Alentejo Casa dos Zagalos Reserva
review: Mineral and tar led to dark plum and rose petal flavors that are flanked by mocha and spice. Finishes with iron and slate. Drink now. 6,500 cases made.

name: Alentejo Estremoz
review: Good focus and concentration in this medium- to full-bodied red, with flavors of dark cherry, cassis and smoke. Kirschlike notes chime in on the finish. Drink now through 2004.

name: Alentejo Vinha do Mouro Estremoz
review: Aromas and flavors of blueberry dominate this bright and juicy Portuguese red. The supple finish oozes fruit, with soft tannins. Drink now.

name: Alentejo Casa dos Zagalos
review: Lively, medium-bodied red, with focused berry and red plum flavors, with some leathery notes mixed in. Peppery finish. Drink now.

name: Alentejo Estremoz
review: Supple and mature, featuring notes of iodine to the dried berry and cherry flavors. Savory herbal elements chime in on the finish. Drink now. 2,080 cases made.

name: Alentejo Estremoz Vinha do Mouro
review: Medium-bodied, with well-spiced plum compote and raspberry tart flavors. Short finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Alentejo Casa dos Zagalos
review: Dried berry flavors up front are flanked by herbal notes on the tart finish. Drink now.

name: Alentejo Estremoz
review: Tired-tasting, with stewy flavors and a dirty finish. 1,850 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: Toffee aromas leads to a complex array of fig, mineral, iron and dark fruit flavors that are rich and intense. The long, caressing finish features spicy notes, with hints of fresh mint. Amazingly elegant.—Non-blind Quinta do Noval Nacional retrospective (February 2011). Drink now through 2025. 250 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: This wine is so incredibly youthful, it is hard to believe it isn't a '85. Still inky black in color, with fresh grapy, earthy aromas, extremely full-bodied, with thick, tough, intense grapy flavors, full tannins and a tight finish. It still seems closed and dumb. Best from 2000 through 2005.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: Perhaps one of the greatest wines ever produced. I tasted it with a London collector who bought the wine at auction in '88. The Port is still incredibly rich and youthful, medium ruby, with a focused chocolate and cherry nose, medium-bodied, with great balance, a superb concentration of fruit and a never-ending finish. Will continue to improve.

name: Vintage Port
review: On most occasions, this wine lives up to its lofty reputation. It has an impressive balance of fruit and tannins, with plenty of fresh, youthful fruit flavors. Deep ruby, with ripe chocolate, berry and cherry aromas, full-bodied, with very round, sweet fruit flavors and silky tannins.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: This sports serious heft, with a core of brooding fig jam, ganache, Christmas pudding and pastis-soaked black currant notes, followed by a powerhouse finish of smoldering charcoal and tar. The feel is remarkably velvety and rounded overall, with a mouthwatering licorice root element adding to the already considerable length. Best from 2026 through 2056. 40 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: This wine was a knockout in a recent blind tasting of nearly a dozen '34s and '35s. In '85, however, another bottle was past its prime. The good bottle was in suspended animation, ruby-red with rich raisin and cassis aromas, very ripe, smoky raisin flavors, medium tannins and a lingering finish. Good bottles will improve with age.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: Offers powerfully spicy aromas and flavors, with notes of dark chocolate, plum pudding and dark cherry, accented by a firm minerality. The endless finish of bittersweet chocolate and mincemeat shows loads of grip. Best from 2035 through 2055. 30 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: Powerfully rich, delivering plush fig, dark cherry and plum confit flavors. Very silky, with plenty of grip and a long, fruity finish filled with effusive pepper and spice notes.—Non-blind Quinta do Noval Nacional retrospective (February 2011). Drink now through 2030. 250 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: A massive wine, what one expects from Nacional in a solid vintage. Deep ruby, with an intense ripe berry nose, full-bodied, very tightly knit, with masses of fruit flavors and tannins and a very long finish.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: The focused fruit zeros in on the palate. Excellent deep ruby, very intense black cherry and plum aromas, full-bodied, with incredibly focused fruit flavors, full tannins and a balanced finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: Vibrant, with luscious yet elegant mineral-infused flavors of dark currant, ripe cherry, green fig and raspberry. Shows ample pepper notes, with the tannins offering plenty of muscle and grip on the long, silky finish. Complex and restrained. Best from 2022 through 2047. 800 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: A very fruity aroma leads to concentrated flavors of raspberry, iron, fig, dark plum, slate and smoke. Refined and unctuous, with a deep well of molten chocolate. Long finish.—Non-blind Quinta do Noval Nacional retrospective (February 2011). Best from 2012 through 2032. 200 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: What a nose. Ripe fruit, with chocolate, blackberries and raisins. Full-bodied and medium sweet, with velvety tannins. Finish goes on and on. Layered and wonderful. Best after 2014. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Very fine young Port. Fascinating aromas of crushed fruit, tar and wet earth. Turns floral. Full-bodied, medium sweet, with chewy, velvety tannins and a long finish. Grips your mouth. A balanced and caressing Noval. Best after 2012. 1,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Juicy and fleshy in feel, with rather youthful notes of plum, blackberry and boysenberry compote pumping out from the core, backed by sweet black licorice and warm fruitcake flavors. Tempting now for the abundance of fruit, but there's a ton of brambly energy through the finish, so this isn't going anywhere anytime soon.--1997 Vintage Port retrospective (January 2017). Best from 2020 through 2040. 1,550 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: Sauve and silky, with peppery overtones to the intense plum confit, dark currant, cherry and chocolate flavors, with hints of licorice. Vibrant, with plenty of youthful grip. The powerful finish is long and well-spiced.Non-blind Quinta do Noval Nacional retrospective (February 2011). Best from 2015 through 2040.

name: Douro
review: Displays intense aromas of red plum and dark cherry, with finely chiseled flavors to match that are joined by briary notes and hints of mint, savory herb and Asian spice. The long, lush and powerful finish is quite creamy. An elegant red. Drink now through 2016. 100 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: This is very polished in feel, with long, caressing, fine-grained structure that allows plum eau-de-vie, boysenberry puree and blackberry cobbler notes to play out at their leisure. Light anise and ganache hints accent the finish while the fruit blazes through. Rock 'em, sock 'em Port. Best from 2030 through 2045. 2,600 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Powerful and rich, with deep flavors of crushed red plum, dark cherry and dried raspberry, featuring a shading of graphite and smoke. Presents luscious spicy details on the finish. Drink now through 2045. 250 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Muscular and ripe, showing fabulous potential. The best Noval in decades, it's full-bodied, with a fruity character, well-integrated, chewy tannins and a medium finish. A long-term wine that needs age to mellow. Best after 2010.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: Supple, with rich chocolate and dark plum flavors balanced by fresh, ferrous notes. A touch closed now, and filled with plenty of rich smoky and inky notes that take on an almost oily consistency. Very firm finish.—Non-blind Quinta do Noval Nacional retrospective (February 2011). Best from 2015 through 2030. 250 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: After a few rather weak years, this puts Nacional back on top. Very deep ruby-black, with ripe raisiny aromas, an abundance of fruit and tannins and an extremely thick and viscous finish.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: This is exciting to drink now but try to hold yourself back. Deep ruby, with a ripe cassis and plum nose, lots of cassis, vanilla and fruit flavors, medium tannins and a long finish.

name: Tawny Port 40 Year Old
review: Intensely fruity, delivering vibrant orange zest, dried mango, apricot compote and baked apple flavors that are plush, well-structured and long. Notes of sage and honey mark the mineral-infused finish. Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Floral aromas and flavors are backed up by plenty of grip in this intense, powerful Vintage Port, which is deep purple in color, with medium tannins and vibrant raspberry, blackberry and cream flavors. Best after 2020.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: This Port shows the essence of freshly crushed grapes. It is as dark as black ink, with a very closed nose, very full-bodied and extremely tannic, with masses of fruit flavors.

name: Vintage Port Silval
review: Black in color, with intense aromas of grilled meat, raisins and prunes. Full-bodied, lightly sweet and tannic. Chewy, with loads of black licorice on the finish. Best after 2012. 100 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port Silval
review: Superdark and powerful. Shows raisin, spice, coffee and violet aromas. Full-bodied, very chewy, with lots of grip and loads of fruit. Very long in the mouth. Outstanding young Port. Supervalue here. Best after 2012. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A refined red, with finely textured flavors of cherry, plum tart and dried raspberry. Offers sinewy tannins and plenty of creamy notes. The long and rich finish presents ample mineral and spice accents. Drink now through 2020. 50 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: A rich and powerful red, offering layered flavors of dark plum, mulled cherry, olive and black licorice. Features an elegant midpalate, with a long finish of dark chocolate and spice. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: Finely crafted and intense Portuguese red, with dense flavors of dark plum, cherry and kirsch accented by plenty of graphite and mineral. Taut, muscular finish is filled with bittersweet chocolate. Best from 2010 through 2014. 100 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: Very suave. Peppery at first, then fills the mouth with ripe, rich red plum, cherry and raspberry flavors, with seductive dark chocolate and hints of truffle. Has plenty of licorice notes, with silky tannins that carry the flavors through the long finish. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Cão and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2014. 900 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port Unfiltered
review: This is succulent and fruity, with concentrated flavors of dark plum, blackberry and chocolate mousse that are backed by good grip. The snappy finish features hints of licorice. Drink now through 2025. 800 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port Colheita
review: Fresh, powerful and fruity, with red plum, dried cherry and marzipan flavors loaded with lithe acidity. Hazelnut cream and butterscotch notes fill the seductively smoky finish, which shows hints of green olive. Drink now. 150 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Very complex, with intense aromas of squeezed tangerine, blackberry and blueberry. Full-bodied, medium sweet and chewy. Extracted yet balanced, with an intense fruity and grapey character. Tight and reserved on the finish. Best after 2015. 1,800 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: A wine with superb balance and class. Medium ruby-garnet, with a strawberry and plum nose, medium-bodied, with lovely, sweet strawberry and plum flavors and an elegant finish. Can improve with age.

name: Vintage Port
review: Still incredibly tough and youthful. It drinks better one or two hours after decanting. Deep ruby-garnet, with ripe raspberry and plum aromas, full-bodied, with thick, chewy fruit flavors and a long finish.

name: Douro
review: There's fine balance and concentration to this full-bodied red, which offers crushed red fruit and mineral flavors amid plenty of pepper and spice. The intense finish features mocha and dark chocolate. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Duriense Cedro
review: Very pure-tasting, with elegant cherry, plum and smoked meat flavors. Raspberry, olive and savory herb fill the chiseled finish. Shows real pedigree, with fine tannins and plenty of power. Needs time. Best from 2011 through 2016. 500 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old
review: An elegant, delicate Tawny, with a full raft of dried white fruit, toffee, cream and butter flavors. The bright finish offers pear tart and spice notes, with suave, smoky overtones. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old
review: Pure, fresh and minerally, this elegant tawny offers a rich mix of glazed apricot, dried citrus, peach and butterscotch flavors, wrapped in plenty of creamy notes. Offers a spicy finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port Colheita
review: Smooth and elegant, this shows an intense dried citrus note to the dried apricot, pear and apple flavors. Toffee and spice notes mark the long finish, which also features accents of white pepper. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Has lots of grapey, stemmy, rich aromas. Full-bodied, lightly sweet and chewy, with plenty of grip. Layered and rich. Serious and structured. All there for the vintage. Best after 2017.

name: Vintage Port
review: This is as well-made as a fine Swiss watch. Medium ruby with a garnet rim, with aromas of perfume, flowers and oranges, medium-bodied, with sweet floral, orange and plum flavors, a silky mouth-feel and a sweet finish. Delicious.

name: Vintage Port Silval
review: Very floral, with plenty of fruit on the nose, turning to dried stem. Full-bodied, with a solid core of fruit and silky tannins. Long and caressing. Serious and youthful still. Keeps on getting better. '77/'85/'97 blind Port retrospective. Best after 2008.

name: Douro
review: Raspberry and currant notes mesh with mineral, tarragon and licorice details in this concentrated, smoke-tinged red. Tangy accents linger on the long finish. Offers fleshy tannins. Drink now through 2023. 1,570 cases made.

name: Duriense Cedro
review: Caresses the mouth with rich, refined blackberry, cream and dark plum flavors, flanked by rich, chocolaty notes. The luscious finish shows mocha and licorice, with hints of savory herbs. This really sings. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2012. 1,600 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old
review: Concentrated flavors of dried pear, apricot, cherry and spice combine into this seamless package. The finish features toffee and orange zest notes, with hints of smoke. Drink now. 750 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old
review: An elegant and refined tawny, with loads of spicy notes to the plum tart, sandalwood and baked cherry flavors. Vanilla and spice accents fill the finish, featuring fresh details of citrus peel and ground nutmeg. Drink now. 180 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port Colheita
review: Offers maple, butterscotch and ripe cherry flavors, with plenty of dried citrus and nutmeg notes. Seductively smoky, presenting a long finish of dried apricot and fig compote. Suave and supple. Drink now through 2020. 120 cases imported.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: This sports a firm core of dried raspberry, dark cherry and smoke-infused kirsch notes that are long and savory. Rich beefy and sandalwood accents lingers on the muscular finish. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Powerfully fruity, filled with intense and pure-tasting flavors of red currant, dark plum and licorice, flanked by notes of black olive and mocha. The long and juicy finish echoes with red raspberry and spice. Drink now through 2020. 50 cases imported.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Refined and elegant, with concentrated flavors of cherry, raspberry, cream, cherry tart and spice. Interesting notes of beef and mineral linger on the broad finish. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: A solid, textbook version, this has flesh and weight, with vivid blueberry, plum and blackberry compote flavors carried by lightly brambly grip through the licorice-fueled finish.  Best from 2020 through 2035. 1,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Redolent of Christmas pudding and dark plum flavors, with plenty of dark chocolate elements, this features modest length on the finish, which is filled with cherry notes. Best from 2018 through 2035. 1,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: This is the best Noval made in three decades and is still fairly reasonable in price considering the quality. It is powerful, rich and fruity on the palate -- almost raw. Medium ruby, with coffee and plum aromas, full-bodied, with sweet tea, coffee and plum flavors and medium tannins. It will improve with age.

name: Duriense Labrador
review: This pretty, peppery red offers fine balance and texture. Cherry, mineral and spice flood the midpalate, with notes of mocha, mineral and dark chocolate on the finish. Syrah. Drink now through 2015. 10 cases imported.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: An outstanding LBV. Black in color, with wonderful aromas of blackberries, cherries and licorice, it's full-bodied and medium sweet, with soft tannins and a long finish. Delicious now and will improve with age. Great value considering the quality. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2008. 10,000 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port Unfiltered
review: Features lots of pepper notes to the plum and dark cherry flavors, with graphite accents. Creamy and spicy on the finish, showing hints of milk chocolate. Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Late Bottled Port Unfiltered
review: Balanced and fresh, with modest grip to the dark fruit and spice flavors, wrapping around the tongue with ample acidity. Minerally finish. Drink now. 900 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old
review: This smells just like English Christmas cake. Full-bodied and very sweet, with plenty of toffee and dried fruit character on the finish. Really yummy. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Savory and sleek, with grilled herb and mineral notes, accented by currant and wild berry fruit. Savory spice and baker's chocolate details mingle on the grippy finish. Drink now through 2022. 1,570 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Outstanding but slightly rustic, with earthy, berry aromas and flavors and chunky, chewy texture. Full in body, medium sweet, with full tannins and a slightly coarse finish. Needs time. Best after 2007.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: Most of the '50s are starting to turn to tawnies, but this is still 100 percent vintage. Medium light ruby with a garnet edge, rich sawdust, plum and cedar aromas, full-bodied, with sweet plum and earth flavors and a long finish.

name: Vintage Port Quinta do Roriz
review: An extremely silky, well-made '95 with plum, berry and spice aromas and flavors. Medium- to full-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a long, silky finish. Best after 2006.

name: Vintage Port Silval
review: This is a wonderfully focused and intense young Vintage Port, with notes of flowers, crushed berries and cherry. Full-bodied and very sweet, with ripe berry and jam flavors. Long and powerful. Best after 2016. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Savory spice and dried herb elements frame the boysenberry and currant fruit in this supple, full-bodied red, with minerally and zesty aromas remaining on the finish. Moderate tannins. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Duriense Cedro
review: This red is well-crafted, with red berry, plum and bay leaf notes added to an undertone of savory spice. Hints of mocha, mineral and espresso lend interest to the chewy finish. Drink now through 2020. 3,440 cases made.

name: Duriense Cedro
review: Shows good cut to the dark plum and cherry flavors, with a rich shading of slate and cardamom details. The lively finish has white pepper and cocoa powder accents, supported by sinewy tannins. Drink now through 2018. 700 cases imported.

name: Duriense Cedro
review: A dense red, with an opulent, spicy aroma, followed by chewy flavors of chocolate, dark plum and French roast. There's firm acidity throughout, and this finishes with dusty, ferrous notes. Best from 2012 through 2015. 500 cases imported.

name: Duriense Cedro do Noval
review: A juicy red, with concentrated red plum and raspberry flavors that offer snappy acidity. Licorice notes show midpalate, leading to a finish filled with minerally and pepper accents. Drink now through 2019. 600 cases imported.

name: Late Bottled Port Unfiltered
review: Medium-weight, showing spice and dried beef accents to the juicy red plum and wild cherry flavors. Displays good grip on the finish, with concentrated dark chocolate and candied mint notes. Drink now through 2016. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Syrah Duriense Labrador
review: Firmly structured, featuring snappy flavors of crushed red and dark fruit, with violet overtones. Dark chocolate lingers on the muscular finish of spice and mocha. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port
review: Silky-tasting, with very fresh and vibrant flavors of dark plum, chocolate and spice. The lush finish is supple and refined. Drink now. 700 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old
review: This is layered with plush flavors of Christmas pudding, plum tart and raspberry, delivering details of caramel and dried berry, with plenty of buttery accents on the finish. Drink now. 900 cases imported.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: There are plenty of hot stone notes to the luscious raspberry and dried cherry flavors. Black olive accents on the richly sanguine finish.  Drink now through 2019. 10 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: This was not declared officially by Noval. It is an exquisite wine with elegant, sweet fruit flavors. It reminds me of a top '67. Excellent deep inky color, intense nose of blackberries and tar; full-bodied. 1,200 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: I have had this wine numerous times. Bottles vary from outstanding to disappointing. At its best, it is medium ruby-red, with a ripe fruit and tobacco nose, sweet, fresh plum flavors, a round mouth-feel and a silky finish.

name: Douro Maria Mansa
review: Firm, fresh and juicy, with snappy flavors of cherry and crushed red plum. Slate and pepper details emerge on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Douro White Cedro
review: A fresh profile of peach and melon flavors marks this medium-bodied white, with spice and cream undertones. Details of orange blossom, lemon and herb linger into the minerally finish. Drink now. 580 cases made.

name: Duriense Cedro
review: The fresh-crushed red fruit flavors are accented by zesty pepper and sage notes. Mineral and white pepper elements linger on the chewy finish. Drink now through 2017. 300 cases made.

name: Port Noval Black
review: A juicy, fruity style, offering good cut to the dark plum and cocoa powder flavors. Features chocolate-covered raisin notes that emerge on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old
review: This rich, well-spiced Port displays a creamy essence to the dried plum and baked cherry flavors. Milky chocolate notes mark the spicy finish. Drink now. 975 cases imported.

name: Vintage Character Port Noval Black
review: Shows beautiful aromas of sliced plum and peach, with raspberry jam. Medium-bodied and lightly sweet, with fine tannins and a fruity finish. Refined and pretty. This is a new Port from Noval that is supposed to attract new consumers and please old ones. Might work. Drink now.

name: Vintage Port
review: This was made in very limited quantities but is extremely good. Medium ruby, with black cherry and plum aromas, medium-bodied, with silky fruit flavors, light tannins and a long cedary, fruity finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: An excellent example of this sublime vintage, this is a lovely, soft, fruity Port with a wonderful balance of fruit and tannin. Medium ruby, with fresh aromas and flavors.

name: Vintage Port Silval
review: Solid Port. Very plummy, with wet earth and grapey character. Medium- to full-bodied, with good tannin grip and a silky finish. Medium sweet. Best after 2006. 1,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Silval
review: Rich and raisiny, if slightly one-dimensional. Not as good as I remember. Full-bodied, sweet and concentrated. Needs time to show what it really has. Best after 2004.

name: Douro Maria Mansa
review: Flavors of boysenberry and red currant show zesty underpinnings, with spice, dried herb and mineral notes wafting into the lightly grippy finish. Drink now through 2020. 5,170 cases made.

name: Duriense Cedro
review: The mineral, black olive and dried berry flavors feature a focused, sinewy edge. Ground coffee notes appear  on the taut finish. Drink now through 2017. 200 cases imported.

name: Duriense Cedro
review: Very juicy, with some power behind the raspberry, red plum and berry flavors. Well-structured, with a zesty, mineral- and spice-filled finish. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Duriense Cedro
review: Red berry and crushed plum flavors are crisp and lively. Notes of paprika and white pepper fill the finish. Drink now. 240 cases imported.

name: Late Bottled Port Unfiltered
review: Offers sweet berry jam and treacle tart on the nose. Full-bodied and medium sweet, with slightly chewy tannins. A little lean. Some bottle age may soften it. Best after 2012. 6,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Refined and well crafted. Dark purple, with fresh floral and grapey aromas and flavors. Medium body, medium sweetness and firm tannins. Best after 1999. 6,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Character Port LB
review: Deliciously fruity, with plenty of style, ripeness and peppery aromas. Medium body and a solid core of fruit and silky tannins. Much better than in the past. Drink now.

name: Vintage Port
review: Very good, but seems a little stalky. It should come together with time. Medium ruby-purple, with a plum nose, full-bodied, with concentrated plum flavors, full tannins and a long finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: Looks quite tired and tawny but it still retains youthful plum flavors. It needs about two hours of aeration. Medium brick red with a very light amber edge and a ripe, sweet plum and vanilla nose, full-bodied, with velvety, sweet, round plum flavors. Gentle, sweet and caressing on the finish.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: Really long and advanced in color, character and maturity. Full-bodied and medium sweet, with caramel and berry. Has not held up well. A disappointing Nacional before the change in ownership of the estate. '91/'92 Port retrospective. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: This could have been the best Port made in the often disappointing '82 vintage, but it seems to have been left in wood too long. Medium ruby, with intense aromas of grape skins and vanilla, full-bodied, with concentrated black cherry flavors and very good structure.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: This is one of the better '75's, but it shows how weak the vintage is when even Nacional comes out on the light side. Medium ruby-red, with a burnt coffee and chocolate nose, medium-bodied, with a lovely balance of sweet fruit flavors and tannins and a medium finish. Best from 1990 through 1995.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: Very good for an undeclared vintage. Medium ruby, with intense strawberry aromas, medium-bodied, with silky, sweet fruit flavors and a medium finish.

name: Ruby Port Fine
review: Ripe and dense, with leathery overtones to the dark fruit, pepper and spice flavors, which linger on the finish. Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old
review: Fruitier style of a 20-year-old, with caramel, light toffee and fruit character. Medium-bodied, with pleasant fruit and a simple finish. Slightly nutty. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: This is surprisingly good for a '50. I tasted it with four or five other '50s and it was one of the best. There are plenty of smoky plum notes on the nose and palate, with a soft balance of tannin and acidity. Perfect now.

name: Vintage Port
review: It is surprising Noval could not make a better '63. It is still nice on the palate for those who want a mature vintage. Medium red-garnet, with smoky plum aromas, medium-bodied, with sweet, mature tobacco and cherry flavors and light, velvety tannins.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: A bit of a disappointment, coming between the fabulous '66 and '63, but it is an elegant Port nonetheless, with silky fruit flavors similar to a mature claret. Medium red with a garnet edge, delicate plum aromas, with light, silky tannins and a lovely balance of fruit flavors on the finish.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: This is quite good for the vintage, but not a blockbuster. Medium ruby-garnet, with a light cherry and licorice nose, medium-bodied, with sweet, rich fruit flavors that slowly fade on the palate.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: A solidly built Port that's easy to enjoy, with generous cherry and berry flavors and a smooth texture. A graceful wine that comes up a bit short on the finish. Drink now.

name: Vintage Port
review: This is a delicious example of a mature vintage Port, with lovely leather and plum aromas and sweet, mature flavors of leather, hazelnuts and plums. It is starting to dry out slightly.

name: Vintage Port
review: Some people may find it too light, but I have been enjoying this vintage for the past two or three years. Light ruby-garnet, with lovely, delicate plum notes on the nose and palate. Best to drink up soon.

name: Vintage Port
review: This is one of the better '75s. Medium ruby-red, with an attractive plum and tobacco nose, medium-bodied, with simple plum flavors and light tannins. The alcohol is starting to show.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Some decent, clean fruit character, but it's a tad too stripped to be anything more than good. Medium-bodied, medium sweet, short finish. Drink now.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: Good, but not what one expects from Nacional. Medium red, with a bouquet of chocolate and roasted coffee, medium-bodied, with roasted flavors, medium tannins and a silky finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: Like many '82s, this is slightly forward and quite sweet. Deep red with prunes and vanilla on the nose, medium-bodied, with light raisin flavors, medium tannins and a long finish.

name: Vintage Port Nacional
review: This should not have been bottled as Nacional. Medium ruby, with chocolate, earth and raisin aromas and flavors, medium-bodied, rather lean and tough and lacking in fruit.

name: Vintage Port
review: Why was this wine declared? It is drinkable but not up to the standards of a big 10 Port shipper. Medium red with a garnet edge, a nose of earth and black pepper, light, sweet plum flavors and an almost untraceable finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: It was barely holding on when I tasted it in '85 but it still showed some interesting spicy leather aromas and flavors. It's more like a mature, light-bodied tawny at this point.

name: Vintage Port
review: I have only had this wine once, and it was well past its prime. Not many shippers made a '41. Already brown, oxidized on the nose and palate.

name: Algarve Paxá
review: A fresh-tasting red, with dark plum and berry flavors that are backed by crisp acidity. The spicy finish features notes of black strap molasses and savory herb. Syrah, Aragonez, Alicante Bouschet and Touriga Nacional. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde Paço de Teixeiró
review: Intense and tart, with appealing lemony flavors and herbal notes, and a good crisp finish. Serve well chilled. Try with sushi. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde Paço de Teixeiró
review: Fairly rich and mature-tasting with some good ripe apple and spice flavors. Not your typical Vinho Verde, but enjoyable. Finishes with buttery notes. Drink now.

name: Vinho Verde Paço de Teixeiró
review: Strives for a generous, mature style of buttery and nutty aromas, but the flavors are somewhat too lean to balance it out. Still, a good white. Drink now.

name: Vinho Verde Paço de Teixeiró
review: Spice and butter flavors mark this amber-colored wine, but not much else. Turns hollow on the finish.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A deeply flavored, rich and powerful red, with plenty of structure supporting flavors of mincemeat, plum pastry, mocha and Asian spice. The dense finish echoes with dark chocolate, slate and raspberry ganache. Drink now through 2020. 500 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Refined and powerful, with pure, concentrated flavors of plum, berry and mineral, which glide seamlessly into a full-bore finish of iron, smoke and Asian spice. Shows impressive focus, balance and structure. Drink now through 2015. 50 cases imported.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Well-spiced, with a creamy texture and silky tannins behind the effusively fruity flavors of boysenberry, raspberry, red plum and cardamom. Very juicy midpalate, presenting notes of white pepper and mineral on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 800 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: A floral style, offering concentrated aromas and flavors of violet, raspberry and crushed red plum. Flinty midpalate, with firm tannins. Graphite and forest floor accents chime in on the finish. Best from 2025 through 2045.

name: Vintage Port
review: Dense, chewy and powerful, showing plenty of violet accents to the zesty dark currant, blueberry and blackberry flavors. Features interesting savory herbal accents on the juicy finish.  Drink now through 2030. 250 cases made.

name: Douro
review: This has a spicy nose, with broad, dense and powerful flavors of mocha, dark plum and blackberry. There's intense bittersweet chocolate flavors on the tannic finish, which features plenty of pure, minerally overtones. Drink now through 2018. 1,750 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: This is loaded with cherry and red plum flavors, accented by notes of tobacco leaf and cedar. Fresh green herbal details emerge on the powerful and mineral-laden finish. Drink now through 2020. 40 cases imported.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Refined flavors of cherry tart, raspberry and cherry are loaded with concentrated spice and sandalwood accents. Lithe midpalate, with a long finish filled with cocoa powder and cream notes. Drink now through 2019. 450 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A rich and juicy red, offering fresh and snappy raspberry, red plum and licorice flavors shaded by hints of slate and graphite. Delivers notes of paprika on the well-structured, austere finish. Drink now through 2017. 460 cases made.

name: Douro
review: An elegant red, with pure, concentrated flavors of raspberry, sandalwood, plum tart and boysenberry that are well-structured. Notes of hot stone and cream linger on the explosively spicy and supple finish. Drink now through 2020. 130 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: There's plenty of power behind the cherry and crushed red plum flavors, joined by crisp, spicy notes. Hints of citrus peel impart extra zest, finishing with pure, powerful accents of pepper and slate. Drink now through 2020. 2,500 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A luscious, powerful red, with mouthfilling flavors of blackberry, dark cherry, dark plum and raspberry. Richly textured, with a long finish that's filled with chocolate, coffee and beef notes. Drink now through 2012. 540 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: An appealing minty note runs through the fresh and lively flavors of crushed raspberry, dark currant and plum pudding. Crisp and spicy on the finish, showing solid grip. Drink now through 2025.

name: Vintage Port
review: This is well-formed already, with a lovely, caressing feel to the layers of boysenberry, açai and plum confiture that stream throughout. Light plum cake and licorice root notes fill in through the finish. Best from 2020 through 2035. 10 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: Velvety in texture and well-spiced, with ripe dark fruit flavors that are matched to engaging forest floor and cedary notes. Cocoa powder and candied plum details show on the refined finish. Drink now through 2020. 175 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: An elegant and sculpted red, with notes of hot stone and spice to the lip-smacking flavors of dried raspberry and wild plum. Licorice and cardamom linger on the finish, which features hints of smoke. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca and others. Drink now through 2017. 2,500 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Raspberry and strawberry notes are dusted with mocha hints in this full-bodied red, which delivers chewy tannins and accents of mineral and dried herb that linger into a finish marked by peppercorn and zest details. Decant. Drink now through 2020. 541 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Loaded with spiced cherry and plum flavors, with currant and cream components and medium-grained tannins. Offers milk chocolate notes on the zesty finish. Drink now through 2015. 375 cases made.

name: Touriga Franca Douro
review: Juicy and well-spiced, with fresh-tasting raspberry, cherry and red currant flavors. Cream and cocoa powder notes linger into the supple finish, with silky tannins. Drink now through 2018. 250 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: This spicy red shows some density, with a polished core of blackberry compote, coffee, licorice and dried herb that is kept focused by firm acidity and full tannins. Offers a lingering, smoky finish. Drink now through 2022. 541 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: A juicy and vibrant red, with notes of white pepper to the red currant, plum and raspberry flavors. Accents of dried mint show on the spicy finish, oozing with dark chocolate details. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: Underbrush aromas underscore the fresh red currant and blackberry flavors in this streamlined red. Firm acidity carries over into a grippy finish, edged with grilled herb and black pepper accents. Decant. Drink now through 2020. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro Passa
review: Spicy, with chestnut, dark plum and spice accenting dark plum and fig flavors. Smoky notes show on the dense finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,320 cases imported.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Elegant red, with bright red plum and berry flavors backed up by firm mineral and mocha notes. Creamy finish is supported by plenty of tannins. Drink now through 2012. 500 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: This peppery white features ripe tropical fruit and melon flavors that are crisp and pure. Rich at midpalate, this offers notes of cream and white chocolate that linger with hints anise and allspice. Drink now through 2017. 1,000 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
