review: Offers raspberry and blueberry aromas, with a violet undertone. Medium-bodied and medium sweet, this has fine tannins and a delicately fruity finish. Refined and delicious. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Ruby Port Reserva
review: Fruity, with raspberry, plum and currant flavors that are fresh and feature milk chocolate notes, all playing against a backdrop of silky tannins. Drink now through 2018. 1,660 cases made.

name: Touriga Franca Douro
review: Smoky, with grilled plum, herb and currant fruit notes packed into a focused profile. Firm acidity and tannins provide structure through the savory-spiced finish. Decant. Drink now. 291 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Offers freshly picked blueberry aromas, with hints of flowers. Full-bodied and medium sweet, with a good amount of chewy tannins on the finish. Needs time to develop in the bottle. Could turn out to be outstanding one day. Best after 2015. 280 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Firm, yet filled with plenty of juicy dark plum, red berry, mineral and savory herb flavors. Graphite and pepper fill the lively finish. Drink now through 2014. 250 cases imported.

name: Douro Passa
review: A zesty red, with flavors of dried raspberry, plum and red currant that linger with peppery notes. The minerally, fresh finish has lightly smoky accents. Drink now through 2018. 900 cases imported.

name: Douro Passa
review: Firm, with dusty overtones to the dried berry and cherry flavors, which are infused with notes of iodine. The finish is tannic. Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2014. 3,000 cases made.

name: Douro Passa
review: Very minerally and focused, offering concentrated dried berry, cherry and plum flavors, with soy notes on the fresh finish. Drink now through 2014. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Douro Passa Red
review: Alluring spicy aromas follow through to berry, dark cherry and mocha flavors, with accents of vanilla and spice. The refined finish offers chocolate, nougat and raspberry tart notes. Drink now through 2016. 3,500 cases made.

name: Douro Passa White
review: A bright white, with luscious and juicy flavors of fig, lemon curd and apple pie accented by plenty of pastry notes. Richly spiced on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 1,250 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: This white has crunchy acidity, with crisp apple and peach notes that show mineral, herb and spice layers. White pepper, zest and floral notes chime in on the finish. Drink now. 833 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: Rich with dried apricot, roasted peach and pineapple flavors that are supported by vibrant acidity. The savory finish is focused and features lemongrass and dried basil notes.  Drink now through 2018. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Douro White
review: This has concentrated almond and mineral notes to the ripe apple and cherry flavors. Buttery accents linger on the finish of apricot and spice. Viosinho and Rabigato. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Douro White Passa
review: A white blossom notes weaves through the crisp apple and peach flavors in this focused white, bound together by fresh acidity that highlights the mineral, herb and spice details on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 1,166 cases made.

name: Douro White Passa
review: This fruity and juicy style is light-footed, offering flavors of green apple, ripe citrus and dried pear matched to notes of ginger and dried tarragon. Zesty finish.  Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro White Passa
review: Apple and Asian pear flavors fill this crisp, fresh-tasting white. Dried tarragon and honey cream accents show midpalate, with a snappy, spicy finish. Drink now through 2018. 360 cases imported.

name: Ruby Port Reserva
review: Shows a chocolate essence to the mincemeat and blackberry flavors, which are well-concentrated and fresh-tasting. Peppery finish. Drink now. 3,330 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Medium- to full-bodied, with very precise red berry and plum flavors. Firm finish features notes of citrus and spice. Drink now. 2,750 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Aromas and flavors of raspberry, dried cherry and plum are firm and filled with tannins, followed by meaty and spicy notes on the finish. Drink now. 1,900 cases made.

name: Douro Passa
review: Red plum, boysenberry and currant notes are focused in this medium-bodied red, with details of herb, peppercorn and mineral. Grippy tannins add texture through the smoky finish. Drink now through 2021. 4,166 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: The minerally aroma, leads to fresh-cut apple and ruby grapefruit flavors, which are focused and pure-tasting. Lots of citrus notes mark the finish. Viosinho, Rabigato and Códega do Larinho. Drink now through 2014. 1,500 cases made.

name: Touriga Franca Douro
review: A spicy style, with good lift to the flavors of dried green herb, red plum and dried blackberry. The finish is redolent of raspberry jam. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Douro Passa White
review: A savory style, with a resinous accent to the ripe pear, melon and wild berry flavors. Minty notes fill the spicy finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: Juicy, with pear and baked apple flavors and a smoky finish. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Berry, spice and cherry character follows through to a medium-bodied, lightly sweet palate. Medium finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Douro Passa
review: Straightforward red, with red plum and berry flavors, and some tobacco leaf notes on the finish. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Pleasing aromas of tea, blackberries and raspberries. Medium-bodied, medium sweet, with firm tannins and a medium finish. Racy little Port here. Best after 2008. 2,170 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Aromas of berries, toasted oak and mocha. Medium-bodied and medium sweet, with fresh acidity and a medium finish. Drink early.  Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2008. 1,250 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A lithe red, with plenty of savory notes to the dried berry and cherry flavors. Mineral and slate accents show midpalate, with a firm finish that echoes with slate and spice details. Drink now through 2018. 1,058 cases made.

name: Lisboa White
review: A richly spiced and well-proportioned white, showing concentrated ripe apple, melon and dried pineapple flavors. Features buttery accents midpalate, with notes of dried ginger and tarragon on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 500 cases imported.

name: Lisboa Vinhas do Lasso
review: A brooding and ripe red, with dark currant, green olive and roasted plum flavors. The dense finish has mocha notes.  Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Suave, with plenty of grip to the fresh and focused flavors of wild plum, salted almond and wild berry. Hints of marzipan show in the pepper- and spice-filled finish. Drink now through 2035.

name: Douro Auru
review: Shows good grip to the red plum, pepper and hoisin sauce flavors that glide with fresh, juicy intensity across the palate. Intense blueberry accents emerge midpalate, delivering a finish that crackles with crispness. Drink now through 2019. 470 cases made.

name: Douro Colheita
review: Mocha, hot spice and chocolate notes fill this decadent red to the brim. Very long midpalate, with accents of slate and spice. Finishes with smoke, cream and cedar details. An exotic red from Portugal. Drink now through 2019. 8,160 cases made.

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: Powerful aromas and flavors of dark plum, mineral, hot stone and mocha are all supported by fine-grained tannins and plenty of fresh acidity. The long, ripe finish of spice and dark chocolate features plenty of tannins. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2014. 1,339 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Quinta dos Muros
review: Shows the cool menthol edge of the vintage, with a nice velvety feel to the plum and boysenberry reduction flavors that roll through. Picks up energy with anise, fruitcake and violet notes through the finish while keeping its velvety feel. Best from 2025 through 2039. 1,160 cases made.

name: Douro Auru
review: Effusive aromas and flavors of crushed red fruits are very fresh and juicy. A lacy acidity supports the raspberry character, with notes of black currant and dark plum. Cream notes fill the finish. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2015. 208 cases made.

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: Intense aromas and flavors of red plum, blackberry, kirsch and dark cherry give this plenty of grip. Concentrated dark chocolate and Italian roast notes fill the vibrant finish. This should have a long life ahead of it. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz. Drink now through 2015. 1,200 cases made.

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: Voluptuous, with silky tannins and decadent flavors of dark plum, bacon fat, cardamom and a touch of cedar. Full-bodied and distinctive, with a finish that goes on and on. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2006. 2,500 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A big, gushing red, showing a perfumed aroma of rose petal and crushed red fruit, with gobs of kirsch, sweet cherry and dark plum flavors. Mineral and spice fill the long, licorice- and chocolate-filled finish. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. Best from 2009 through 2013. 1,250 cases made.

name: Tinta Barroca Douro
review: A full-bodied, structured red, with steeped raspberry and ripe strawberry fruit flavors edged by white pepper, anise and herb accents. Crisp, integrated acidity gives freshness through the mineral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2023. 280 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Effusively fruity, with a deep well of crisp boysenberry, cherry and blueberry flavors and plenty of rich, spicy notes. The fresh, mineral-filled finish is very juicy. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2011. 3,500 cases made.

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: A rich and well-crafted red, with pepper and cast iron notes to the dried raspberry, plum and kirsch flavors. The taut finish is dominated by graphite details and muscular tannins. Drink now through 2018. 1,250 cases made.

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: Muscular and juicy, with a firm backbone to the plum, mineral and dried berry flavors. Offers medium-grained tannins on the long, spicy finish, with plenty of cedar and graphite notes. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2016. 2,077 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A lithe, focused red, with spicy undertones framing the wild currant and blackberry fruit. Smoky mineral and grilled herb details are supported by moderate, integrated tannins on the finish. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2021. 1,650 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: An alluring nose of mineral and spice follows through to flavors of wild plum, dark cherry and mincemeat. The lingering finish offers white pepper and slate notes, with brambly overtones. Drink now through 2016. 3,250 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Very plush, with a juicy allure to the red plum, raspberry and sweet cherry flavors. Crisp and fresh in the midpalate, with lots of cream and spice. Drink now through 2014. 2,000 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: There's a juicy aroma, with very expressive mineral, red plum and hot stone flavors. Finishes with a tannic jolt and well-defined savory herbal and dark chocolate notes. Drink now through 2013. 248 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: Rich and ripe, with inviting flavors of blueberry, cherry and spice. This has a good backbone of acidity, which keeps it all in balance. Notes of milk chocolate and smoke on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 550 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Shows an interesting mix of mature aromas and flavors of dark plum, savory herb and chocolate, with a strong peppery strain. The finish is chewy, with dark chocolate, mocha and hints of bourbon. Distinctive. Drink now through 2010. 330 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A rich and fruity red, with plenty of fresh acidity behind the currant, plum and red berry flavors. Offers mineral and pomegranate notes on the snappy finish. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2015. 7,750 cases made.

name: Douro
review: This suave red offers balanced and zesty flavors of red plum and berry, with hints of persimmon. Shiso notes linger on the fresh finish. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2012. 5,608 cases made.

name: Douro Auru
review: Offers a concentrated spicy aroma, with notes of juniper and dried oregano to the silky flavors of plum tart, raspberry ganache and wild cherry. The bright finish of orange zest provides focus and length. Drink now through 2018. 1,589 cases made.

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: A juicy, lively red, with mineral, cherry, smoke and spice flavors that are flanked by savory herbal notes. Crisp finish. Drink now through 2015.

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: This has a Châteauneuf-like intensity to the meaty, dark plum flavors, nicely shaded by peppery and smoky notes. Balanced, with a firm backbone of acidity, and a welcome freshness on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro Mural
review: A ripe, supple red, with beefy overtones to the plum, dark cherry and raspberry flavors. Savory herb and hints of sage mark the mocha-filled finish. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca and Touriga Nacional. Drink now through 2013. 10,000 cases made.

name: Douro Mural Reserva
review: Dried red berry aromas and flavors feature accents of black licorice and olive. Very firm midpalate, with plenty of pepper and iron notes. The finish shows details of dried herbs and forest floor. Drink now. 4,330 cases made.

name: Douro Muros de Vinha
review: Well-structured, with flavors of red plum, dried raspberry and forest floor. The minerally finish is filled with savory notes. A pure and powerful red from Portugal. Needs time in the cellar to unwind. Best from 2017 through 2021. 6,665 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: A firm white, with plenty of acidity behind the savory flavors of pine, green apple and kiwi fruit. The minerally finish features lots of crunchy, spicy notes. Viosinho, Malvasia Fina, Moscatel Galego Branco and Gouveio. Drink now through 2019. 2,585 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: A refined style, featuring juicy flavors of red raspberry, dark currant and blueberry, infused with fresh-crushed plums. A spicy-savory note runs through this version, lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2018.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: This open-knit red features plump layers of ripe blackberry, plum and mineral. Details of dried herb and black tea linger on the moderately tannic finish. Drink now. 160 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: Very firm and structured, with powerful tannins behind the black currant, dark plum and blackberry flavors. Bittersweet chocolate notes build through the dense finish. Drink now through 2015. 450 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: Smoky and seductive, with an aroma of blueberries and an array of ripe and concentrated berry spice and red fruit flavors. Medium- to full-bodied, with touches of balsamic on the finish.  Drink now through 2005. 6,300 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: A plush, open-knit red, sporting spiced plum and crushed raspberry flavors, underscored by licorice and floral accents. The tannins show moderate grip on the finish. Drink now. 160 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Very minerally, showing lots of briar notes, with vibrant flavors of mocha, dried raspberry, tea and cream, joined by cocoa powder and nougat accents. The elegant finish lingers with hints of smoke and spice. Drink now through 2017.

name: Douro
review: Features fresh aromas and flavors of crushed red fruits, backed up by plenty of acidity. Red raspberry and plum notes dominate, with some currant and cranberry elements. Hints of white pepper and iron grace the finish. Drink now through 2017. 3,880 cases made.

name: Douro Auru
review: Bright raspberry, cherry and red plum flavors fill this full-bodied red. Rich meat and spice notes enliven the finish, which also features plenty of chocolate. Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz. Drink now through 2010. 300 cases made.

name: Douro Colheita
review: A generous, full-bodied red, with concentrated blackberry compote, anise and grilled herb aromas. Details of mocha and floral are accented by minerally notes on the tannic finish. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2022. 6,100 cases made.

name: Douro Colheita
review: Shows good cut to the crushed red berry, violet and dark cherry flavors. Delivers engaging minerality, with peppery notes and muscular tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 5,795 cases made.

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: A ripe, full-bodied style, with spiced plum, kirsch and fig fruit structured by fleshy tannins and rich, spicy undertones. Licorice-infused finish. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. Drink now. 920 cases made.

name: Douro Mural
review: This is lush, with engaging minerality to the raspberry, red plum and red currant flavors. Shows plenty of forest floor notes as well, delivering a finish of white pepper and dried herbal details. Drink now through 2019. 4,750 cases made.

name: Douro Mural Reserva
review: A ripe and savory red, with dried berry, fig and dark plum flavors accented by notes of tar and licorice. The tannins build on the finish, revealing dark chocolate accents. Drink now through 2015.

name: Douro Mural Reserva
review: There are lots of briary notes to the concentrated red berry and dried cherry flavors in this medium-bodied red. Soft and silky on the finish. Drink now.

name: Douro Reserva
review: This shows as lot of fruit up front, with dried berry, dark currant and briary flavors that are supported by firm acidity. Graphite notes appear on the chewy finish. Drink now through 2015. 2,800 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Juicy, with raspberry and red plum flavors and peppery notes. The chewy finish features chocolate and coffee, with plenty of tannins. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2010. 2,200 cases made.

name: Douro White Frontaria
review: Dried green herb and fresh-cut green apple notes are matched to some creamy details this zesty white. Piney and gooseberry notes on the finish. Malvasia Fina, Gouveio, Rabigato and Viosinho. Drink now through 2017. 10 cases imported.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Features roasted plum flavors that are fresh, ripe and loaded with dark chocolate and mousse notes. Hints of licorice linger on the long, spice-filled finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,111 cases made.

name: Moscatel Douro Reserva
review: Very fresh for its age, with amber maple flavors and lots of orange peel and spice. The lively finish features vanilla and pepper. Serve slightly chilled. Drink now through 2013. 1,600 cases made.

name: Moscatel Douro Reserva
review: Fresh tasting dessert-style white, with appealing ripe pear, caramel and maple flavors. Orange peel notes give zip to the finish. Serve well-chilled or on ice as an aperitif.  Drink now.

name: Port Twenty Seven Grapes Reserve
review: Spicy and ripe, with dark plum, mulberry and dried raspberry flavors that feature plenty of ferrous and iodine notes. Finishes with hints of chocolate and smoke. Drink now. 1,589 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Lively and well-concentrated, with pretty plum, red cherry and spice flavors. Spice and chocolate emerge on the finish. Drink now. 485 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Big, grapey and raisiny, with coffee bean, plum jam and tar aromas and flavors. Full-bodied, very sweet and velvety. A more forward style of Vintage Port, but stylish and pretty. Best after 2014. 1,900 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Briary aromas follow through to brambly flavors of dried berry, tea and spice. Minerally, leafy notes linger on the crisp finish. Drink now through 2015.

name: Douro
review: Medium-bodied, with red plum and berry flavors and some creamy notes. The bright finish lingers with mocha and spice. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca, Tinta Barroca and Touriga Nacional. Drink now. 2,400 cases made.

name: Douro Muros de Vinha
review: A brambly red, with lively acidity to the flavors of dried raspberry and plum. Minerally notes show midpalate, presenting slate and spice details on the finish. Drink now. 6,665 cases made.

name: Douro Muros de Vinha
review: Medium-bodied, with a zesty note to the lithe flavors of dried raspberry, mocha and dark plum, accompanied by notes of Asian spice. Hints of juniper chime in, showing a lift of rose petal and red currant on the finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Offers a peppery nose, with flavors to match, featuring notes of dried raspberry, red currant and black olive. The finish delivers a firm push of savory and sanguine details. Drink now through 2016. 2,200 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A peppery red, with an appealing mix of berry and red fruit flavors. The supple finish features some cedary notes. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca. Drink now. 2,618 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Wild berry and spice fill this bright, chewy red, which shows lots of raspberry and cream on the finish. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. Drink now through 2011. 850 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: This has an alluring aroma of coffee beans and dark chocolate, with flavors to match. Full-bodied, with good structure and a spicy finish. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: Interesting herbal aromas, with stony peach flavors and licorice notes, and good structure as well. Grilled nut notes on the finish.  Drink now. 1,350 cases made.

name: Douro White Mural
review: Well-structured, with plenty of acidity behind the flavors of lilac and green peach. Ripe melon notes linger on the aromatic finish, with plenty of spice. Malvasia Fina, Gouveio, Rabigato and Viosinho. Drink now through 2018.

name: Douro White Muros de Vinha
review: Lots of fresh-cut apple and pear flavors that are buoyant and loaded with fresh acidity. Floral notes on the fresh finish. Malvasia Fina, Gouveio, Moscatel Galego Branco and Síria. Drink now. 1,085 cases made.

name: Touriga Franca Douro
review: Good concentration to the dark plum, mineral and smoke flavors in this medium- to full-bodied red. Jammy, blackberry notes enliven the finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Broad-shouldered, muscular red, with plum and berry flavors, seasoned with mineral and sea salt. Leather and mesquite elements linger on the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Douro Rosé
review: Shows good weight and focus, with dried berry and cherry flavors, featuring rich, spicy notes that extend on the supple finish. Drink now. 1,300 cases made.

name: Moscatel Galego Branco Douro
review: Aromatic white, just a touch off-dry, with touches of richness to the flavors of apricot, tarragon and honey, which linger on the zesty finish. Drink now. 445 cases made.

name: Douro Mural
review: Balanced, with a nice combination of cherry and spice flavors, with a touch of elegance on the finish. Tinta Barroca, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Nacional. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Douro Mural Reserva
review: A sinewy red, with flavors of dried plum and wild cherry that offer hints of cream and spice. Sandalwood notes show on the finish. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca and Touriga Nacional. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Douro Peccatore Reserva
review: A medium-bodied, fresh-tasting red, featuring raspberry and red plum flavors, with spiced cherry notes on the finish. Drink now. 14,000 cases made.

name: Douro Rosé
review: A supple rosé, with creamy notes to the red plum and dried raspberry flavors. Hints of dried herb on the finish.  Drink now. 1,060 cases made.

name: Douro Rosé
review: Well-balanced rosé, with flavors of salmonberry, red cherry and some smoky notes on the finish.  Drink now. 1,700 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: Juicy, with fresh, spicy notes to the ripe pear, white currant and melon flavors. Peppery accents grace the finish. Drink now. 1,180 cases made.

name: Verdelho-Sauvignon Blanc Douro
review: An aromatic white, offering stony notes to the green apple and citrus flavors. Shows zesty acidity, with appealing grass and herbal accents on the finish. Drink now. 277 cases made.

name: Douro Colheita
review: A taut red, with flavors of dried red berry and cedar. Chewy tannins on the finish. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca. Drink now. 8,500 cases made.

name: Douro Muros de Vinha
review: Mature-tasting, but still lively, with flavors of dried cherry and spice, which linger on the finish. Tinta Barroca, Tinta Roriz, and Touriga Nacional. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Douro Rosé
review: Medium-bodied rosé, with chewy flavors of dark cherry, red peach and spice. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Offers raisin and spices on the nose. Full-bodied and medium sweet, with plenty of fruit and a slightly fiery finish. Rather hollow in the midpalate. Drink now. 3,300 cases made.

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: Interesting for its mature flavors of dried cherry, sandalwood and spice, but they are fading fast. Drink up. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, and Touriga Franca. Drink now. 1,900 cases made.

name: Vinho de Mesa Duradero
review: Dark plum and berry flavors, with some tannic and mocha notes. Drink now. 525 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: Floral aroma, with mint and green peach flavors. Tart finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: This has a slightly cheesy aroma, with dried berry flavors, which turn thin and a bit metallic. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca. 6,000 cases made.

name: Boal Madeira
review: Open 2 1/2 weeks. Intense aromas of smoke, cocoa and fruitcake are followed by nut and caramel flavors and a medium-sweet, rich palate offset by a salty tang that really gives character. There's a little astringency and heat, yet this seems young, exuberant and full of personality. Drink now.

name: Boal Madeira
review: Nutty aromas with a slight treacle note and hints of forest floor expand in the mouth, leading into flavors of caramel and walnut and turning quite dry. A lighter style that finishes with a taste of truffles. Drink now.

name: Valpaços Seleccionada
review: Ripe and succulent, with plenty of dark plum and red cherry flavors that are framed by paprika and pepper notes. A good quaffer that should go well with roast chicken. Trincadeira Preta. Drink now through 2009. 150 cases imported.

name: Trás-Os-Montes White Santa Valha
review: Firm, almost austere, with good concentration to the mineral, citrus and tropical fruit flavors and a short, intense finish. Verdelho. Drink now through 2011. 150 cases imported.

name: Valpaços Santa Valha
review: A peppery cast to this bright, fruity red, which is filled with delicious red plum and berry flavors. Spice and mineral notes linger on the crisp finish. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca, Touriga Nacional and Tinta Barroca. Drink now. 750 cases imported.

name: Douro Escada d'Oro
review: Powerful and concentrated, with a deep well of red plum, raspberry and tart cherry flavors. Plenty of structure and sinew, with spice and touches of chocolate and cream on the finish.  Drink now through 2010. 1,415 cases made.

name: Douro
review: This boasts a lively mix of dark plum and dried blackberry flavors, flanked by thyme and tarragon accents. Dark chocolate oozes from the finish. Drink now through 2014. 1,833 cases made.

name: Douro Reserve
review: A decadent, extracted style, with ripe dark-chocolate aromas and flavors and plenty of roast meat and spice lingering on the alluring finish. Like a dry Port. Drink now through 2009. 583 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Extremely aromatic, with crushed raspberry and flowers such as violet and lilac. Medium-bodied, with a solid core of dense, silky tannins and a medium finish. Refined and pretty already. Best after 2015. 350 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Savedra
review: Floral and fruity, with plenty of chewy tannins and bright acidity on the finish. Medium- to full-bodied. Grows on the finish. A little more fruit and tannin structure would take this to an outstanding level. Best after 2015. 150 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A tight, minerally style, with flavors of dried raspberry, mocha, dark plum and spice. Very chocolaty, with touches of mint and spice on the finish. Drink now. 1,150 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Mature-tasting, displaying good definition to the plum, mineral, currant and spice flavors. The broad finish shows notes of smoke and dried meat. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: An aromatic '95 that needs more time to come around. Intensely grapey, with berry and wet earth character. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. Best after 2000. 975 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Single Quinta
review: Lots of pretty raspberry and cherry aromas, with a hint of wet earth. Medium-bodied, medium sweet, with a solid core of fruit and silky tannins and a medium finish. Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2008.

name: Vintage Port Single Quinta
review: A young Port, with raisin, spice and plum character. Medium-bodied, with racy, firm tannins and a fresh fruit finish. Best after 2005. 1,555 cases made.

name: Port Finest Reserve
review: Grapey and rich, with black pepper and light raisin character. Medium- to full-bodied, with velvety tannins. Ripe fruit on the medium sweet, slightly hot finish. Drink now. 565 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Savedra
review: Not a big Port, but fine and attractive. Ready sooner than others. Aromas of black licorice and mineral. Medium-bodied, medium sweet, with ripe, firm tannins and a medium finish. Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2007.

name: Late Bottled Port Unfiltered
review: Rhubarb and sultana on the nose follow through to a full body, with round tannins and a sweet, spicy finish. Some citrus fruit appears, too. A little rustic. Drink now. 2,100 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Good, clean berry and mineral character. Medium-bodied and medium sweet, with a short, slightly austere finish. Drink now. 880 cases made.

name: Douro Cistus Reserva
review: Supple, with focused berry and red cherry flavors, and milk chocolate notes on the finish. Well-rounded and ready to drink. Drink now. 6,500 cases made.

name: Douro Cistus Grande Reserva
review: Juicy, toasty red plum and cherry flavors with a broad, spicy finish offering milk chocolate notes.  Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Douro Cistus Reserva
review: Medium-bodied and juicy, with well-defined briar and red plum flavors and lots of espresso and chocolate notes. Smooth finish.  Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Douro Cistus
review: Tight, with plum, and spice flavors, with some chocolate notes on the short finish.  Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Douro Cistus Reserva
review: Chewy red fruit flavors fill this medium-bodied red. Spicy finish falls a bit flat. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: Deep, rich and ripe, with impressive concentration and length. This has loads of dark plum, dark cherry and dark chocolate flavors that are nicely fringed by spiced meat and smoke notes. Full-bodied, balanced and pure-tasting, with a mineral- and spice-filled finish. Tempting now. Best from 2006 through 2011. 1,840 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Rich and decadent on the nose, with meaty, earthy crushed blackberry and blueberry aromas. Full-bodied and lightly sweet, with loads of chewy, ripe tannins and a long, very rich finish. There's lovely richness and balance to this. From the former owner of Quinta do Noval. Best after 2016. 500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Seductive, with kirsch and red plum flavors that intensify on the long finish, all backed by a firm structure. A silky, full-bodied red that would go well with roasted poultry or pork. Drink now through 2007. 1,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Sleek and racy, with plenty of fine tannins and ripe fruit. Full-bodied, with long, sweet cherry and berry character. Very good indeed. Best after 2006. 1,490 cases made.

name: Douro
review: An inviting aroma of spice and crushed red fruits is followed up by lush, vibrant flavors of dark plum, red cherry and dark chocolate that linger appealingly on the long finish. Youthful and focused red that has plenty of muscle as well. Drink now through 2004. 500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Loads of berry, earth and meat character. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins, light sweetness and a medium finish. Slightly nutty aftertaste. Best after 2008. 780 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Plenty of smoke and bacon fat in this powerful, angular red. Redolent of cardamom and sandalwood, which turn quite decadent on the finish. A very reduced and exaggerated style. Needs time to settle down. Best after 2004. 850 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Offers nuts and plum jam on the nose. Full-bodied and medium sweet, with slightly chewy, extracted tannins. A little coarse now, but should come around nicely. Close to Vintage Port quality. Best after 2011. 141 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Currants and wet earth dominate the nose. Medium-bodied, with good tannins and a medium, light finish. Firm, silky little Port. From one of the former owners of Noval, Cristiano van Zeller. Best after 2008. 1,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Powerful, with plenty of acidity to the intense cherry, violet, raspberry and wild plum flavors. Offers a sinewy texture, showing a focused spiciness and a long, mineral- and chocolate-filled finish. Sleek and refined. Best from 2040 through 2060. 750 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A lush, seductive red, filled to the brim with an array of dark fruit and kirsch flavors, accented by plenty of cream and spice notes. Silky tannins and molten chocolate hints add richness. The long finish echoes with mineral and white pepper details. Best from 2015 through 2022. 2,300 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Deeply colored and powerful, with a rich, fruity aroma and layers of kirsch, mocha, dark plum and spice flavors. Immense structure. Fine-grained tannins, with a long, powerful finish of meat, smoke and chocolate. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz and Tinta Barocca. Drink now through 2015. 2,530 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Very fresh and pure-tasting, displaying a minerally essence to the concentrated dark plum, cassis and dark cherry flavors that are broad, dense and rich. Medium-grained tannins emerge with plenty of fresh acidity. The balanced finish features mocha and spice, with hints of chocolate. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz and Tinta Barroca. Drink now through 2020. 2,500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: This powerful red delivers concentrated flavors of dark plum, Asian spice, roasted meats and dark chocolate that are backed up by fine acidity. Medium-grained tannins are silky, and the finish is rich, with concentrated notes of dark chocolate, mocha and cream. Best from 2012 through 2018. 200 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: This powerful and finely crafted Portuguese red drips with luscious dark plum, kirsch and ripe raspberry flavors that are accented by rich Asian spice and dark chocolate notes. The elegant finish is lush, long and unctuously spicy. Drink now through 2015. 80 cases imported.

name: Douro
review: A tour de force. This has a heady, Port-like aroma and gobs of rich, vibrant flavors of dark plum, cassis and blackberry and hints of blueberry. Ripe and finely balanced, with plenty of Asian spice and smoke notes. Tempting now for its sheer exuberance. Best from 2007 through 2012. 2,330 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Powerful, intense and concentrated red, with robust flavors of dark plum, dark cherry and spice, all tightly wrapped but generous and deep. Smoke and dark chocolate notes emerge on the long, refined finish. A stunning red from the wilds of the Douro. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Francesca, Tinta Roriz, Tinta Barroca and Tinto Cão. Best from 2005 through 2008. 2,160 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A polished and suave style, with a Burgundian allure, featuring lively acidity behind the raspberry, dried blackberry and dark plum flavors. Lengthens out nicely on the muscular finish, showing plenty of cream and spice hints. Drink now through 2022. 2,050 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A rich red, with brooding dark plum, mulberry and dark cherry flavors, filled with spicy notes. Offers accents of licorice and blackstrap molasses midpalate, leading to a long, dense and refined finish of mineral and dark chocolate. Drink now through 2020. 2,050 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Powerful aromas of rose petal and kirsch are followed by intense flavors of raspberry, mocha, dark plum and chocolate. There's an impressive minerality and creaminess that lingers on the long, lush finish. Drink now through 2014.

name: Vintage Port
review: Pure and fruity, with good grip to the vivid dark plum, dark cherry and blackberry pie flavors. Intense raspberry notes chime in as well. The minerally finish offers plush dark chocolate and spice details. Drink now through 2040. 300 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A supple and suave red, displaying a concentrated profile of tangy raspberry, cherry and red currant fruit, backed by a firm, integrated acidity. White pepper, leafy and spice details linger into the finish, structured by muscular but refined tannins. Drink now through 2020. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Ripe and full-bodied, with firm and rich flavors of dark plum, blackberry and mocha. Displays a luscious creaminess, with concentrated dark chocolate notes and a well-spiced, muscular finish. Drink now through 2018.

name: Douro
review: Deeply flavored, rich and intense, with concentrated flavors of kirsch, dark plum and dark cherry. There's lots of mocha and chocolate midpalate, with a hint of smoke on the long finish. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Barroca and Tinta Roriz. Drink now through 2018. 2,900 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Broad, rich and and deeply flavored red, with loads of mouthfilling dark plum, raspberry, cocoa and Vienna roast flavors. This shows an elegant side as well, which emerges on the long, long finish with chocolate mole and spice elements. Drink now through 2008. 4,800 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Offers an explosively floral aroma, with elegant and minerally flavors of raspberry, red plum and cherry tart that deliver plenty of grip. The pure finish presents white pepper and dark chocolate details. Best from 2020 through 2035. 125 cases imported.

name: Douro Meandro
review: This concentrated red shows restrained power to its flavors of roasted red plum, dark cherry and blackberry. Broad and rich on the finish, with plenty of savory spice and chocolate notes. Touriga Franca, Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, Sousão, Tinta Amarela and Tinta Cão. Drink now through 2018. 14,000 cases made.

name: Douro Meandro
review: Offers a powerful aroma of crushed red fruits, with flavors to match. There's an intense minerality that's accented by notes of beef and pepper, with medium-grained tannins on the closed finish. Needs some time in the cellar. Best from 2009 through 2013. 2,500 cases imported.

name: Douro Meandro
review: An intense kirschlike aroma is followed by pure flavors of dark cherry and blackberry, with loads of mineral and spice. Refined and powerful, with a long, long finish of iron and hot stone. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca and Tinta Barroca. Drink now through 2012. 5,830 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Loads of sweet blueberry on the nose, with a wet earth undertone. Full-bodied, with a delicate sweetness and a long, racy finish. Turns chewy. This is subtle and very refined, yet there's a serious hit of fine tannins on the finish. Best after 2015. 675 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Refined and supple, with lush blackberry, dark plum and blueberry flavors that are nicely flanked by delicious Asian spice and plum pudding notes. Lip-smacking finish of espresso bean and a hint of liquid smoke. Drink now through 2008. 4,333 cases made.

name: Douro Meandro
review: Full-bodied, ripe and plush with a surplus of dark plum, dark cherry and kirsch flavors. Silky tannins and creamy notes power the spicy finish. Drink now through 2014. 3,750 cases imported.

name: Douro Meandro
review: Powerful aromas and flavors of cassis, mint, dark chocolate and spice are accented by an impressive minerality. Medium-grained tannins and plenty of structure back up the almost Port-like essence of this muscular red. Shows exotic Asian spice notes on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,450 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Enticing, with a relatively high-pitched açaí and blueberry core that lets violet, menthol and star anise notes fill in easily. The floral edge stays prominent through the finish. Best from 2020 through 2035. 400 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: This sweet, fruity and refined Port displays pure, supple flavors of raspberry ganache, red plum and dark cherry. Finishes with plenty of cream and spice. Best after 2018. 750 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Wonderfully floral and fruity, with an exotic fruit character underneath. Full-bodied, medium sweet, with a good backbone of tannins and fruit. Subtly lingers on the finish. A new single quinta Port that used to go into the Ferriera blends, and also made the great table wine, Barca Velha. Best after 2010. 650 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Deep, rich and intense, with a lovely, meaty, gamy aroma and enveloping flavors of dark plum, cassis and dark cherry. Dark chocolate and spice notes on the finish round out this impressive full-bodied red. Best from 2003 through 2006.

name: Douro Meandro
review: Plum, boysenberry and currant flavors lead the way in this supple, juicy red, with licorice, smoke and floral notes chiming in on the herb-tinged finish. Drink now through 2019. 15,000 cases made.

name: Douro Meandro
review: This muscular red features flavors of dried berry and roasted plum, with lots of leafy and savory accents. Hints of hot stone on the finish are infused with taut minerally notes. Drink now through 2019. 1,953 cases imported.

name: Douro Meandro
review: Vibrant and well-structured, with a lively mix of wild plum and cherry flavors that are backed up by plenty of fresh acidity. Features notes of graphite on the finish. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz, Tinta Barocca and Sousão. Drink now through 2015.

name: Douro Meandro
review: Broad and rich, with layers of ripe plum and blackberry flavors that are nicely feathered with cream and spice. The finish oozes with chocolate, mineral and smoke. Drink now through 2008. 4,330 cases made.

name: Douro Meandro
review: Fresh and-pure tasting, with good cut to the flavors of red plum, boysenberry and black olive, supported by firm tannins. Zesty acidity emerges on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 15,000 cases made.

name: Douro Meandro
review: Sinewy, with well-structured flavors of dark plum, French roast, mineral and tobacco leaf. If you are tired of the oaky, jammy style and are looking for a distinctive flavor profile, this is your wine. Drink now through 2007. 6,916 cases made.

name: Douro Meandro
review: This muscular red features chewy tannins behind the dried berry and cherry flavors, sporting plenty of graphite notes. Accents of cedar and tobacco appear on the finish. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca,Tinta Roriz, Sousão, Tinta Barroca and Tinto Cão. Drink now through 2016. 15,000 cases made.

name: Douro Meandro
review: Ripe and chewy, with concentrated flavors of dark plum, cocoa powder and dried berry backed up by hefty tannins. Finishes with tea and shiso leaf notes. Drink now through 2016.

name: Port Meandro Finest Reserve
review: Frank plum, raisin and grape flavors run the show here, with a light hint of Christmas pudding holding the finish, where there is just a touch of heat, but this is more than serviceable. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro Meandro
review: Lithe and muscular, with crisp berry and cherry flavors, and pretty toasty shadings. Tight finish. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca and Tinta Barroca. Drink now. 5,250 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Big and juicy with lots of grapey fruit and firm tannins, yet it's refined and classy. Full-bodied, medium-sweet with a long finish. Impressive.   Score range: 92-94

name: Port A.B.F. Very Old
review: Gorgeous and alluring, with dark toffee, toasted sesame, allspice and cardamom notes that resemble a PX Sherry, only with a less viscous mouthfeel and a much finer edge throughout. The back end pulls in hints of ginger, green tea and powdered clove, imparting lift and cut through the extremely long and suave finish. The mouthfeel is sublime. Drink now. 77 cases made.

name: Douro Field Blend Reserva
review: Sinewy yet refined, with impressive power behind the firm, crisp flavors of dark plum, olive and boysenberry, matched to notes of tarragon. Presents focused minerality midpalate, offering a long, vibrant finish of dried wild herb and slate. Best from 2015 through 2022. 500 cases imported.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Rich, powerful and finely crafted, this Portuguese red delivers layers of concentrated red plum, currant, blueberry and kirsch flavors. Silky tannins knit it seamlessly together. The elegant, refined finish is filled with mineral, smoke and spice. Drink now through 2016. 2,056 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Adelaide
review: There's a sinewy power and refinement to the dark plum, dark chocolate, dried blackberry and currant flavors, accented by notes of forest floor and cardamom. The dusty finish features sanguine accents, matched with a hint of truffles. Best from 2030 through 2050. 833 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Finely textured, with pure and powerful flavors of dark currant, black olive, red plum and wild cherry, accented by notes of molten licorice. Latent tannins and vibrant acidity give this a lively mouthfeel, offering a refined finish of chocolate mousse. Drink now through 2022. 500 cases imported.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Very polished and ripe, with intense mocha and spice aromas and powerful flavors of blackberry, French roast coffee and black olive. The long finish is filled with effusive dark chocolate and Asian spice notes, with hints of toast and cream. Drink now through 2020. 3,458 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Powerful and concentrated, boasting medium-grained tannins that support the dense plum and berry flavors, which feature plenty of ferrous, minerally notes. Mocha and spice linger on the long finish. Very well-crafted, finely balanced and pure-tasting. Needs time in the cellar. Best from 2012 through 2020. 2,188 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Adelaide
review: Richly layered, with fig, boysenberry and blackberry paste flavors jockeying for position while Christmas pudding, dark chocolate and Black Forest cake notes add an exotic edge through the finish. Has some seriously sneaky grip too, with a roasted apple wood note well-buried. This will be fun to age. Best from 2030 through 2045. 333 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Seductive and refined, with a beautiful aroma of Asian spice, cassis and chocolate with flavors to match. Broad and lush, with plenty of structure and a caressing finish of cream, black truffle and mocha that goes on and on. Tempting now. Best from 2006 through 2010. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva Field Blend
review: A refined red, bursting with focused raspberry, red plum, currant and cherry pie flavors. Very suave and balanced, with a supple finish of mocha and chocolate that is backed up by silky tannins and enhanced by a rich creaminess. Drink now through 2018. 1,317 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Dense and concentrated flavors of wild plum, meat, kirsch and tobacco leaf fill this powerful red, with fine-grained tannins on the exuberantly fruity yet balanced finish. Mineral notes linger with plenty of chocolate overtones. Drink now through 2016. 1,125 cases made.

name: Douro
review: This powerful and refined red delivers concentrated flavors of plum, dried cherry and spice. Offers a fine texture, with plenty of savory herbal notes, followed by a long, olive- and smoke-filled finish. Drink now through 2015. 15,833 cases made.

name: Douro Field Blend Reserva
review: Elegantly floral, firm and savory, with red plum and berry flavors flanked by notes of dried sage. Lush midpalate, presenting hints of iodine on the well-structured finish. Drink now through 2021. 3,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Broad textured, yet rich tasting, with dark plum, dark cherry and dark chocolate flavors, which extend into a long finish with smoky, meaty notes. This is well-structured, full-bodied and delicious now, but should develop nicely in the bottle. Drink now through 2006. 900 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old
review: Suave and silky-tasting, delivering complex, refined flavors of buttercream, toffee, dried apricot and pear. Light and airy on the finish, with a cleansing minerality and hints of sea salt. Drink now. 83 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 30 Year Old
review: Shows engaging minerality to the toothsome, rich flavors of buttercream, pear tart and glazed apricot that glide deftly across the palate. White chocolate and spice notes emerge on the broad, rich and luscious finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Adelaide
review: A luscious, floral style, with lively cherry, plum and raspberry flavors that feature some minty notes. Cocoa powder, spice and cream details linger on the powerful finish. Best from 2020 through 2040. 415 cases made.

name: Douro Adelaide
review: Taut and powerful, with meaty overtones to the dried cherry, red plum and smoke flavors. The long spice-filled finish shows notes of cigar box and mocha. Drink now through 2012. 167 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Concentrated blackberry aromas and flavors dominate this very juicy, fresh-tasting red. Strong notes of dark chocolate and French roast fill the finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,666 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Pure, refined and deeply flavored, with a heady, red fruit aroma and loads of red plum, dark cherry, plum pudding and spice flavors all held in balance by a powerful structure and a curranty finish. Best from 2004 through 2008. 600 cases made.

name: Douro Superior Quinta do Orgal
review: A dense, polished red, with mouthcoating layers of grilled plum, dried blackberry and currant fruit, underscored by savory spice and herb elements. Charcoal, licorice and dried floral aromas fill the firm finish. Drink now through 2021. 1,250 cases made.

name: Douro White Reserva
review: A crisp and complex white, showing plenty of structure to the citrus, mineral and dried fig flavors. Flint and stony notes chime in as well, with a rich finish marked by spice and freshness. Drink now through 2020. 50 cases imported.

name: Douro White Reserva
review: A rich and luscious white, with concentrated yet refined flavors of pear, apple, ripe melon and pineapple that are long and well-spiced. There's an enticing floral note, revealing buttery overtones that linger on the unctuous finish. Drink now through 2020. 458 cases made.

name: Sousão Douro
review: The effusive red fruit flavors are matched with muscular tannins and a lingering savory intensity. Dark currant, black fig and damson plum flavors dominate, accented by hints of graphite and licorice. The pure and lively finish features plenty of acidity. Drink now through 2018. 100 cases imported.

name: Sousão Douro
review: This powerfully crisp red is redolent of crushed red fruit flavors, focusing on raspberry, cherry and wild plum. Hints of nectarine provide verve, and this finishes with shadings of graphite, slate and black licorice. Drink now through 2018. 370 cases made.

name: Sousão Douro
review: Fruity and juicy, delivering a zesty aroma that leads into cassis, red plum, and raspberry flavors that are supported by a fresh acidity. The crisp finish features medium-grained tannins and spice. A rare single-varietal bottling of this native Portuguese grape. Drink now through 2017. 458 cases made.

name: Sousão Douro
review: A lush and deeply colored red that bursts with intense cherry and blueberry flavors, backed up by plenty of fresh acidity. The long, fruit-filled finish features concentrated pepper and spice notes. Drink now through 2015. 214 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: This lithe red is generous, with boysenberry, Asian spice and ripe blackberry flavors highlighted by creamy dark chocolate and slate accents. Violet and grilled herb details show on the long finish. Drink now through 2022. 6,166 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: An intense creamy aroma leads to very fresh and pure-tasting flavors of red plum, mineral, cherry and savory herbs. Finishes with raspberry ganache and dark chocolate. Drink now through 2015. 1,500 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: A muscular, strapping Touriga, with concentrated flavors of dark plum, red cherry and raspberry. Has a long, lingering finish of dark chocolate and ganache. Drink now through 2012. 100 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port Adelaide
review: Very expressive, with a strong note of anise pulling the core of warmed plum, açai and blueberry compote flavors along. A light graphite edge adds definition to the relatively velvety finish. There's quite a bit of bass here, considering the lighter-styled vintage. Best from 2022 through 2038. 225 cases made.

name: Douro
review: This Portuguese red bursts in the mouth with intense flavors of cassis, berry and red cherry that are powered by a strong backbone of acidity. Finish of game and bittersweet chocolate. Almost Burgundian in its elegance and balance. Best from 2003 through 2008. 5,000 cases made.

name: Douro Field Blend Reserva
review: Concentrated blueberry and blackberry flavors are supported by fresh acidity and firm tannins. The Asian spice notes are intense, lingering into the powerful, mineral-laden finish. Drink now through 2019. 3,600 cases made.

name: Douro Field Blend Reserva
review: Powerful, complex and concentrated, with good cut to the dried blackberry, dark currant and crushed plum flavors, featuring savory and cedary notes. Lithe, delivering a finish of dried beef, mineral and spice. Drink now through 2018. 6,160 cases made.

name: Douro Field Blend Reserva
review: This lush, vibrant red drips with unctuous dark fruit flavors that feature plenty of cocoa powder and spice accents. Well-balanced and fresh, with a long, rich and creamy finish. Drink now through 2016. 2,541 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Elegantly spicy, with fresh plum, nectarine and raspberry flavors that are accented by plenty of creamy notes. Lively acidity punches up the sandalwood-filled finish. Drink now through 2013. 1,666 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Vibrant and juicy, with delicious flavors of red plum, cherry, smoke and raspberry. Well-crafted, with a vein of cream and spice notes that carry through the hot stone elements to the finish. Tinta Roriz, Tinta Amarela, Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Sousão. Drink now through 2010. 1,400 cases made.

name: Douro White Reserva
review: Ripe citrus and apple pastry flavors fill this spicy, well-structured white. Toast notes show midpalate, with a minerally finish that offers tangerine and lemon curd accents. Drink now through 2020. 780 cases made.

name: Douro White Reserva
review: Ripe, rich and powerful, with concentrated pear, apple and citrus flavors that are supported by plenty of fresh acidity. Finishes firm and juicy, with smoky and minerally notes. Needs some time to evolve. Rabigato, Gouveio, Viosinho and Arinto. Best from 2013 through 2018. 390 cases made.

name: Sousão Douro
review: Peppery and rich, offering dense, interwoven flavors of dark plum, baker's chocolate and boysenberry. Features vibrant acidity, with enticing black licorice and white pepper notes that linger on the creamy finish. Drink now through 2019. 917 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old
review: Light amber in color, offering delicious, elegant and fresh aromas and flavors of toffee, dried apricot, berry and spice. Finishes with orange zest and a hint of coconut. Stylish. Drink now. 141 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Offers lots of savory and minerally notes to the flavors of roasted plum, slate and forest floor. Intense dark chocolate details show midpalate, leading to a finish that lingers with smoke and Asian spice accents. Drink now through 2020. 2,333 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Raspberry and dark currant flavors dominate this elegant red, with medium-grained tannins and notes of cocoa powder. Dried mint accents emerge on the plush finish. Drink now through 2020. 3,250 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: This rich and fruity red shows ample violet notes, with touches of cinnamon and spice to the red plum, cherry and ripe melon flavors. Smoke and tar linger on the chewy finish. Drink now through 2018. 3,250 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Adelaide
review: This medium-sweet Port offers a silky mouthfeel, featuring a pretty mix of damson plum and raspberry flavors that show hints of cinnamon. Chocolate and spiced cherry notes mark the supple finish, joined by hints of cream. Best from 2016 through 2030. 783 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Essence of blackberry and raspberry, with interesting accents of sage and tarragon. Offers understated power, with a fresh acidity that keeps it all lively. Finishes with mineral and black olive. Tinta Barroca, Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca, Touriga Nacional and Sousão. Drink now through 2015. 8,125 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Nice concentration and intensity to this full-bodied, red table wine, with an alluring aroma of roasted meat and spice. Rich blackberry, cassis and chocolate flavors are deftly balanced and linger on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 7,000 cases made.

name: Douro Field Blend Reserva
review: A minty undertone marks the slate, raspberry and black cherry notes in this suave red. Licorice and floral details chime in, backed by vibrant acidity on the moderately tannic finish. Decant. Drink now through 2019. 5,666 cases made.

name: Douro White Reserva
review: Rich and ripe, showing concentrated tropical fruit and pear flavors, with hints of butterscotch. The long finish is smoky and intense, with notes of savory herb and lanolin. Drink now through 2013. 267 cases made.

name: Douro White Reserva
review: Unctuous, showing layers of rich pear, ripe apple, apricot and butter flavors, with plenty of spice and mineral. Very pure-tasting on the finish, with smoke and cream. Rabigato, Gouveio and Viosinho. Drink now through 2010. 200 cases made.

name: Sousão Douro
review: A beam of acidity bursts through the wild blackberry, currant and forest floor notes of this medium-bodied red. Dried herb, smoke and white pepper details lend savory appeal to the finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,666 cases made.

name: Sousão Douro
review: Shows a flinty note to the flavors of dark plum, dried raspberry and mocha. Interesting shiso leaf accents show midpalate. The finish offers pepper and licorice hints. Drink now through 2018. 833 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A firm, fresh and balanced red, with muscular red plum, berry and currant flavors, supported by a sturdy structure. The minerally finish reveals hints of flint. Drink now through 2016. 17,500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Concentrated and supple flavors of cherry, raspberry, plum and currant are supported by fresh acidity. The juicy finish crackles with notes of slate and hints of dark chocolate. Drink now through 2017. 22,500 cases made.

name: Douro White Reserva
review: The peach puree, lemon curd and tarragon notes have a minerally undertone in this medium-bodied white, with creamy accents highlighting the almond, spice and apple details on the long finish. Drink now. 2,250 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A zesty red, with wild raspberry and cranberry notes, backed by white pepper and underbrush details. Modest tannins frame the crisp, mineral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2019. 20,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A lithe, savory red, with notes of hot stone to the red berry, licorice and tarragon flavors, this is minerally, with accents of slate and white pepper on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 18,500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Medium- to full-bodied, with mouthfilling red plum, dark cherry and berry flavors. Has plenty of tannins on the finish, with a smoky note. Drink now. 10,583 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Powerful and appealing notes of iron and mineral, with a rich vein of blackberry and dark cherry fruit flavors. Firm finish filled with smoke and mineral. Drink now through 2010. 10,000 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: Rich and exotic, with loads of tropical fruit, butter and cream flavors, with a smoky elements as well. Finish zings along with loads of pepper and ginger notes. Gouveio, Rabigato and Viosinho. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: A spicy, alluring, medium- to full-bodied white, with crunchy apple and mineral flavors and creamy notes. An interesting style that's light on its feet and finishes with notes of cinnamon and spice. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Douro White Reserva
review: A rich and chewy white, with plenty of power to the ripe pear, apple and baked peach flavors. Finishes with spicy and smoky notes. Rabigato, Gouveio, Vinosinho and Arinto. Drink now through 2015. 833 cases made.

name: Sousão Douro
review: A muscular style, with dense, mocha-laden flavors of dried raspberry, hot stone and dried blackberry that are richly spiced. Licorice snap and pepper details show on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 750 cases made.

name: Sousão Douro
review: Deeply colored, with intense, almost jammy flavors of blackberry, kirsch, smoke and spice. A Portuguese original. The red grape of Vinho Verde brought to another level. Long finish filled with pepper and dark chocolate. Drink now through 2009. 200 cases made.

name: Tinta Roriz Douro
review: Focused and well-crafted, with delicious sandalwood, smoke, dark cherry and blackberry flavors. Rich chocolate notes fill the finish. Drink now through 2008. 700 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Medium-bodied, with fresh-crushed plum and cherry flavors that feature forest floor accents. The juicy finish is refreshing and makes for an easygoing red. Drink now. 19,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Bright and juicy, with flavors of dried raspberry, berry and smoke. Finishes with sanguine notes backed up by plenty of tannins. A touch rough-hewn. Drink now through 2015. 16,250 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Pretty cherry and red plum flavors are well-integrated in this medium- to full-bodied red. Raspberry and sweet plum pudding notes emerge on the easy finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A young, concentrated red with loads or raspberry, black cherry and plum flavors, and plenty grip. Chocolaty notes build on the finish. Tempting now, but best to wait. Best from 2003 through 2005. 5,000 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: Bright, with notes of almond, apricot and beeswax that turn spicy on the tangerine-accented finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Douro White Reserva
review: A juicy, lively white, showing pear, citrus and apple flavors, with notes of honey and spice. Finishes with sea salt and mineral. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro Rosé
review: The dried berry and cherry flavors are crisp and spicy in this lively rosé, with vanilla and cream details on the finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Plum and red currant flavors dominate this medium-bodied red. Crisp acidity powers the fruit and spice on the zesty finish. Drink now. 10,583 cases made.

name: Douro White
review: Medium-bodied, fresh and balanced, with marzipan and pine nut flavors, with lingering notes of pineapple and spice. Crisp, grassy finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Moscatel Galego Branco Douro
review: An aromatic white, with zesty flavors of tarragon, orange rind and grapefruit, supported by bright acidity. Crisp finish. Drink now. 1,673 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro Rosé
review: Dried berry and herbal notes have good cut in this zesty rosé, with accents of tangerine and melon blending together on the finish. Drink now. 1,225 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro Rosé
review: Crisp, with green herbal notes gracing the cranberry and red currant flavors. Finishes on the tart side. Drink now. 1,166 cases made.

name: Douro Quadrifolia
review: Roasted plum and dried berry flavors feature a slightly stewy note. 17,167 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: An elegant style, full of well-spiced, juicy flavors of raspberry, boysenberry and blueberry that extend with lively acidity and well-integrated tannins. Unctuous and succulent on the finish, which oozes with molten chocolate. Best after 2025. 1,250 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Plush and rich, with concentrated flavors of dark plum, kirsch and spiced cherry, backed up by fresh acidity. Offers raspberry jam nuances, with notes of licorice lingering on the chocolate-filled finish, which reveals hints of savory herb. Very complex and powerful. Best from 2016 through 2042. 650 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Powerfully rich and refined, with plenty of grip behind the lip-smacking flavors of kirsch, dark plum, chocolate and boysenberry. Shows excellent balance as well, with a silky texture and a long, spicy finish that's accented with hints of licorice and cedar. Best from 2014 through 2034. 500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port A Capela
review: Intense blackberry, spice and stem aromas turn slightly floral. Full-bodied and medium sweet, with wonderfully integrated tannins and a finish of black pepper and spice. Beautifully balanced, with gorgeous fruit. A new small-production, single-vineyard Port from Vesuvio, one of the great Port estates of the Douro Valley. Best after 2020. 250 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Terrific aromas of berries and violets, with a hint of mint. Full-bodied and lightly sweet, with fine, silky tannins that build on the palate and caress the tongue. Outstanding concentration and harmony. Greatest Vesúvio this century. Best after 2010. 5,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Complex aromas of crushed berries, pepper and spices. Full-bodied, with medium sweetness and layers of polished tannins. Masses of berry, plum and citrus character. This single-vineyard Port is always superb. Best after 2014. 2,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: A ripe and rich '95 boasting a remarkable essence of crushed berries, this is classic Port. It's full-bodied and quite sweet, with the velvetiest of tannins and a long, long ripe fruit finish. At its best after 2008. 3,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A generous, polished red sporting an array of glazed black cherry, currant and blackberry flavors woven together with licorice, Asian spice and mineral elements. Full, supple tannins hug the floral aromas on the finish. Drink now through 2023. 800 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A powerful, full-bodied red from Portugal, oozing with kirsch, dark plum and dark cherry flavors that are flanked by concentrated dark chocolate, bourbon and tobacco leaf flavors. The long finish features rich spice and smoke notes. Tempting now. Best from 2010 through 2015. 1,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Effusively fruity, offering luscious red plum, dark cherry and chocolate flavors that are well-integrated. Very suave and creamy as well, with a long finish filled with cocoa powder and Asian spice. Best from 2020 through 2045. 750 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Fascinating aromas of citrus fruits, blueberry and dried flowers, with tar notes as well, lead to a full-bodied, medium-sweet palate, with a black pepper and spice undertone to the rich, ripe berry fruit. Turns chewy and tannic on the finish. So much to come with age in the bottle. Very typical for Vesuvio. Best after 2017. 2,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Lovely nose of plums, chocolate and berries, with hints of spices. Full-bodied, with superfirm tannins and a tight tannin structure. Long and refined. It builds on your palate. Best after 2012. 2,500 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A big, rich and powerful red, with concentrated flavors of dark plum, kirsch, dark currant and dried mint that resonate with ripe Asian spice notes. Floral and hot stone accents fill the vibrant and juicy finish. Very suave. Drink now through 2022. 1,100 cases made.

name: Douro
review: A big, rich and open-textured red, with ripe flavors of dark currant, red plum and boysenberry, matched to lilting mineral and spice notes. The focused and pure-tasting finish has accents of dried mint and dark chocolate. Drink now through 2022. 1,200 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Elegant and full of crushed red raspberry, macerated cherry and dark plum flavors. Shows good grip, with an integrated finish of dark chocolate, accented by floral notes. Best after 2020. 150 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: A full-throttle, full-bodied Port, exhibiting lively raspberry and cassis flavors that feature plenty of grip. Lush creamy notes carry through to the chocolate mousse-infused finish. Best from 2015 through 2025. 600 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Capela
review: Focused and precise, with cedar and cigar box notes to the luscious raspberry and boysenberry flavors. Silky midpalate, offering cream and chocolate details on the vibrant finish. Best from 2020 through 2050. 200 cases made.

name: Douro
review: This full-bodied red is generous but focused, with blackberry, plum and dried strawberry fruit highlighted by anise, herb and cocoa accents. Well-integrated tannins frame the finish, which is filled with floral and mineral elements. Drink now through 2022. 800 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Concentrated red fruit flavors are intense and well spiced, with vibrant acidity behind raspberry, wild plum and kirschlike notes. Supple finish of mineral and pepper is filled with concentrated chocolate mousse notes as well. Drink now through 2020. 50 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Expressive, with plum, blackberry and blueberry paste flavors that have a juicy edge along with lively licorice snap and suave dark chocolate notes. Lots of plum skin and cobbler details fill in on the finish. Best from 2030 through 2040. 950 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Shows a raisin and grape skin aroma. Full-bodied and medium sweet, with astringent tannins. Very young. Still tight and powerful; needs time to mellow. '91/'92 Port retrospective. Best after 2007. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Elegant, with an intense spiced cherry note that features plenty of rich, chocolaty accents. Well-structured, with a long, vibrant finish that's filled with licorice and black olive overtones. Drink now through 2017. 19,700 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Lovely sweet toffee, toasted peanut and black tea notes start this off, with warm brown bread, mulled currant and fig fruit flavors filling in behind. Shows some maturity through the finish, but this will hang around a bit longer.--1997 Vintage Port retrospective (January 2017). Drink now through 2030. 3,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Loads of character in this one. You can almost smell the soil. Very powerful and impressive, with masses of tannins and medium sweetness. It shows opulent aromas and flavors of wet earth, green tea and berry. A tough young wine that needs to age. Best after 2000. 1,300 cases made.

name: Douro Pombal do Vesuvio
review: A ripe and fruity red, with flavors of dark plum, blackberry and cherry tart accented by notes of dark chocolate and Asian spice. The minerally finish is fresh and pure-tasting.  Drink now through 2019. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro Pombal do Vesuvio
review: Features a rich savory and minerally cast to the focused flavors of red plum, raspberry and red currant, supported by fresh acidity. The finish lingers with sandalwood and allspice details. Drink now through 2019. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro Pombal do Vesuvio
review: There's plenty of snap to this fruity red, with flavors of red currant, licorice, cherry and raspberry. The zesty finish features plenty of vanilla and spice, with hints of chocolate. Drink now through 2015. 3,500 cases made.

name: Douro Pombal do Vesuvio
review: Red violet aromas and flavors are firm and focused. Plum and cherry chime in as well, with plenty of cream and spice. The plush finish is filled with with rich notes of mocha and truffle. Drink now through 2016. 300 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: This is very grapey on the nose, with hints of rose. Full-bodied and very balanced, with ultrafine, silky tannins and a long, long finish. Beautiful and balanced. Medium sweet. Best after 2017. 150 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Impressive. Dark purple in color, with lots of pretty plum, floral and berry aromas. Full-bodied, with very racy tannins and a long, long, fruity finish. Reserved, it needs time. Best after 2004. 3,300 cases made.

name: Douro Pombal do Vesuvio
review: Elegantly styled, filled with concentrated flavors of dried savory herb, cherry and allspice, all supported by lithe acidity and a taut structure. Offers hints of white pepper and cream on the flinty finish. Drink now through 2018. 2,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Thick and finely textured Port. Lovely aromas of anise, berries and mint. Full-bodied, very sweet, with silky tannins. Fruity finish. Best after 2004. 2,900 cases made.

name: Douro Pombal do Vesuvio
review: A juicy red, with fresh raspberry, plum and anise notes bound together with lip-smacking acidity. Tangy, with spice and floral notes chiming in on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro Pombal do Vesuvio
review: Dark plum, cherry and blackberry flavors are flanked by plenty of spicy notes in this young red. The finish features milk chocolate notes. Drink now. 2,170 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Tough and forward, with lively berry, black cherry and spice aromas and flavors, a bitter chocolate edge and a wallop of alcohol on the finish; needs until 1998 to show harmony.

name: Alentejo
review: Ripe and full-bodied, with loads of plum, dark cherry and cassis flavors, which are backed up by a broad range of rich, smoky notes. Distinctive, with a decadent finish of spice and plum pudding. Drink now through 2007. 400 cases made.

name: Alentejo Terra do
review: Plenty of brown sugar, smoke, plum and spice flavors in this medium- to full-bodied red. Ripe finish is filled with cardamom notes. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro Calços do Tanha
review: A pretty core of red cherry and plum flavors is backed by medium-grained tannins and crisp acidity. Raspberry and spice fill the finish. Drink now.

name: Douro Poleiros
review: Medium-bodied, with a core of red cherry and spice flavors backed up by firm acidity. Has a chewy, mocha-filled finish. Drink now.

name: Douro Vinha dos Deuses Grande Reserva
review: Taking on mature notes, with green olive and cedary accents to the dried cherry and berry flavors. Forest floor details lengthen out on the finish. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Offers a seductively minty aroma, with luscious flavors of blackberry, raspberry ganache and dark plum that are filled with Asian spice and juniper berry notes. The finish is loaded with dark chocolate and mocha nuances. An extravagantly flavored red. Drink now through 2022. 125 cases imported.

name: Douro VV47
review: This has a concentrated, plush texture, delivering boysenberry and blackberry flavors woven together with licorice, dark chocolate and herb details. A mix of savory and sweet spice notes mark the floral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2019. 300 cases made.

name: Douro Assobio
review: This fresh red offers a plump core of red plum, raspberry, olive and licorice flavors, woven together with baker's spice and milk chocolate details. Supple tannins frame the smoky, mineral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2021. 27,000 cases made.

name: Douro Margem
review: Supple in texture, this polished red is layered with crushed raspberry, boysenberry and dark cherry fruit notes accented by licorice, baker's chocolate and dried herb elements. Full, integrated tannins frame cassis and spice elements on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 250 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old
review: Offers lots of savory overtones to the crisp currant and spiced plum flavors, with some citrusy accents. Features hints of glazed apricot on the rich finish. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Douro Assobio
review: A savory and well-spiced red, with dried herb and fresh earth aromas edging the boysenberry and red plum flavors. Firm tannins structure the minerally finish. Drink now through 2022. 27,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: A ripe red, with roasted plum and tealike notes that are firm and savory. The finish has oaky accents that turn plush and rich-tasting.  Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Very crisp and spicy, with concentrated cherry and crushed red plum flavors. This finish features plenty of savory herb accents and dark chocolate notes. Drink now through 2014. 2,500 cases made.

name: Douro Assobio
review: Red currant and wild berry flavors are quite crisp and sinewy in this medium-bodied red. The snappy finish features some peppery notes. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca and Touriga Nacional. Drink now through 2014. 11,000 cases made.

name: Douro White Assobio
review: A spicy, zesty white, packed with star fruit and ripe apple fruit flavors, driven by integrated acidity into a finish marked by white pepper and herb aromas. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Douro White Assobio
review: A taut white, with plenty of stony notes to the green apple and dried pear flavors. Dried green herbal accents on the finish.  Drink now. 42,000 cases made.

name: Douro Minas
review: Fruit-forward, this youthful, mouthcoating red boasts blueberry, raspberry and cherry flavors that are a touch candied. Violet and licorice accents linger into the moderately tannic finish. Drink now through 2019. 500 cases made.

name: Douro Assobio
review: There are some herbal notes to the flinty flavors in this white, plus plenty of citrus accents. The taut finish has some hints of dried mint. Viosinho, Rabigato and Gouveio. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Dão
