review: This red offers a silky mouthfeel, with flavors of cherry, fresh-crushed plum and boysenberry filled with lively red currant notes. Violet accents show on the minerally finish. Suave and powerful. Drink now through 2020. 600 cases imported.

name: Touriga Nacional Dão
review: A full-bodied and focused red, showing plenty of muscle between the dried berry, wild plum and savory herbal flavors. Features a snap of black licorice and green olive, with dark chocolate notes on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 60 cases imported.

name: Touriga Nacional Dão
review: Ripe and smoky, with loads of dark cherry, cassis and boysenberry flavors. There's also a deep well of dark chocolate and spice, which carries through to the long finish. Drink now through 2014. 400 cases made.

name: Dão
review: A lithe and juicy red, offering a wild herb note to its flavors of dried blackberry, tar and plum. Elements of underbrush and bramble power the tannic finish. This makes a good match for roast poultry. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases imported.

name: Alfrocheiro Preto Dão
review: Plenty of red cherry, berry and spice flavors, with some smoky notes as well. Fine-grained tannins on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Dão
review: Dried herb notes meld into the boysenberry and wild strawberry fruit of this fresh, supple red, with mineral, citrus zest and fresh earth details dovetailing on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Dão Reserva
review: Perfumed red, with a nice touch of elegance. Plum, berry and red cherry flavors. Finishes with smoky notes. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Dão
review: Medium-bodied red, with plum and berry flavors, and tobacco notes. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: A creamy, gently toasty style, with a brioche note leading the way for peach, persimmon and yellow apple flavors. The bright acidity keeps this fresh, while carrying a gentle toasted hint gracefully. The debut release for this joint venture of Washington's Betz Family and South Africa's De Morgenzon. Drink now through 2018. 600 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Very elegant and refined, with deep, rich flavors of raspberry, red plum and dark cherry that are complex and feature plenty of restrained grip. Dark chocolate details show on the lush, creamy finish. Best from 2022 through 2038. 188 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Vintage Port
review: This is seductive, with milk chocolate, creamed plum and blueberry fruit notes, and a long, caressing, velvety edge to the finish, where alluring anise and warm ganache hints chime in as the fruit just pours through. Best from 2028 through 2040. 187 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Mirabilis Grande Reserva
review: This full-bodied red shows focus to the supple and concentrated raspberry, cassis and licorice notes, which are edged with floral, spice and black tea details. Fleshy tannins give texture to the lengthy, mineral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2022. 417 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Clássico Grande Reserva
review: Dense and rich, with dark plum, mocha and spiced cherry flavors that feature lipsmacking spiciness, with medium-grained tannins. Licorice and black olive notes are followed by a finish of chocolate mousse and spice. Drink now through 2020. 666 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: A layered core of kirsch, plum compote and dark chocolate flavors is underpinned with black tea, floral and spice details in this full-bodied red. Well-structured, with firm, integrated acidity and moderate tannins that ease into the mineral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2022. 375 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Touriga Nacional Douro TN
review: Luscious, with plenty of black licorice notes to the dense, ripe flavors of tar, dark plum and fig. Black olive and Asian spice notes fill the powerful finish. Best from 2012 through 2016. 500 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: Offers vivid aromas of crushed red fruits, luxuriantly spicy and fruity, with concentrated red currant, red plum and cherry flavors that are supported by loads of fresh acidity. The finish features slate and white pepper. Drink now through 2018. 411 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Mirabilis Grande Reserva
review: This chiseled red shows finely etched flavors of dark cherry, wild plum and currant, with notes of hot stone and hints of paprika. Delivers crisp tangerine accents and firm tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2019.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Reserva
review: This concentrated red shows some muscle, with grippy tannins framing the plum reduction, ripe raspberry and licorice flavors. Dark chocolate, herb and graphite accents show on the long finish. Drink now through 2025. 1,478 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro White Mirabilis Grande Reserva
review: A plush, focused style, with crispness and definition to the rich white fruit and citrus flavors. Offers bright minerality, with plenty of lemon meringue overtones. The crunchy finish has a piquant spiciness. Drink now through 2017.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Late Bottled Port
review: The dark plum, raspberry and dark chocolate flavors are fresh and well-integrated, accented by supple notes of Asian spice and sandalwood. White pepper and mineral details appear on the pure and balanced finish. Drink now through 2025. 300 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Vintage Port
review: Interesting notes of roasted meats are sandwiched between red plum and dark cherry flavors, supported by medium-grained tannins. Features sandalwood and smoke on the finish. Best from 2014 through 2022. 166 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Casa Burmester Reserva
review: Lovely aromas of rose petal and mineral give this crunchy, well-structured red a seductive allure. The palate is filled with rich and mature flavors of red plum, mineral, smoke and cassis, which echo on the long finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Clássico Grande Reserva
review: A plush, multilayered red, with supple flavors of crushed red fruit, berry and red currant, supported by medium-grained tannins and lively acidity. The elegant finish has notes of smoke and spice. Drink now through 2022.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Referência Grande Reserva
review: The aromas and flavors of blackberry, boysenberry and red currant are fresh and focused in this spice-filled red. Sandalwood and dried cherry notes show on the juicy finish, with medium-grained tannins. Drink now through 2018.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Referência Grande Reserva
review: There's fine balance and exuberance to the muscular green olive, dried cherry and beef flavors. Tannins linger on the finish, with plenty of cedar and spice. Drink now through 2017. 411 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Ripe and polished in feel, with warm cassis, blueberry reduction and cherry compote flavors pumping along, backed by a rounded structure and notes of black licorice and Black Forest cake on the finish. Drink now through 2025. 467 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Fresh and juicy, this offers plenty of grip, featuring plenty of dark plum and berry preserves flavors that are rich and robust. The long, lush and spicy finish is filled with dark chocolate. Drink now. 291 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Vintage Port
review: Sweet and plush, with concentrated cherry and plum flavors that feature hints of ripeness. The suave finish offers chocolate and spice, with restrained grip. Best from 2014 through 2018. 166 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Vintage Port
review: Lots of black licorice and ripe fruit character in a balanced and well-structured young Vintage Port. Full-bodied, lightly sweet, with polished tannins. Very good indeed. Much better than when tasted from barrel. Best after 2010. 1,455 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Pomares White
review: An open-knit white, sporting creamed peach, kumquat and melon notes elegantly laced together by fresh, integrated acidity and spice details. Hints of verbena linger into the finish. Viosinho, Gouveio and Rabigato. Drink now through 2020. 5,833 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Reserva
review: A sinewy, peppery red, with crisp dried berry and black fig flavors, featuring some tobacco and cream notes. Finishes with accents of hot stone and spice. Drink now through 2017.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Reserva
review: Smoky-tasting, with cocoa powder, dried plum and baked cherry flavors. Features notes of savory herb on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 1,700 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Expressive, featuring menthol, warm plum sauce and melted black licorice aromas and flavors. Offers a generous feel, with a light graphite edge keeping this honest through the finish. Drink now through 2022. 50 cases imported.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Vintage Port
review: Warm brown bread, toffee and toasted sesame notes lead the way, backed by a rather fresh, yet mature, core of steeped fig and warm ganache flavors. The open, suave finish lets allspice and cinnamon details glide through.--1997 Vintage Port retrospective (January 2017). Drink now through 2026. 1,455 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro
review: Sinewy, featuring lots of crushed red fruit flavors, including plum, blackberry and dried raspberry. This offers medium-grained tannins, with a supple finish of smoke and spice, as well as hints of iodine. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz and Tinta Cão. Drink now through 2014. 8,333 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Pomares
review: This red shows good cut and structure to its red berry and currant flavors, which show a saline note. Features cedar and underbrush on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 2,000 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Rosé Reserva
review: A decadent rosé, with a creamy profile, showing red berry, peach tart and baking spice notes through the long finish, all held together by fresh, supple acidity. Tinta Roriz and Tinta Francisca. Drink now. 5,978 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Moscatel Galego Branco Douro Pomares
review: Aromatic, with floral notes edging the honeydew melon and white peach flavors. Firm acidity binds this all together through the spicy, herb-tinged finish. Drink now. 1,667 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro
review: Savory aromas of dried herb and fresh earth flank the red berry flavors of this medium-bodied red. Hints of white pepper are highlighted by tangy acidity on the finish. Light tannins. Drink now through 2019. 1,047 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Referência Grande Reserva
review: Ripe and spicy, with brooding flavors of dark plum that turn a touch stewy.  Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 375 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Port Clã Special Reserve
review: Ripe and brooding, with meaty overtones to the mocha and dark plum flavors. The finish features some graphite notes. Drink now.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Touriga Nacional Douro TN
review: Boysenberry and dried cherry flavors are smoky and rich in this medium-bodied red. Notes of paprika and sandalwood mark the finish. Drink now. 450 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Late Bottled Port
review: A bit tough for an LBV, with ripe fruit character and chewy tannins. Medium-bodied, medium sweet, finish is medium. Drink now.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Colheita Unoaked
review: A sinewy red, with dried berry and cherry flavors that finish with notes of slate and tar. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz and Tinto Cão. Drink now. 4,166 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Grande Reserva
review: Spicy, though a touch austere, showing maple and cedar accents to the roasted plum and dried cherry flavors, with a short finish. Drink now. 611 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Trás-Os-Montes Tavedo Terras Durienses
review: Ripe and pruny, smelling and tasting like a Valpolicella made by the ripasso method, this has good concentration and character, though its rusticity won't appeal to everyone. Drink now through 1999.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Vintage Port
review: A rustic and burly young wine showing a hint of nuttiness. Full-bodied and very sweet, with an alcoholic and musty finish. Could improve, but the funky character detracts from the overall quality now. Best after 2002. 2,500 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Vintage Port
review: Slightly more mature than many '95s at this stage, and considerably lighter. Medium-bodied, medium sweet, with light tannins and a light finish. Best after 2001. 800 cases made.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Vintage Port
review: Firm and rich, with blackberry, mineral and a leafy undertone. Full-bodied, yet refined and silky. Long. This is very well done.   Score range: 89-91
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

name: Douro Duvalley Grande Reserva
review: A ripe and muscular red, filled with concentrated dark plum, boysenberry, anise and mocha flavors. Offers accents of dried bay leaf, with a tannin-packed finish modulated by dark chocolate and cream notes. Drink now through 2022. 190 cases made.

name: Douro Duvalley Reserva
review: Shows a meaty note to the concentrated dark plum, dried raspberry and mocha flavors, extending midpalate with hints of black olive and anise. The firm finish delivers plenty of cedar and spice details. Drink now through 2018. 1,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Touriga Nacional Tejo QSJB Reserva
review: Redolent of blueberry preserves, this features plenty of red raspberry notes, with elements of spice on the tannic finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Viño de la Tierra de Castilla y León Q
review: Smoky, loamy and meaty notes give this muscular red an austere character, but there's a core of black plum, licorice and mineral flavors and good density beneath the firm tannins. This has power but needs time. Best from 2016 through 2026. 200 cases imported.

name: Viño de la Tierra de Castilla y León QS2
review: A smooth, polished texture carries savory flavors of black olive, tobacco and licorice in this dense red. A core of black cherry and espresso is supported by well-integrated tannins and firm acidity. A bit savage, but harmonious. Tempranillo. Drink now through 2022. 200 cases imported.

name: Viño de Mesa
review: This red has a syrupy texture balanced by firm tannins that frame raspberry, vanilla, tobacco and mineral flavors, which linger, sweet and spicy, on the finish. Drink now through 2011. 300 cases imported.

name: Viño de la Tierra de Castilla y León Q
review: This trim red shows a savory edge, with sage, underbrush and tobacco notes framing modest cherry fruit flavors. Light tannins and fresh acidity provide focus. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases imported.

name: Touriga Nacional Douro
review: Muscular and concentrated, showing intense boysenberry and cassis flavors, with mineral and hot stone notes on the full-throttle finish. Needs some time to open up. Prototypical Touriga Nacional. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Vintage Port
review: A taut, muscular style, with firm tannins behind the red currant and raspberry flavors. Mineral and dark chocolate notes show on the finish, revealing some floral hints. Best from 2018 through 2025. 325 cases made.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Firm and flavorful, with layers of rich berry, spiced cherry and chocolate flavors that are balanced and fresh. Very pure mineral and spice notes fill the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2015.

name: Douro Talentus
review: Very spicy, with an array of ripe and intense flavors, including blackberry, blackstrap and dark plum. Dense chocolate and coffee notes on the tannic finish. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz. Drink now through 2012. 545 cases made.

name: Douro Vinhas Velhas Reserva
review: A taut style, featuring sandalwood and spiced cherry flavors, with some smoky notes in the mix. Mineral and hot stone accents appear on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro
review: Bright red cherry and red plum flavors give this red verve and punch. The spicy finish features notes of sandalwood and mocha. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz. Drink now. 1,077 cases made.

name: Douro Quinta do Carqueijal Red
review: Spicy aromas, with fruit flavors of raspberry, cherry and plum. Clean, focused finish. Good match for grilled meats. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Ruby Port
review: Juicy and filled with clean and balanced flavors of red berry, plum and cherry, showing notes of forest floor on the broad finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port
review: Fruity and supple, with red plum, butterscotch and savory spice notes that are crisp and balanced. Dark chocolate and raspberry accents grace the finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Douro Quinta do Carqueijal
review: The dried berry flavors dominate, showing some smoke and iodine notes that turn a touch chewy on the finish. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Douro Quinta do Carqueijal White
review: Distinctive style, with smoky, chalky flavors. Rustic. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Douro White Reserva
review: Buttery tasting, showing almond and ripe pear flavors, with floral notes on the finish. Rabigato, Malvasia Fina and Fernão Pires. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Douro
review: Meaty and sinewy, showing dark plum and cassis flavors, with graphite shadings on the finish. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Douro Garrafeira
review: A meaty, stewy aroma makes this an over-the-top red. Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz. Not imported into the U.S.

name: Vintage Port
review: A pleasant, early drinking '95, with pretty berry, spice and green tobacco aromas and flavors. Medium-ruby, brick red. Medium-bodied, with medium tannins, a sweet finish. Best after 2002.

name: Late Bottled Port Seixo de Ansiães
review: A bit hot and rustic. Medium-bodied and very sweet, with a raisiny, earthy aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Some cherry and cedar character. Firy. Medium in body, medium sweet, with a simple finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Big and grapey, with a mineral and spice character. Full-bodied and chewy, with a raisiny character. Nicely done.   Score range: 89-91

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Coast
review: Concentrated and ripe, with plum, blackberry, sage and spice notes that carry though the round tannin, earth and mocha character on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Coast
review: Ripe and smoky, with fleshy flavors of plum, blackberry and mocha that carry through the finish. Drink now. 9,400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Coast
review: Starts with moderately tannic green-bean and bell pepper flavors, picking up coffee and berry notes. Drink now through 2005. 2,300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Coast
review: Simple, but offers flavors of black cherry, strawberry and smoky charred oak, some herbal notes as well. Made by Laurel Glen Vineyard. Drink now through 2000. 4,362 cases made.

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde QM
review: Open-knit and fresh, with lemon zest, dried pineapple and floral flavors, this light- to medium-bodied white shows a white pepper edge. Herbal notes grace the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde QM
review: Well-crafted, with good balance to the ripe apple, melon and grapefruit flavors that feature notes of roasted pineapple. Lemon verbena hints linger on the rich finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Alvarinho-Trajadura Vinho Verde Torre de Menagem
review: A creamy white, offering peach, lemon curd and pear notes, fringed with spice and honey cream accents. White blossom and herb details chime in on the finish. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde QM Vinhas Velhas
review: Offers an aroma of ripe white fruit, with buttery notes to the baked apple and dried pear and peach flavors. Lemony finish. Drink now. 210 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde Blue Ocean
review: Light and crisp, with bright flavors of fresh-cut apple and melon. Hints of herb mark the firm finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Vinho Verde Terra Antiga
review: Medium-bodied, with tropical fruit flavors and plenty of apricot and rich, spicy notes. Crisp finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde Couto de Frades
review: There's a nice zippiness here, augmented by lime, stone and some green peach flavors. Crisp finish. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde Blue Ocean
review: Features a mature edge to the cherry and wild berry flavors, with some hints of pepper. Short finish. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Vinho Verde Terra Antiga
review: Very appley, with spicy overtones. Hints of almond on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde Couto de Frades
review: Peachy aromas and green peach flavors dominate this racy Portuguese white. Nicely concentrated, though a tad coarse on the finish. Drink now.

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde QM
review: Peachy, with citrus accents and a nice herbal note on the finish. Clean and refreshing. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Vinho Verde Blue Fin
review: Aromas and flavors of ripe tropical fruit dominate this medium-bodied white, which turns a touch cloying on the finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde QM
review: Straightforward white, with citrus flavors and some mineral elements. Tart finish. Drink now.

name: Vinho Verde QM
review: Light-bodied, with some green peach flavors, a little spice on the finish. 8,000 cases made.

name: Alvarinho-Trajadura Vinho Verde Torre de Menagem
review: A basic white, with citrus flavors and some minerallike accents. Finishes on an earthy note. 10,000 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: A potent, distinctive style, with loamy earth and graphite details amid the rich dark berry, licorice and savory herb notes, ending with repeating flavor themes and a foundation of firm, fine-grained tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Carmenère. Drink now through 2032. 9,000 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Pleasantly rich, graceful and elegant, with a tapered mix of currant, blueberry and blackberry flavors that are ripe, firm and deep, but not weighty or excessive. A seductive push of black licorice adds dimension. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Carmenère and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2027. 9,000 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Pure, rich and supple, with a mix of mocha, dark berry, cedar and black licorice notes, all coming together on the finish. The tannins keep the reverberating flavors in check. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Carmenère. Drink now through 2026. 9,000 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Intense, vibrant and concentrated, with firm, complex currant, cedar, anise and black cherry fruit. Tightly wound, with chewy tannins, it can stand short-term cellaring. Best from 2004 through 2014. 9,917 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Tight and complex, with layers of spicy currant, earth, cedar, toast and anise. Firms up on the finish, with crisp acidity and mineral notes. Best from 2002 through 2010. 4,000 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Rich, supple and forward, this drinks well now but is worthy of cellaring. The core of currant, anise, cedar, vanilla and spice flavors are smooth and polished, as are the tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2001. 500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa-Sonoma Counties Illumination
review: Succulent and fragrant, offering a terrific mix of orange blossom, green tea, peach, Meyer lemon and nectarine flavors on a supple body. A crisp, juicy thread weaves in and out, lingering on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Appealing for its caressing fruit and supple tannins. Lets the currant- and anise-laced flavors glide across the palate, offering good depth and ending with a complex, persistent finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2013. 8,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa-Sonoma Counties Illumination
review: Juicy, aromatic and bright, offering a fleshy mix of grapefruit, green apple and lemon zest notes, with a spicy, floral side showing on the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Tight and focused, offering a trim band of cedar, loamy earth, dried berry, mocha and espresso, this is well done in a restrained style, ending a bit clipped, with grainy tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2022. 8,100 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Elegant and supple-textured, with earthy currant, mineral, sage and dusty berry flavors that end with a touch of herb and cedary oak. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2015. 10,000 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Sleek and focused, dark in color and rich in flavor, with full-bodied currant, mocha, blackberry and clove flavors that gain depth and complexity on the finish, leaving you hoping for a shade more length. On the aftertaste, the woody, leathery flavors stand out. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2007 through 2013. 9,700 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: No mistaking the earthy, barnyard flavors that run through this wine, overshadowing the rich currant and blackberry fruit. Finishes with smoky tobacco and cedary flavors along with a dry leathery taste and firm tannins. Drink now through 2012. 9,650 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Aging well. Elegant and understated, with dried currant, mineral, sage and loamy earth notes that are pleasant and well proportioned.--'97 California Cabernet retrospective. Drink now through 2012. 4,500 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Aromatics of ripe plum, spice, currant and black cherry give this a complex scent and it's supple and elegant on the palate, with firm yet polished tannins that let the fruit flavors glide through yet remind you that a few years in the cellar are appropriate. Drink now through 2012. 8,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa-Sonoma Counties Illumination
review: Peach and citrus flavors are broad and spicy, with a touch of lime skin on the finish. Shows solid acidity and a floral whiff. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Offers a taut band of dried currant, black cherry and plum-laced fruit, with cedar and tobacco. Full-bodied and tannic, turning very dry and austere on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Carmenère. Best from 2010 through 2016. 9,400 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Tough-edged, with firm, austere, dry and chalky tannins, but also a rich, dense, minerally core of currant and black cherry, ending with a dash of leather. Drink now through 2010. 9,200 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Tough-edged, but with an hour of decanting some of the dry, leathery, earthy flavors give way to a modest core of supple currant, spice and mineral. Finishes with dry, earthy tannins; decant, but best to drink soon, as it will likely dry out. Drink now through 2006. 8,500 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Gallops with ease through a barnyard of earth and leather, ending with an austere, acrylic edge and a hint of dried, earthy currant.--1995 California Cabernet retrospective. Drink now through 2009. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Ribbon Ridge
review: The tannins are juicy but slightly gritty, with cherry and herb flavors on a plush frame, gaining transparency on the finish. Best from 2017 through 2020. 143 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Ribbon Ridge
review: Taut and well-built, with black raspberry and loamy mineral aromas and layered flavors of dark berry, dried herb and spice that linger toward well-framed tannins. Drink now through 2022. 198 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Ribbon Ridge Ribbon Ridge Vineyard
review: Very light, just a shade darker than rosé, with spicy, toasty overtones to the modest red berry flavors, finishing slim. Drink now through 2018. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Ribbon Ridge
review: Very light in color and weight, with pretty pomegranate and floral flavors that linger quietly. Drink now. 165 cases made.

name: Dogliani Briccolero
review: Though plush in texture and concentrated, this red is also lively, evoking blackberry, black currant, violet and tobacco flavors. Stays sleek and focused through the finish, echoing fruit and spice elements. Drink now through 2020. 4,000 cases made.

name: Dogliani San Luigi
review: A full-bore version, with aromas of black pepper settling into blackberry, leather and tar flavors. The dense tannins are assertive. This needs time to show its best. Best from 2018 through 2023. 2,500 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani Briccolero
review: This red is ripe, packing blackberry, black cherry, violet and chocolate flavors. Shows plenty of structure to weather a few years in the bottle. Fine length. Drink now through 2015. 4,000 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani San Luigi
review: Rich and concentrated, yet also supple and full of blackberry, violet, kirsch and tobacco flavors. Firm, but should become more harmonious in a year or so. Drink now through 2015. 4,500 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani San Luigi
review: A bright infusion of black cherry and black pepper, with just a touch of bitter almond, are the highlights of this juicy red, which leaves a mouthwatering impression. Drink now through 2013. 5,000 cases made.

name: Dogliani Briccolero
review: A rich, succulent red, boasting cherry, plum, earth and black pepper notes. Very tannic, showing fine length on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 4,000 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani Briccolero
review: A tightly wound, astringent red, with tart cherry and cranberry flavors on a backbone of firm tannins. This is concentrated, so give it a few months to relax. Drink now through 2014. 4,000 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani Briccolero
review: Well made, balanced and concentrated. Medium- to full-bodied, with blackberry, black cherry, even mineral character and round, supple tannins. Fresh, vibrant finish. Drink now through 2000. 2,915 cases made.

name: Dolcetto d'Alba Briccolero
review: Bright and aromatic, with grapey lemon peel aromas that follow through to a medium body, with a good core of fruit and a fruity finish. Clean and delicious. Drink now.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani Briccolero
review: Very distinctive, with ripe berry, wet earth and a hint of sous-bois. Medium-bodied, with a fresh palate and intense finish. Loads of character here. Drink now. 2,400 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani Briccolero
review: New-wave Dolcetto, with black fruit and hints of licorice and clay on the nose. Medium-bodied, with fine, fruit-coated tannins and a light oak note on the finish. Always a good Dolcetto. Drink now. 2,330 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani Briccolero
review: Medium-bodied, with lots of black currant bush character, firm tannins and a solid, fruity finish. Drink now. 2,330 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani Briccolero
review: Plenty of crushed raspberry character in this red. Medium-bodied, with juicy acidity and a flavorful, crisp finish. Delicious. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani Briccolero
review: Very firm and generous, with concentrated currant, berry and plum aromas and flavors rounded out by a touch of oak. Built to stand up to whatever food one might introduce to it. Drinkable now, but better in 1992 or '93.

name: Dogliani San Luigi
review: A bit gruff around the edges, this red delivers black cherry and blackberry flavors, with an herb-inflected finish. Drink now through 2018. 2,500 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani Briccolero
review: A beautiful Dolcetto, tasting of earth, mineral and red berry notes. A charmer of medium body, it delivers some silky tannins. Harmonious finish. Drink now through 2001. 7,500 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani Briccolero
review: A firm, medium-bodied red, with intense blackberry bush and claylike mineral character. Lacks a bit on the finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani San Luigi
review: Blueberry and mineral aromas follow through to a medium body, with fresh fruit and a medium finish. Slightly short. Drink now.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani Briccolero
review: A crisp, lively Dolcetto, with black grape and forest fruit character. Clean and fresh. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani Briccolero
review: Pretty floral and berry aromas in this Dolcetto. Medium-bodied, with fresh acidity and a lively finish. A bit lean at the end. Drink now. 2,400 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani Briccolero
review: Round and supple, it's light- to medium-bodied, with a nice core of pepper, cherry and vanilla flavors. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani San Luigi
review: A straightforward Dolcetto, with grapey fruit character. Medium-bodied, with fresh acidity and a crisp finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani San Luigi
review: Lots of cherry aromas, with hints of flowers. Medium-bodied, with fresh fruit and a slightly lean finish. Crisp. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani San Luigi
review: Fresh and fruity, with plum and berry character. Medium-bodied, with a slightly astringent finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani San Luigi
review: A tight, medium-bodied red, with black fruit and a tobacco note. Very firm and crisp. Drink now. 3,700 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani San Luigi
review: Black fruit, mineral and light vanilla character. Slightly lean. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani San Luigi
review: Fresh, with currant and light licorice character. Light- to medium-bodied, with firm tannins and a slightly astringent finish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani San Luigi
review: A fresh wine, with earth, meat and plum skin aromas. Medium body. Lively fruit and a short finish. Drink now through 2001. 3,100 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani San Luigi
review: Light rose-hip and a hint of earth on the nose. Medium- to light-bodied, with a fresh, tightly-packed palate. Firm finish. Needs food. Drink now. 3,750 cases made.

name: Dolcetto di Dogliani San Luigi
review: Fruity and easy, sporting a round, soft texture, grapey, berry character and light finish. Drink now.

name: Nebbiolo Langhe
review: Tightfisted with its cherry and berry flavors, this red ends with a surfeit of tannins, leaving a dry, astringent impression. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 100 cases made.

name: Taurasi Vigna Grande Cerzito Riserva
review: A vibrant, sculpted red, led by aromatic accents of violet, wild herb and tarry mineral that waft through the pure and focused flavors of baked black raspberry, sun-dried cherry, black licorice, tobacco and fig cake. Fine, ripe tannins are effortlessly layered with the expressive range of flavors. Drink now through 2031. 100 cases made.

name: Taurasi Vigna Quintodecimo Riserva
review: A lovely, mouthwatering red, rich and focused, with lightly chalky tannins defining the finely meshed flavors of dried fig, star anise, creamed cherry and dried thyme. The long, aromatic finish echoes a note of spicy mineral. Drink now through 2027. 100 cases made.

name: Fiano di Avellino Exultet
review: A finely knit, creamy white, with a zesty thread of ground ginger, mineral and citrus, layered with pear and peach fruit. Long and dense on the mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2022. 850 cases made.

name: Taurasi Vigna Quintodeceimo Reserva
review: This rich red offers loads of southern character with its spicy yet very ripe wild berry, dark plum, underbrush, mocha and incense notes woven on a full, minerally frame. Fine length. Drink now through 2022. 20 cases imported.

name: Aglianico Irpinia Terra d'Eclano
review: A fragrant red, with a thread of flowers and exotic ground cardamom spice winding through the tightly meshed flavors of raspberry coulis, fig cake and spicy mineral. Bright and mouthwatering, this has the grace and power of a gymnast. Drink now through 2028. 8,500 cases made.

name: Aglianico Irpinia Terra D'Eclano
review: A dark, rich southern red, displaying a mix of game, mocha, jammy wild berry and cassis notes wound around fine tannins. A tarry mineral note lingers on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 30 cases imported.

name: Falanghina Irpinia Via del Campo
review: A mouthwatering white, defined by racy acidity and rich minerality, layered with a floral overtone and flavors of poached apricot, mandarin orange peel, fleur de sel and honeycomb. Drink now through 2022. 850 cases made.

name: Greco di Tufo Jaune d'Arles
review: A streak of spicy mineral drives the flavors of melon, lime zest and blanched almond in this vibrant white. Medium-bodied, fresh and balanced, with a juicy, lingering finish. Drink now through 2020. 850 cases made.

name: Fiano di Avellino Exultet
review: This white delivers ripe yellow apple, pear and creamed melon notes woven with spice and pine. The round finish takes on a waxy feel. Drink now. 40 cases imported.

name: Greco di Tufo Giallo D'Arles
review: A ripe white, with lifted yellow melon, pear and honey notes framed by hints of spice and underbrush. Drink now. 40 cases imported.

name: Falanghina Campania Via del Campo
review: A round, rich white, with spice, mineral and citrus zest notes lifting the ripe melon and tangerine fruit flavors. Drink now. 60 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Kenefick Ranch
review: Smooth and caressing, exhibiting rich layers of mocha-laced currant, blackberry, plum and cassis. Tight, focused, pure and persistent, ending with a long, creamy finish. Drink now through 2024. 95 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Kenefick Ranch
review: Very rich and intense, with expressive roasted herb, plush plum, dried berry, cedar and anise flavors. Firms on the finish, where the tannins show traction. Drink now through 2023. 94 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Kenefick Ranch
review: Rich, dark and powerful, with blackberry, dark chocolate and smoky beef notes that build momentum toward refined but muscular tannins. Best from 2019 through 2024. 125 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Beckstoffer Las Piedras Vineyard
review: A sophisticated effort, with rich, creamy oak and dark berry notes that are full-bodied and caressing even as the tannins gain presence. Hints of licorice, sage, crushed rock and herb add flavor and textural dimension. Drink now through 2030. 125 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Kenefick Ranch
review: Immense and intense, showing a powerful expression of ripe, vibrant Cabernet that becomes tamer midpalate on. Still raw and edgy, with dry extracted tannins, featuring a nice mix of vivid blueberry and dark berry fruit that ends gracefully. Drink now through 2028. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Pellet Vineyard
review: Ripe, rich and intense, with a notable black licorice accent to the dark berry, cedar and spice notes. Acidity and ripeness give this a bit of rawness and heat. Eases into gear midpalate on. Drink now through 2020. 125 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Kenefick Ranch
review: A gutsy effort, with tannins that muscle their way to the forefront, making for a chewy texture. The flavors are deep and persistent in the end. Drink now through 2028. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Kenefick Ranch
review: Riper and juicier than most 2011s, this nonetheless wrestles with dryness and tannins. At the center lies extracted blackberry, black licorice, dusty earth and cedar-cigar box nuances. Finishes full-throttle, with the fruit standing up to the tannins. Drink now through 2022. 120 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Oakville Tench Vineyard
review: Rich lemon meringue and honeysuckle flavors show an appealing lushness and fullness in this white, but the juicy acidity keeps the flavors in focus. Accents of chamomile, lanolin and poached pear chime in on the finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Rich, with black and red licorice, savory herb, dried berry and cedar notes. Rustic, yet focused and persistent. Drink now through 2021. 94 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Beckstoffer Las Piedras Vineyard
review: Intense, with a rawness to the texture and a measure of heat, centered on very ripe raspberry and wild berry flavors, as well as a good push of cedary oak. A touch of bitterness detracts. Drink now through 2028. 75 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Pellet Vineyard
review: The chewy tannins show a graceful side, with forthcoming savory berry, cherry, plum and cedary oak flavors. Ends dry and tannic. Best from 2019 through 2027. 150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Spring Mountain District
review: A mix of ripe, generous plum and blackberry marked by spicy, savory roasted herb notes. Firms on the finish, then turns dry, ending with a black licorice aftertaste. Best from 2013 through 2023. 94 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Oakville Tench Vineyard
review: Extremely juicy, with lip-smacking notes of lime, passion fruit, melon and lemon, as good intensity persists on the finish. Drink now. 46 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford
review: Rustic and chewy, with edgy tannins and dried currant, green olive and savory herb flavors, drying on the finish. Time may work to its advantage. Drink now through 2024. 48 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Kenefick Ranch
review: A firm, chunky style, with cedary oak, plum and wild berry fruit that's shaded by mineral and herbal notes. Drink now through 2019. 96 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Rutherford McGah Vineyard
review: Bright and lemony, with a hint of melon rind on the crisp finish adding a pleasant bitter note. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Fig Tree Vineyard
review: Succulent, aromatic and fleshy, with mango, tangerine and green apple flavors that are bright and juicy. Lemongrass and fresh ginger accents linger on the finish. Drink now. 1,651 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Refuge
review: Supple and nicely juicy, offering a complex mix of white grapefruit, yellow apple and Meyer lemon flavors that are light and refreshing, but this doesn't shy away from intensity, with ginger, oolong tea and lime zest notes lingering on the finish. Drink now. 326 cases made.

name: Rosé Dry Creek Valley
review: The aromas of strawberry blossom and orange zest lead to layered, dry yet silky flavors of watermelon, peach and mineral. Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah. Drink now. 682 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Deep and well-structured, with smoky wild berry aromas and layered black cherry, cracked pepper and loamy earth flavors that are wrapped in ripe but firm tannins. Best from 2013 through 2017. 5,363 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Quest
review: Focused and well-structured, with aromas that blend raspberry and tart blueberry with complex flavors of licorice, mineral and smoky cracked pepper. Ripe tannins firm up the finish. Best from 2017 through 2025. 339 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: Zesty aromas of huckleberry and licorice lead to concentrated and complex flavors of blackberry, cracked pepper and roasted sage, with a long, appealingly rustic finish. Drink now through 2014. 375 cases made.

name: Flight Dry Creek Valley
review: A distinctive blend, offering floral raspberry and spicy vanilla aromas that lead to vibrant, juicy huckleberry and creamy hazelnut flavors, with a long, lingering finish. Zinfandel and Viognier. Drink now through 2016. 250 cases made.

name: Grenache Dry Creek Valley Rosé Wine Creek Ranch
review: Sleek, crisp and vibrant, with strawberry blossom and spice aromas and crisp, layered flavors of watermelon, mineral and vanilla. Drink now. 448 cases made.

name: Rosé North Coast
review: Boldly zesty, yet retains a sense of finesse, offering floral raspberry and dried cherry aromas and supple, layered strawberry, vanilla and brown spice flavors. Mourvèdre, Syrah, Grenache and Carignane. Drink now. 391 cases made.

name: Roussanne-Viognier Dry Creek Valley
review: Ripe pear, yellow apple and golden raisin flavors are smooth and bold, with a terrific spicy edge bringing nutmeg details and dried white flower accents into the long, intriguing finish. Juicy acidity keeps the flavors fresh. Drink now. 260 cases made.

name: Roussanne-Viognier Dry Creek Valley
review: Smooth and very juicy, this offers a blend of mango, papaya and ripe peach flavors, accented by a squirt of Meyer lemon juice. The spice, honeysuckle and green apple notes crescendo on the finish. Powerful and refreshing. Drink now. 253 cases made.

name: Syrah Dry Creek Valley
review: Plump and supple, with smoky and floral blueberry aromas and well-structured flavors of raspberry, orange zest and spicy dried herb. Drink now through 2027. 349 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Plump and rich, with blackberry and Chinese five-spice powder aromas and ripe, dense flavors of smoky plum, licorice and cracked pepper. Drink now through 2023. 1,990 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Bold raspberry and toasty spice aromas combines with lively, jammy flavors of black cherry, smoky anise and dried sage. Drink now through 2027. 5,904 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Black Boar
review: Briary and well-built, with black raspberry and grilled sweet anise aromas and zesty flavors of smoky plum, licorice and sage. Drink now through 2028. 1,206 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Black Boar
review: Brooding and opaque, this is a real bruiser. Aromas of tar and smoky black raspberry lead to dense flavors of dark wild berry, licorice and grilled herb. The tannins are big but ripe. Best from 2017 through 2023. 830 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Reserve
review: A bruiser, with black raspberry and spice aromas supporting deep, firm flavors of plum and dark chocolate. Needs time. Best from 2016 through 2022. 1,000 cases made.

name: Grenache Dry Creek Valley Rosé Wine Creek Ranch
review: A knock-out rosé that balances vibrant fruit with racy acidity. Offers zesty floral aromas of watermelon and smoky spice, with layered strawberry and mineral flavors. Drink now. 378 cases made.

name: Rosé Dry Creek Valley
review: Racy aromas of spice and orange zest lead to crisp, lively watermelon and apricot flavors. Grenache, Syrah, Mourvèdre, Counoise and Petite Sirah. Drink now. 988 cases made.

name: Rosé Dry Creek Valley
review: A lovely blush, with peach blossom and strawberry aromas and crisp, lively flavors of watermelon, apricot and orange zest. Grenache, Syrah, Mourvedre and Counoise. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Roussanne-Viognier Dry Creek Valley
review: Pineapple, pear and peach flavors are juicy and ripe, with accents of green tea, honeysuckle and citrus zest. Intense and lingering. Drink now. 243 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley
review: Vivid and intense, with a tropical note of passion fruit running through the citrus and melon flavors. Floral, spice and lemon verbena details echo on the juicy finish. Drink now. 5,100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley
review: Beautifully balanced, lean, almost delicate at first, but lively enough to reveal distinctively spicy, herbal, peach and honey flavors, finishing silky and smooth. Drink now. 5,600 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Fig Tree Vineyard
review: This white is juicy and intense, exhibiting flavors of ripe pear, yellow apple, melon and citrus that are balanced and elegant, while staying well-focused and very refreshing. Drink now. 2,185 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Briary but balanced, with wild berry and underbrush aromas and nicely structured boysenberry, roasted sage and fresh black pepper flavors that finish with zesty tannins. Drink now through 2014. 3,793 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Flight
review: Supple and lightly jammy, with black cherry and spicy cinnamon aromas and soft plum and cracked pepper flavors. Drink now through 2019. 236 cases made.

name: Elusive Dry Creek Valley
review: Supple, dark and smoky, with notes of baked berry, licorice and grilled herbs. Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2021. 510 cases made.

name: Grenache Dry Creek Valley
review: Floral raspberry and cinnamon aromas open to taut, sleek flavors of dried cherry, anise and white pepper. Drink now through 2027. 522 cases made.

name: Grenache Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: Jammy yet sleek, with aromas of ripe raspberry and mint, plus plush flavors of dark plum, licorice and pepper. Drink now through 2020. 744 cases made.

name: Grenache Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: Tight, intense and earthy, with dried currant and berry, sage, mineral and underbrush notes. Though rustic and chewy, this comes together on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 812 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Dry Creek Valley
review: Dark and a bit chunky, with plenty of appealing notes of blueberry, bitter chocolate and spicy cedar. Drink now through 2027. 411 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: Dark, rich and gutsy, with blackberry and plum notes framed by thick, dense tannins and details of espresso, cigar box and black tea. Drink now through 2020. 297 cases made.

name: Quest Dry Creek Valley
review: Dark and brooding, with black cherry and tar aromas and dense flavors of blackberry, espresso and roasted herbs. Zinfandel and Petite Sirah. Best from 2013 through 2017. 250 cases made.

name: Rosé Dry Creek Valley
review: Soft and pretty, with floral strawberry aromas and delicate, appealing raspberry, blood orange and spice flavors. Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 602 cases made.

name: Rosé North Coast
review: Soft and appealing, with notes of strawberry and spicy vanilla. Mourvèdre, Carignane, Counoise, Grenache and Syrah. Drink now. 526 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley
review: Juicy, with a mouthwatering edge to the grapefruit and melon flavors. A touch of honeysuckle lingers nicely on the crisp finish. Drink now. 6,229 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley
review: This crisp white offers a distinctive mineral edge and floral details, set on a light and juicy body, with touches of pear, apple and citrus and a lingering finish. Drink now. 7,590 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Fig Tree Vineyard
review: Appealing, with zingy acidity and fresh, grassy hints to the lime, grapefruit and green apple flavors. Features a light body, with a good amount of lime zest on the crisp, intense finish. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Fig Tree Vineyard
review: Sleek and refreshing, with grassy aromatics of fresh thyme up front, featuring lemon meringue, lime, melon and grapefruit zest notes. Crisp and refreshing. Drink now. 2,033 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Fig Tree Vineyard
review: Focused, with hay, fig, vanilla and tangy lemon-lime tones that carry through the vibrant finish. Drink now through 2006. 8,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Refuge
review: A pretty, softly juicy tangerine and Key lime note gives this white a fresh fruit core, with green tea details. Light and refreshing. Drink now. 326 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Refuge
review: Crisp and refreshing, with a juicy core of acidity, complemented by appealing green apple, melon, lime and lemon flavors. Clean finish. Drink now. 137 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Boldly flavored and plump, with dark fruit, offering black plum, licorice and bittersweet chocolate accents. Drink now through 2023. 3,491 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Crisp and nicely focused, with bright cherry and underbrush aromas and zesty raspberry and herb flavors. Drink now through 2019. 7,971 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Supple, with a grapey tone to the cherry and berry character. An elegant, understated style with appealing flavors and mild, integrated tannins. Drink now through 2002. 6,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Pleasing for its ripe, pure cherry, currant and berry flavors. A medium-weight style that finishes in light oak and hints of herb and cedar. 4,906 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Aging quite nicely, holding its plummy cherry and wild berry flavors while maintaining a sense of elegance and finesse. Finishes with supple tannins and good length.--Zinfandel Retrospective. Drink now through 2002.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Complex, full-bodied and stylish, with toasty, earthy, spicy notes accenting the solid berry and cherry flavors. Has great balance and finesse; a good bet to cellar through 1996.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Complex and elegant, with a distinct red currant and cherry core. Well balanced, smooth and supple on the finish. Aging well.--Zinfandel retrospective. Drink now through 2002.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: The beautiful plum, black pepper and wild berry aromas are as seductive as they could be, braced by a firm backbone of supple tannins and toasty oak. A classy wine that's drinkable now.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Refreshing and effusively fruity, teeming with pepper, raspberry, spice and jam notes framed by balanced tannins and a touch of wood, but not overdone. Fruit echos on the finish. Delicious now but should age until 1994 and beyond.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Effusively fruity, but reined in and firmly wrapped in just enough tannin to keep it from being too simple. Lots of strawberry on the palate. Tapers off and echoes on the finish. Drinkable now, better in 1990.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Packed with flavor and structured like a Bordeaux; plenty of wine for the price.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Flight
review: Dark and brooding, with blackberry and pepper aromas and ripe, briary flavors of black raspberry, licorice and smoked herb. Drink now through 2025. 520 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Flight
review: This dense red is packed with rustic fruit, with aromas of black raspberry and cracked pepper and flavors of plum and underbrush. Finishes with burly tannins. Best from 2012 through 2015. 250 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Reserve
review: Refreshingly ripe, zesty and complex, with black cherry, wild berry and raspberry accented by peppery spice. Elegant and refined. Drink now through 2005. 900 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: An appealingly rustic style with notes of black cherry, dried herbs and white pepper. Shows good structure and balance with a long finish that shows creamy vanilla and firm tannins. Drink now through 2008. 819 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley
review: Ripe, rich and rough-hewn, with chunky cherry, currant and earth flavors that are a bit coarse now but not excessive. Has firm, well-proportioned tannins. Not particularly complex yet, but has all the ingredients. Best after 1993. 1,500 cases made.

name: Dry Creek Cuvée Dry Creek Valley
review: Has pretty cherry, violet and peppery red currant notes, with a hint of candied fruit. Easy to like, with a lively mouthfeel that will soften over the next year. Drink now through 2004. 2,073 cases made.

name: Dry Creek Cuvée Dry Creek Valley
review: Tight and tart, with pretty black cherry, wild berry and spice flavors, turning elegant and supple on the finish. Grenache, Mourvèdre, Syrah and Zinfandel. 1,400 cases made.

name: Elusive Dry Creek Valley
review: A zesty and easygoing blend, with notes of raspberry, spice and cola. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2025. 612 cases made.

name: Grenache Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: Supple, graceful and balanced, this is easy-drinking yet complex, with vivid plum, black cherry and wild berry. Drink now through 2012. 999 cases made.

name: Mourvèdre Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: This full-bodied wine offers fragrant floral, briary wild berry and spice notes, with dense tannins, cola and toasty tobacco flavors on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 368 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Dry Creek Valley
review: A dense wall of tannins is balanced by a generous medley of wild berry and plum flavors, showing plenty of spice, pepper and sage accents on the finish. Drink now through 2030. 408 cases made.

name: Rosé Wine Creek Ranch Dry Creek Valley
review: Crisp and delicate, with hints of watermelon and orange zest. Grenache, Syrah, Mourvèdre, Petite Sirah and Counoise. Drink now. 1,340 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley
review: Crisp and light, with honey and toast notes and a melon and tangy lemon finish. Drink now. 5,300 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Fig Tree Vineyard
review: Intense grassy notes give this wine a lot of personality, framing up the intensely juicy lemon, lime and grapefruit flavors, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now. 862 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc-Gewürztraminer Dry Creek Valley
review: Distinctive and refreshing. Plenty of spicy, floral aromatics give way to lemon-lime flavors, with a crisp acidity and a touch of fresh hay on the finish. Drink now. 275 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: A savory style, with appealing aromas of bay leaf, sage and pepper, plus briary, slightly rustic cherry flavors. Drink now through 2017. 8,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: A Zin for Chianti lovers, this is lively, tart and fresh with notes of plum, herb and smoky spice. The tannin-acid mix gives the finish an angular quality. Drink now through 2017. 5,695 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Briary and rustic, with black raspberry and spicy vanilla aromas and appealing dried cherry and underbrush flavors. Drink now through 2013. 3,900 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Ripe and appealing in a rustic style, with a jammy edge to the red cherry, raspberry and plum flavors. 4,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Supple and well balanced, adding a pleasant, earthy edge to the cherry and wild berry flavors. Finishes with mild tannins and a tarry aftertaste. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Anderson Ranch
review: Concentrated and gutsy, and though this lacks finesse, it's appealing for its deep blackberry and licorice aromas and chunky blueberry, pepper and sage flavors. Drink now through 2015. 631 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Anderson Ranch
review: Concentrated, with fine intensity to raspberry, currrant, plum and nicely integrated toasty oak flavors. Healthy, ripe tannins underscore the finish. Drink now through 2006. 790 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Grist and Katz-Asher Vineyards
review: Explosively jammy up front, showing ripe raspberry and toasted sage, with the flavors narrowing to modest cherry, jalapeño and caramel. Drink now through 2018. 140 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: Rustic and zesty, this is loaded with wild berry and licorice aromas. Offers savory boysenberry and meaty cracked pepper flavors. Drink now through 2014. 624 cases made.

name: Dry Creek Cuvée Dry Creek Valley
review: Firm, with fragrant roasted herb, cherry, plum, dried currant and subtle spice tones that maintain their intensity through the solid tannins of the finish. Grenache, Mourvèdre, Syrah and Zinfandel. Drink now through 2005. 3,450 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley
review: Vibrant and juicy, with grapefruit, lemon and melon flavors, featuring citrus zest aromatics and a finish of fresh grass. Drink now. 5,117 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley
review: Lemongrass, grapefruit and lime zest come together in a vivid, smooth and very refreshing mix. Drink now. 4,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley
review: Somewhat lean on the palate, this serves up hints of wintergreen, herb, grapefruit, fresh melon and hay, finishing moderately but cleanly. Drink now through 2002. 4,835 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Barrel Complete
review: Honeyed notes of citrus, melon and apricot are charming and elegant, with soft acidity and spicy, tobacco and slate notes that echo in the finish. Drink now. 273 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Fig Tree Vineyard
review: Medium-bodied, with a broad base of lemon, orange zest and melon flavors. Crunchy acidity accents the hints of dried flowers and herbs, followed by a refreshing finish. Drink now. 2,384 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Fig Tree Vineyard
review: This is smoky, with distinctive mineral, gunpowder, lime peel and hay notes that mingle with juicy citrus flavors. Drink now. 3,716 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Reserve
review: A steely wine, with hints of orange, lemon and lime. Bright acidity carries the flavors forward to a moderate finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma County
review: Succulent lemon meringue flavors at the core show accents of toast, hay and dried chamomile, lingering on the finish. Drink now. 6,595 cases made.

name: Syrah Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: Intense, full-bodied and complex, with ripe blackberry and wild berry fruit that has a greenish, stemmy edge. Drink now through 2014. 243 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Dried raspberry, dried currant, mustard seed and roasted herb flavors are concentrated and intense, with modest tannin and vanilla tones in the finish. Drink now through 2005. 6,294 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Dieden Vineyard
review: Middle-weight dried raspberry, plum, roasted herb and vanilla flavors have good ripeness and modest tannins. Drink now through 2005. 564 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Old Vine
review: Offers zesty raspberry fruit, with accents of cracked pepper and licorice, with flavors that finish on a note of rustic tannins. Drink now through 2015. 145 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Tambellini Vineyard
review: Warm and supple red, with soft tannins to the plum, cocoa, dried currant and slightly musty roasted herb notes. Drink now through 2004. 253 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: Stewed black cherry, plum, herb and cocoa flavors have a slightly musty edge and a velvety texture, with soft, round tannins. Drink now through 2004. 397 cases made.

name: Cabernet Cuvée Dry Creek Valley
review: Supple and spicy, with an herb and bell pepper streak that runs through the currant and berry flavors. Modest tannins make this approachable now, but it can age through 1999. 4,000 cases made.

name: Dry Creek Cuvée Dry Creek Valley
review: Tightly wound at present, its black cherry, spice, cola and toast flavors are still working their way to the surface. A little short on the finish, it should nonetheless flesh out with time. Grenache, Syrah, Mourvèdre and Zinfandel. Drink now through 2003.

name: Grenache Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: Shows a tart, sour berry core, with loamy clay flavors. Appealing, but on a modest scale. Drink now. 690 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: Shows aromatic floral and citrus elements, with berry and cassis flavors and spice, loam, cedar and tobacco notes. Medium-bodied, with firm tannins and good focus. Drink now through 2012. 445 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley
review: Light and fragrant, more floral than herbal, offering citrusy flavors on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Fig Tree Vineyard
review: Woody, piney aromas hang with the wine through hints of citrus, green pear, tart apple and hints of melon that emerge on the finish. Good intensity. Drink now. 4,705 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Fig Tree Vineyard
review: Tart, with good depth to the grass, green apple and grapefruit flavors underscored by vanilla. Drink now. 7,826 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Fig Tree Vineyard
review: Lemon-lime flavors are tart and tangy, melding into fig, peach and vanilla tones on the finish. Drink now. 7,650 cases made.

name: Syrah Dry Creek Valley
review: Cedary, with beef, fresh sage, cola and berry flavors highlighted by firm structure and toasty oak. Drink now through 2007. 375 cases made.

name: Syrah Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: Firm and trim, marked by spice, mineral, sage and dried currant and berry flavors. Full-bodied, with tannins clamping down on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 245 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Pronounced oak and vanilla overtones combine nicely with chocolate and berry flavors. Drink now through 2004. 6,900 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: A medium-weight style, with moderately ripe plum and wild berry flavors that, while good, fail to excite. Drink now through 2000. 4,875 cases made.

name: Cabernet Cuvée Dry Creek Valley
review: Strikes a nice balance between cherry-flavored Cabernet flavor and oak nuances, but is firmly tannic and moderately concentrated. Drink now for its youthful fruit, or cellar through 1995 for more maturity. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. 2,886 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley
review: A subtle wine shaped by cedary oak but showing an elegant core of cherry and currant flavors. Not too flashy, but a well-mannered, balanced wine, finishing with firm tannins. Drink now.

name: Dry Creek Cuvée Dry Creek Valley
review: A ripe and fruity style, with ripe grape and cherry flavors. Can be served chilled. Grenache, Mourvèdre, Syrah and Zinfandel. Drink now.

name: Grenache Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch Rosé
review: A dry and spicy rosé, with a dark salmon hue accented by watermelon aromas and strawberry and mineral flavors. Drink now. 446 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley
review: A bright, lean wine with a subtle core of hazelnut and grapefruit flavors. Firm and refreshing. Drink now. 3,837 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Fig Tree Vineyard
review: Distinctive for its spiciness, with pear, citrus and apple flavors that are juicy and refreshing, but a touch coarse. Drink now. 3,140 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Fig Tree Vineyard
review: Decidedly tangy, with a serious acidic backbone to the lemon-lime, herb and Asian pear flavors. Drink now. 3,316 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Fig Tree Vineyard
review: Vanilla, pear and cream flavors finish with a tangy lemon edge. Drink now. 6,825 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Fig Tree Vineyard
review: Quite oaky, with good richness to the vanilla, coconut and lemon flavors. Drink now. 4,150 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Reserve
review: A bit of resiny flavor adds some interest to the light and snappy, bright pear notes. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Reserve
review: Bright and buttery, medium-weight, smooth in texture, with a touch of fig to balance the basic butterscotch flavors. Drink now.

name: Steelhead Red Dry Creek Valley
review: Firm, with tangy cherry, sandalwood and Provençale herb tones accented by cedary oak and lively structure. Grenache, Mourvèdre, Syrah and Zinfandel. Drink now through 2007. 2,692 cases made.

name: Syrah Dry Creek Valley
review: On the beefy and cedary side, with muted flavors of cherries, berries and spice.  Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Syrah Dry Creek Valley Hommage Á Ampuis
review: Spicy cherry, plum and raspberry flavors are sleek and trim, ending with an earthy edge. Drink now through 2010. 259 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Bright berry and dried raspberry flavors fold into underbrush and earth character, with cedary notes and solid structure. Drink now through 2006. 8,187 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Jammy currant, dried herb and vanilla tones, which have modest tannins. Drink now through 2004. 5,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Lively and focused, with wild berry and plum aromas and flavors and a hint of earthiness on the finish. Balanced and drinkable now.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Anderson Ranch
review: Zesty, with plum and anise aromas and tart, spicy black cherry flavors. Finishes with cedary, dry tannins. Drink now. 647  cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: Tries for a big, full-bodied style, but lacks the flesh and fresh fruit to be entirely successful. Shows aromas and flavors of dried cherry, plum and licorice, ending with tightly wound tannins. Best after 2008. 312 cases made.

name: Dry Creek Cuvée Dry Creek Valley
review: Modest notes of beef, berries, plums, pepper and cedar are soft and pleasant. Grenache, Mourvèdre, Syrah and Zinfandel. Drink now. 3,691 cases made.

name: Dry Creek Cuvée Dry Creek Valley
review: Somewhat muddled, but decent depth to modestly tannic flavors of toasty oak, roasted plum, herb and cocoa. Grenache, Syrah, Mourvèdre and Zinfadnel. Drink now through 2004. 3,300 cases made.

name: Dry Creek Cuvée Dry Creek Valley
review: Firm in texture, with a nice fruit profile that includes plum and berry flavors along with toast and earth notes that add interest. Finishes a little short.

name: Mourvèdre Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: Road tar-asphalt aromas join dried berry notes in a medium-bodied effort, shy on depth and concentration. Drink now through 2012. 517 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: Wild berry flavors have a juicy, tangy edge, with citrus peel accents and spicy, cedary notes. Struggle with the drying tannins and herbal flavors on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 461 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Tart, with herbal twinges to the cranberry, blueberry, cedar and spice notes, ending with a peppery finish and firm tannins. Drink now. 6,274 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Wine Creek Ranch
review: Tart, with plum and sage aromas and cherry, white pepper and licorice flavors that linger with cedary tannins. Drink now. 647 cases made.

name: Cabernet Cuvée Dry Creek Valley
review: Lean and earthy; a narrow band of cherry and cedar, but needing some more flesh and flavor.

name: Dry Creek Cuvée Dry Creek Valley
review: Simple and drinkable, with nicely spicy plum and berry notes. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Fig Tree Vineyard
review: Round and generous in flavor, centering on fig and vanilla, but a tart streak of limelike acidity pokes through on the finish. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Reserve
review: Somewhat restrained, with a touch of grass and herbs at the fore. Mineral notes fill in at the end. Drink now. 2,018 cases made.

name: Steelhead Red Dry Creek Valley
review: Simple, with grapey, spicy dried berry flavors that are buried under a rustic, tannic profile. Grenache, Zinfandel, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 2,652 cases made.

name: Petite Syrah Napa Valley Helmet Of Mambrino Stags' Leap Ranch
review: A dark, fragrant and expressive red, showing accents of fresh forest floor and loam to the flavors of wild blueberry and blackberry, along with licorice, rosemary and espresso details. Thick, velvety tannins and a spicy finish give this wine extra charm. Drink now through 2026. 1,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Stags' Leap Ranch
review: A gorgeous effort, brimming with rich, juicy wild berry, blackberry and light cedary oak flavors. Firms nicely midpalate, ending with an elegant, detailed finish and fine-grained, minerally tannins. Drink now through 2028. 572 cases made.

name: Panza Stags' Leap Ranch Napa Valley
review: An immense, powerful wine, dark, rich and hearty, with wonderful aromas of ripe plum, raspberry and blackberry, with spicy floral scents and a solid core of flavors. It packs the requisite dense core of tannins, but also some pretty notes of vanilla and tobacco. Best from 2005 through 2012. 750 cases made.

name: Panza Stags' Leap Ranch Napa Valley
review: A gorgeous, sophisticated, over-the-top Petite; rich, smooth and concentrated. Layers of plum, blackberry and wild berry, with coconut and mocha oak draped on top, finishing with smooth, plush tannins and a long aftertaste. Lots of tannins, too, as you might expect. Petite Sirah. Drink now through 2012. 500 cases made.

name: Petite Syrah Napa Valley Helmet Of Mambrino Stags' Leap Ranch
review: Dense, intense, dark and focused, with savory details of black pepper, fresh loam and red licorice that accent the core of blackberry jam. Offers a mouthful of rustic tannins. Drink now through 2026. 300 cases made.

name: Petite Syrah Napa Valley Stags' Leap Ranch
review: Powerful, with vivid blueberry and blackberry notes at the core, this packs plenty of flavor and gusto into its smooth, integrated package. Espresso, mesquite, graphite, spice box and gingerbread flavors are an intriguing combination, and the dense tannins never get in the way. Drink now through 2020. 1,228 cases made.

name: Petite Syrah Napa Valley Stags' Leap Ranch
review: Fragrant violet, mineral and licorice notes are full of personality, with thick, full-bodied tannins and a smoky espresso note to the ripe black fruit flavors. Dark and rich, with flavors that persist on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 2,200 cases made.

name: Petite Syrah Napa Valley Stags' Leap Ranch
review: Beautifully crafted, rich, complex and concentrated, with a youthful exuberance to the ripe plum, ginger, blackberry and wild berry, turning supple and polished, with a long, rich aftertaste, making this a rather graceful wine for its size and grape. Drink now through 2012. 190 cases made.

name: Petite Syrah Napa Valley Panza Stags' Leap Ranch
review: Pure and delicious, notably supple with a generous offering of ripe, spicy plum and wild berry, a touch of hazelnut and nutmeg, and a touch of beef carpaccio, ending with a dash of pepper and ripe, integrated tannins. Drink now through 2012. 580 cases made.

name: Petite Syrah Napa Valley Stags' Leap Ranch
review: The ripe blackberry and plum flavors are rich and detailed, with gingerbread, chocolate-covered coffee bean, black tea and clove accents. The tannins are firm but polished, providing a nice backbone. Drink now through 2026. 250 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Stags Leap District
review: Bold but polished, with a complex core and aromas of blackberry, forest floor and chocolate-covered coffee bean, plus zesty smoky plum and pepper flavors. Drink now through 2027. 225 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Stags Leap District Block 12
review: Dark and brooding, with thick, fine-grained tannins that give an espresso edge to the blackberry and huckleberry flavors and black walnut, smoke and sandalwood details, mingling together beautifully on the finish. Drink now through 2026. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 202 cases made.

name: Petite Syrah Napa Valley Stag's Leap Ranch
review: A bold, thick version, with plenty of gingerbread, espresso, cigar box and nutmeg details. Luscious, ripe blackberry flavors lie at the core. Focused and expressive, delivering a long, powerful finish. Drink now through 2024. 1,690 cases made.

name: Grenache-Mourvèdre Napa Valley Panza Stags' Leap Ranch
review: Intense, concentrated, fleshy and complex, with vivid blackberry, wild berry and spicy plum notes. Keeps the focus on the fruity aspects of the wine, as the tannins remain smooth and fleshy. Drink now through 2012. 110 cases made.

name: Petite Syrah Napa Valley Stags' Leap Ranch
review: Gingerbread, violet and black walnut notes mingle with chai tea and chewy, juicy wild berry flavors. Delivers plenty of black pepper and mocha intensity on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 1,372 cases made.

name: Petite Syrah Napa Valley Stags' Leap Ranch
review: Very intense, juicy and concentrated, yet polished for a wine this size. Jet-black, showing rich, complex black fruits, with blackberry, wild berry and blueberry sharing center stage. Finishes with a long, rich, intensely fruity aftertaste. Drink now through 2011. 957 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Panza Stags' Leap Ranch
review: Dark, firm, intense and concentrated, this is an immense wine with a solid backbone of tannins, offering hints of earth, dark chocolate and blackberry and a mix of cedar and tobacco. Definitely needs time for the tannins to subside. Best from 2007 through 2013. 1,400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Stags' Leap Ranch
review: A rich, plush, deeply concentrated and young yet firmly tannic Cabernet that delivers a dense core of earthy currant, blackberry, lead pencil, cedar and tobacco. Finishes with excellent concentration and length. Best from 2007 through 2013. 480 cases made.

name: Panza Stags' Leap Ranch Napa Valley
review: Best approached with a whip and chair. Deeply concentrated and oozing with flavor, with tiers of chewy black cherry, blackberry, cedar, vanilla and salty, minerally notes. The brawny oak tannins are a bit raw, but the flavors linger. Petite Sirah. Drink now through 2007. 370 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District
review: More structure than charm at this stage, with firm tannins, vibrant acidity, crushed rock notes and a taut core of nervy dark berry and minerally flavors. Best from 2020 through 2032. 268 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Panza Stags' Leap Ranch
