review: Supple and well-balanced, it makes the most of its ripe currant, herb, blackberry and cedary notes. Its fleshy mouthfeel helps it go down easy, finishing with a dash of tobacco, mineral and spice. Drink now through 2009. 490 cases made.

name: Petite Syrah Napa Valley Panza Stags' Leap Ranch
review: Intense and concentrated. The initial burst of ripe blueberry and wild berry fruit turns firm and chewy, providing a measure of substance and depth from midpalate on. Drink now through 2012. 494 cases made.

name: Petite Syrah Napa Valley Stags' Leap Ranch
review: Dense, rich and compact, with intense layers of beef carpaccio, wild berry, sage, mineral and tobacco, finishing with chewy tannins that hang on. Needs cellaring and decanting. Drink now through 2012. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 540 cases made.

name: Petite Syrah Solano County Pretense
review: Ripe plum, mineral and spice notes are distracted by leathery accents. Still, a ripeness and a richness adds elegance to the rustic tannins. Drink now through 2012. 526 cases made.

name: Gary Player Major Championship Series Muirfield 1959 Western Cape
review: Stylish, with coffee and cedar notes framing macerated black currant and plum fruit, followed by a toasty, bitter cocoa-tinged finish. This shows mature notes, but it's hanging on nicely. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinotage and Shiraz. Drink now through 2010. 2,500 cases made.

name: Glenhurst Western Cape
review: This has an impressive core of raspberry and boysenberry fruit, augmented by chocolate ganache, wood spice, tobacco and mineral notes. Merlot, Syrah and Pinotage. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Syrah Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: A burly style, showing lots of coffee and roasted chestnut aromas that give way to black currant, plum and bacon flavors, with a smoky finish. Drink now. 280 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Cape Agulhas
review: Showy, with pear and piecrust aromas and flavors, followed by butter, spice and hazelnut notes on the finish. A nice plump, friendly style. Drink now. 420 cases made.

name: Oculus Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Very mature, this drinks more like a Sémillon now, showing almond, melon, persimmon and paraffin notes, with hints of smoke and butter on the finish. Still has some life, with the rich texture of age. For fans of the oak-fermented style. Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now. 260 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Cape Agulhas
review: Shows nice fresh lemon, pink grapefruit and straw flavors, with a crisp, clean finish. Drink now. 420 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc-Viognier Stellenbosch Glenhurst
review: Shows the peach and melon notes of Viognier, with a citrusy edge on the finish. Clean and fresh. Drink now. 440 cases made.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: Burly, with chestnut, coffee and dried currant fruit followed by a chewy, cedary finish. Still has some life, but the vivacity is gone. For fans of the style. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Hillside Estate
review: Dark, rich and concentrated, with a complex array of black cherry, wild berry, anise, mineral, sage, tar and cedar. Long, rich aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Vineyard Reserve
review: Elegant, ripe and juicy, with an earthy streak running through the pretty array of guava, pineapple, pear and fig flavors that linger. Drink now through 2001. 960 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Sierra Madre Reserve
review: A rich, complex and graceful wine, with many facets. The pear, apricot, citrus, butterscotch and honey aromas and flavors all come together for a long, delicious finish. Drinkable now, so why wait? 620 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Reserve
review: Bold, ripe and spicy, with layers of black cherry, plum, earth, mineral and sage. Finishes with firm, rich tannins. Drink now through 2006. 2,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Reserve
review: Dense and chewy, with a pretty array of meaty plum, cherry and herb notes. Fans out to reveal greater depth and concentration, and finishes with a meaty aftertaste. 1,354 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Reserve
review: A well-focused California version of the Rhône variety that's ripe and plummy, with spicy, peppery notes. Shows fine depth and concentration, while maintaining a sense of elegance and finesse. The finish goes on and on. Delicious. Drink now through 2001. 850 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Focused, with subtle, creamy citrus, mineral and tropical flavors. Holds together on the finish, where citrus, toasted oak and herb-tinged flavors linger. Drink now. 3,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Vineyard Reserve
review: A concentrated, complex style, with pretty pear, citrus, nectarine and floral flavors, this is a tightly wound, deeply flavored young wine that should only get better with short-term cellaring. Drink now through 2001.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Sierra Madre Vineyards
review: Bold, ripe and creamy, with a pretty array of complex pear, honey, toast and spicy flavors that are concentrated and long on the finish. Beautifully crafted. 2,300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Reserve Block Eleven
review: Vibrant, rich and concentrated, with a zingy, citrusy edge to the tart, earthy pear and lemon blossom notes. Very distinctive in that respect, as the nervy acidity makes it an ideal choice for many dishes. Drink now through 2006. 1,400 cases made.

name: Syrah Arroyo Grande Valley Rancho Arroyo Grande Vineyard Single Vineyard Selection
review: Lots of exotic spices built around a core of intense blackberry, bay leaf, pepper, game meat and new leather. Deeply concentrated, intense and firmly tannic. Beautifully crafted. Drink now through 2009. 250 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Hillside Estate
review: Complex and well made. Lots of pepper and spice up front, a vegetal note, too, it slowly unfolds into more interesting flavors of beefy, stewed plums and berries. The texture is smooth and supple. Drink now through 1999. 380 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Hillside Select
review: Spicy and meaty in character, with a strong vegetal accent, but it straightens out, showing toast, plum, currant and anise notes along with the meaty flavors. Rich and concentrated, it makes quite a statement about Syrah in Santa Barbara county. Try after 1997. 110 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Reserve
review: A real beauty, ripe, supple and complex, with a fleshy array of meaty plum, spice, oak and cedar. Holds its focus on the finish, where the flavors are vibrant, fan out and linger. Drink now through 2004. 2,100 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Hillside Estate
review: Tightly wound, but rich and concentrated, with layers of raw beef, leather, sage, mineral and black cherry, turning spicy and revealing more depth and complexity on the finish, which is remarkably elegant and refined. Drink now through 2010. 1,350 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Stolpman Vineyard Single Vineyard Selection
review: Wonderful plum and blackberry fruit is sharply defined, firm and concentrated, with tight acidity and tannins, finishing with a burst of fruit. Drink now through 2009. 200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Intense and concentrated, with a nice core of pear, fig and melon flavors, picking up traces of citrus and honey on the aftertaste. 3,300 cases made.

name: Marsanne Santa Barbara County
review: Defined by notes of toast and hay, with intense yellow raisin, apple and pear flavors that are both broad and full-bodied, all accented by fresh acidity. Drink now. 2,100 cases made.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: Smooth and complex, with layers of ripe plum, black cherry, stewed plum and spice, picking up anise, sage and cedar. Finishes with hints of leather, cedar and coffee. Drink now through 2004. 7,900 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Powerful and spicy, with lots of cedar, toast and pepper edges to the central core of plum and cherry flavors. Full-bodied and flavorful; goes for lots of gusto, but stays in balance. Drink now.

name: Viognier Santa Barbara County Los Olivos Vineyard
review: Smooth, round and generous, a mouthful of floral fruit basket flavor that persists into an exuberant, tasty finish. Ready now. 200 cases made.

name: Bien Nacido Cuvée Santa Barbara County
review: Attractive for its pure flavors of juicy pear, peach and honey, ending in a spicy aftertaste that shows off the Viognier half of this blend, with Chardonnay making up the rest. 768 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Reserve
review: Rich and intense, with layers of spicy green pear, fig, citrus and cedary oak. Finishes with a burst of flavor. Drink now through 2004. 1,300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Reserve
review: Bright, zesty acidity keeps the core of ripe pear, tangerine and nectarine flavors lively, finishing with a nice touch of citrus. Drink now through 2002. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Excellent balance between the ripe, firm, apple, pear and melon flavors and the light, creamy oak and nutmeg shadings. Drink now through 2005. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: A touch of raciness runs through this vibrant young wine, echoing spicy pear, grapefruit, citrus and melon. Drink now through 2004. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Sierra Madre Reserve
review: Shows off a hint of honeyed botrytis on the nose and palate, but the apple and pear notes fold in nicely on the finish and it's well balanced. 680 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Sierra Madre Reserve
review: Marked by a slight botrytis edge, with honey and fig notes that straighten out on the finish, where the flavors linger.

name: Los Olivos Cuvée Santa Barbara County
review: Elegant and spicy, with supple herb, berry and cherry flavors that pick up a complex, earthy component on the finish. Syrah and Mourvèdre. 500 cases made.

name: Los Olivos Cuvée Santa Barbara County
review: Firm and trim, with an intense, compact band of plum and cherry flavors that pick up earthy, leathery tones. Finishes with firm tannins. Syrah and Mourvèdre. 442 cases made.

name: Roussanne Edna Valley Alban Vineyard
review: Lean and on the tart, citrusy side, with a mix of floral, waxy, honeysuckle and nectarine fruit. Lively acidity keeps the flavors vibrant. Drink now through 2006. 365 cases made.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: A ripe, fruity style, centered around a core of cherry and rhubarb pie flavors, right down to the crust. Firmly tannic, it can be enjoyed now or cellared short-term. Excellent value. Drink now through 2008. 11,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: Trim and spicy, with a meaty, earthy edge to the ripe plum and berry flavors. Turns complex and enticing on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 5,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: Young and tight, with a firm core of plum and berry flavors. Picks up some spicy cherry notes on the finish, as well as a nice pepper and leather accent. Drinks well now. 5,600 cases made.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: Distinct for its pepper and green olive notes, but balanced by ripe cherry and plum. Turns complex and spicy on the finish. 4,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: Firm and flavorful but reined-in, with nicely focused raspberry, floral , toast and vanilla aromas and flavors, supple but balanced, with crisp acidity. Tannins are well incorporated. Drinkable now, probably best around 1991.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Alisos Vineyard Single Vineyard Selection
review: Intense, with vibrant spice, blackberry and wild berry flavors that are framed by a tight core of tannins. Shows off all that fruit and a nice black pepper scent on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 250 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Reserve
review: Dark, ripe, and concentrated, with a tannic core of cherry and leather Syrah flavors. Shows a lot of substance and depth, finishing with a mineral accent. 1,320 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Los Olivos Reserve
review: Complex, toasty oak and ripe currant notes pick up a spicy aniselike edge on the finish. Has a sense of elegance and finesse, and carries through a lingering aftertaste. 95 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Hillside Estate
review: Firm and full-bodied, with spicy, beefy, leathery currant, exotic spice, stewed plum and cedary oak notes leading to a well-focused core of flavors on the finish. Best from 2002 through 2006. 900 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: A ripe, vibrant, complex wine, with a mix of firm blackberry and wild berry flavors, a dash of pepper and spice and a firm structure, finishing with a tasty beefy edge. Drink now through 2007. 2,500 cases made.

name: Bien Nacido Cuvée Santa Barbara County
review: A blend of Chardonnay (67 percent) and Viognier (33 percent), this exhibits the body and pear flavors of the former and the spicy qualities of the latter. 1,008 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Reserve Block Eleven
review: Well-oaked, with a creamy core of smoky marshmallow, fig and apricot flavors that are tasty, if you like this style. Drink now through 2006. 1,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard Y Block
review: Deftly balanced, moderately rich and complex, with earthy pear, fig and honeydew melon flavors that are appealing. Turns a little simpler on the finish, where a touch of toasty oak adds dimension. Drink now. 3,400 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Purisima Mountain Vineyard
review: Tangy and intense, with excellent focus on black cherry, pomegranate and roasted herb nuances. Lively acid and tannin structure should show best with food and six months in bottle. Drink now through 2007. 72 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Purisima Mountain Vineyard
review: Effusively fruity, with a pretty mix of ripe, rich cherry, cranberry and candied apple flavors. Drink now through 2005. 94 cases made.

name: Los Olivos Cuvée Barbara County
review: Firm and concentrated, with pepper, dried berry, cherry and cola flavors. Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2003. 460 cases made.

name: Los Olivos Cuvée Santa Barbara County
review: Firm and rich, with complex, concentrated cherry rhubarb, and a peppery, beefy edge. Turns to cherry on the finish. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now through 2006. 705 cases made.

name: Los Olivos Cuvée Santa Barbara County
review: Quite earthy on the nose, but on the palate it's quite smooth and viscous. The flavors run from herbs to leather and black currant. Tannins are firm at the end. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now through 2003. 600 cases made.

name: Los Olivos Cuvée Santa Ynez Valley
review: A solid value with lots of character, offering ripe plum, blackberry, pepper and cedar notes, with firm tannins that exhibit a crushed rock earthiness on the finish. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now through 2018. 390 cases made.

name: Roussanne Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: This wine has an intriguing flavor profile, with a complex mix of sour lemon drop and a hint of butterscotch, with sage and earth adding yet other dimensions. Drink now. 140 cases made.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: Offers a tight core of pepper-laced dark berry, hot brick, game and cedar, ending with firm, cleansing tannins. Drink now through 2019. 9,918 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Alisos Vineyard Single Vineyard Selection
review: Complex, if on a modest scale, with ripe red cherry, plum and wild berry fruit that turns earthy, with a touch of sage, dusty berry and espresso on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Hillside Estate
review: Offers cherry-berry notes, with a meaty edge, before turning tannic. Best from 2000 through 2006. 1,400 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Reserve
review: Smooth, ripe and supple, with pretty cherry, berry and strawberry flavors. Holds its fruitiness, finishing mildly tannic. Drink now through 2004. 1,850 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Purisima Mountain Vineyard Single Vineyard Selection
review: Smooth, with a pretty display of mocha, boysenberry, blackberry and wild berry, with floral overtones and a trim finish that's mildly tannic. Drink now through 2009. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Sierra Madre Reserve
review: Crisp and lively, with a nice zing of lemon, apple and grapefruit flavors that hint at toast and honey on the finish. Drink now.

name: Los Olivos Cuvée Santa Ynez Valley
review: A ripe, zesty style, with spicy cherry, wild berry, sage, strawberry and herbal scents that are supple and refreshing, with lots of fruit flavors to admire. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now. 525 cases made.

name: Roussanne Edna Valley Alban Vineyard
review: Floral and grapey aromas lead to a complex, concentrated young wine, with restrained flavors of lichti, quince and bosc pear. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Roussanne Edna Valley Alban Vineyard
review: Clean and refreshing, with lively pear, spice, rose petal and citrus flavors of moderate depth and complexity. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Syrah Arroyo Grande Valley Rancho Arroyo Grande Vineyard Single Vineyard Selection
review: Firm and tight, with a core of spicy, beefy wild berry flavors that are well-proportioned, showing good tannic structure on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 120 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Firm and intense, with spicy white pepper, dried currant and stewed plum flavors that offer enough depth and complexity to hold your interest. Drink now through 2008. 2,000 cases made.

name: Viognier Santa Barbara County Ibarra-Young Vineyard
review: Ripe and floral, with apricot, vanilla and buttery peach notes. Drink now through 2001. 200 cases made.

name: Los Olivos Cuvée Santa Barbara County
review: Hearty and full-bodied, with a smooth texture and an earthy edge to the generous plum, cherry and spice aromas and flavors. Has a murky feel and vegetal overtones that are not so appealing, but has the style and substance to age well. 60 percent Syrah and 40 percent Mourvèdre. Drink now through 1995.

name: Los Olivos Cuvée Santa Ynez Valley
review: Supple, refreshing and elegant, with pretty red cherry, cranberry and strawberry scents of modest proportions. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now. 1,400 cases made.

name: Marsanne Santa Ynez Valley
review: Tangy citrus, peach and pineapple flavors have good intensity, with apple cider and spice accents. Finishes with bitter-almond notes and a raw texture. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: A firm, taut wine, with an earthy clay flavor at the core, with meat, beef and just-ripe berry flavors. Drink now through 2007. 8,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard Y Block
review: Simple. Spicy pear, melon and apple flavors that are clean, with a floral edge. Drink now. 4,400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay-Viognier Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Cuvée
review: A curious blend of two grapes--the spiciness of Viognier with the body of Chardonnay--with hints of tangerine and pear. Drink now through 2003. 700 cases made.

name: Roussanne Edna Valley Alban Vineyard
review: Offers complexity with its range of rose petal, citrus and nectarine, turning a bit soapy on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 300 cases made.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: The core of meaty cherry and plum flavors shows off a slight candied edge, finishing with firm tannins. Drink now through 1999. 6,100 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Reserve
review: A bit austere, with lively acidity that shows ripe currant, mineral and berry fruit, but never really gets into deeper flavors. Drink now through 2005. 1,750 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Colson Canyon Vineyard Single Vineyard Selection
review: A beef stew of a Syrah, with beef carpaccio, white pepper and dried berry flavors forming the core flavors, ending with a dry austerity. Drink now through 2008. 72 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Hillside Estate
review: Austere, though there are attractive cherry and wild berry flavors on the lean frame that are pleasing. Drink now through 2005. 840 cases made.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: Lacks focus and defined fruit, with some tart, leafy dried berry and plum flavors. Drink now through 2004. 8,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Hillside Estate
review: Intense, yet somewhat restrained in its delivery of fruit, with ripe cherry and berry notes that bow down to some chewy tannins, ending with a clipped aftertaste. Drink now. 1,050 cases made.

name: Viognier Santa Ynez Valley Ibarra-Young Vineyard
review: Dilute, with tart Granny Smith, lime skin and green papaya notes wrapped up in zingy acidity. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Viognier Santa Ynez Valley Ibarra-Young Vineyard
review: A flinty style that shows a strong citrusy character, with floral lemon-lime flavors served up on a beam. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Bien Nacido Cuvée Santa Barbara County
review: Simple and uncomplicated, with flavors of pear, spice, honey and oak. A blend of Chardonnay and Viognier that does little to benefit either wine.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Sierra Madre Reserve
review: A very easy-to-like wine. Rich, ripe and exuberantly fruity in flavor, with a smooth, soft texture and lingering aftertaste.

name: Marsanne Santa Barbara County Los Olivos Vineyard
review: Broad, soft and gentle, not distinctive, a solid but uneventful white. 1,500 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Distinctive, robust and ripe. Extremely dark in color, peppery and gamey in flavor, with smoke, anise and black cherry notes to add complexity. Moderately tannic, but soft in structure. Drink now through 1993.

name: Marsanne Santa Ynez Valley
review: Light style and body, with modest pear and apple flavors. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard Single Vineyard Selection
review: Trim band of black cherry, herb and snappy green beans are tight, compact and tangy. Drink now. 3,600 cases made.

name: Viognier Santa Barbara County Ibarra-Young Vineyard
review: Ripe, with a slightly bitter edge to the spicy pear and hazelnut flavors.

name: Los Olivos Cuvée Santa Barbara County
review: Simple and not quite ripe, with a tart, green edge to the meaty berry and leathery flavors. Syrah and Mourvèdre.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: Not as rich and powerful as many other Syrahs, but well-crafted and lively on the palate, a nice red wine but not particularly distinctive.

name: Viognier Santa Ynez Valley Ibarra-Young Vineyard
review: Tart, with a sour lemon drop candy note and a mix of wax and sage notes. 230 cases made.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: Concentrated, silky, with lots of smoke, mint and meaty aromas, opening up to ripe cherry and berry flavors, turning lean and almost austere on the finish.

name: Marsanne Santa Ynez Valley
review: A bit tart and simple, with a narrow strand of citrus and lime. 680 cases made.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: An earthy, gamy, leathery style that veers toward dirty sour berry flavors.   19,000 cases made.
